loans.name: Islomdjon

texts.en:
Islomdjon is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

Islomdjon works in the central city market selling shoes and clothing for teenagers. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for three years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city for purchasing new goods. Islomdjon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family.

Today Islomdjon would like to ask for a loan of $2500 to purchase new clothing and shoes to sell. We believe his drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Islomdjon’s business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 48 years old, married, and he has 3 children. His youngest child is 5 years old. His children are still young and they attend school. His wife sells hair extensions to help support their household. Amos loves his family very much and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. 

Amos is in a unique business: he is a key fabricator. He has a machine that he uses to fabricate keys for his customers. The demand for his services is high and he hopes to purchase an additional machine. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase a machine to fabricate keys. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to fabricate keys

loans.name: Holiyor

texts.ru: Хаиткулов Холиёр проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Холиёр занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает и продает оващи. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Холиёр хочет получить хороший урожай. Для этого ему нужна внасить в почву удобрения. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Holiyor H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 41 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Holiyor is involved in agriculture. He grows and sells vegetables. His wife helps him with this business. Holiyor wants to get a good harvest and needs to treat the soil with fertilizers. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 23-year-old married woman. She is a happy woman and she is always filled with joy when her customers purchase her goods. She has a child and her child is 3 years old.

Joy sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for five years. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joy has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara hails from Esan in Edo State but resides with her family in Benin City, Nigeria. She is 61 years old, is married and has eight children. Some of her children are married while some are still in school.

Clara sells tailoring materials and sarongs to make a living after her retirement as a civil servant. With the busy nature of her business she is happy seeing herself still useful to her family and able to contribute her share to the home as a wife and a mother. She does this to support her husband who is also a retired officer who has little or no income to support the family.

Clara hopes to expand her business in future. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Karia

texts.en:
Karia is a 42 year old man who has been running a farm near Kitale, Kenya, for the past ten years. He used to sell charcoal, but over time he became involved in the timber business and then finally settled on farming maize, tomatoes, and peas, which he sells at the local markets. He still works occasionally in the timber business when he is available, but that is only a minor source of income for him these days. He requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 40,000 to start a poultry farming business.

Karia is married with four children, ages 5, 8, 14, and 18 years old, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. It is hoped that the extra income from this loan will increase the family's overall well being and assist in paying the children's school fees. He wants to provide a comfortable life for his family so they do not need to constantly worry about finances.

In the future, Karia wants to purchase a vehicle so he can easily transport farm produce to market. He is hopeful for the future, and said that so far Juhudi Kilimo has provided a beneficial relationship. He is eager to maintain in contact with the organization and hopes to provide additional feedback on his progress throughout the course of the loan.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en:
Bukky is a beautiful and hardworking woman. She sells sarongs and clothes at retail prices to her customers, selling daily to make her business sustainable. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to own an African boutique in the future where she will sell only African fabrics.

Bukky hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She is itching for business expansion.

Bukky is 32 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells building materials to also support their home. Her eldest child is 9 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Monsieur Malick S. est un habitant de la localité de Camberene, sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Depuis 2 ans il gère une quincaillerie ou la vente de ciment est prédominante. Monsieur S. a démarré  ses activistes commerciales avec la fabrication de brique. Il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son activité. L’augmentation de ses revenus lui promettra de mieux gerber ses charges familiales. Monsieur S. est un homme marie et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Malick S. lives in the village of Camberene and is a shareholder-member of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese mutual loans and savings institution association) savings bank; he has never had a credit from the bank before. For the past two years he has been managing a hardware store which predominantly sells cement. Mr. S. began his commercial activities by making bricks. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs in order to strengthen his business. The increase in his income will allow him to manage his family expenses better. Mr. S. is a married man with two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en:
Ramota is a beautiful and hardworking woman. She sells sarongs at retail prices to her customers and sells daily to make her business sustainable. Her customers A. usually friends and residents. She hopes to own a boutique in the future where she will sell only African fabrics.

Ramota hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is itching for business expansion.

Ramota is 58 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. Ramota duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín  Hernández B.  tiene 41 y vive en el barrio Nuevo Milenio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus hijos; es allí donde tiene su pequeño negocio de vender calzado y simultáneamente de  remontarlos porque conoce el arte y también ofrece este servicio.
 Desde muy pequeño su madre, mujer cabeza de familia, le enseño a negociar  y  esa es hoy su más grande experiencia; Joaquin, trae calzado económico  desde la Guajira y lo comercializa a través de 4 vendedores ambulantes  él y su cónyuge  que también trabaja en el negocio, desde su casa en un local contiguo. En este, su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo está aplicando por un valor de $1.500.000, el cual invertirá en la compra de calzado deportivo que tiene encargado  por  clientes a través de sus vendedores.
Joaquín dice, que su madre le enseñó a perder la pena en la calle  desde muy pequeño, cuando lo mandaba a vender todo lo que se le ocurriera, para ayudarla a sufragar los gastos de su familia y eso lo considera su mejor experiencia, porque lo llevó a pensar en ser independiente y con su negocio compró la casa donde vive, pudo acceder a créditos con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo y con ello adecuar un local, comprar vitrinas de exhibición  y hacer rendir su capital de trabajo.
 Como Joaquín es un hombre de grandes sueños que pertenece a una congregación cristiana, quiere que todos en la iglesia tengan fuentes de empleo, por eso su meta es extender su negocio  en zonas no abordadas, para lo cual  va a requerir de vendedores, así ayudaría a que sus hermanos de congregación que no tienen empleo  generen sus propios ingresos.  
Su desafío mas grande es cuando se presentan problemas de salud en su familia, es ahí donde algunas veces se han visto afectados sus ingresos, porque es un excelente miembro de familia, pero persiste en su negocio y es muy responsable por eso siempre sale adelante.
texts.en:
Joaquín Hernández B., 41, lives in the Nuevo Milenio de Soledad neighborhood with his wife and children; he has a small, shoe sales and repair shop. From a very early age, his mother, who was head of household, taught him how to negotiate; this is his greatest experience to date. Joaquin brings low-cost shoes from La Guajira and sells them via four traveling salespeople, himself and his wife, who also works in the business located next-door to their home. This is his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; it's valued at $1.500.000 which will be used to buy athletic shoes for which his salespeople already have orders placed. Joaquín says that his mother taught him not to be shy in the streets when he was very young and she would send him out to sell all kinds of things to help her meet family expenses; he considers this to be the best experience because it taught him to be independent. His business made it possible for him to buy his house, he was able to get loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that allowed him to set up a shop, to buy display cases and to help his working capital go farther. Because Joaquín is a man with big dreams who is part of a Christian community, he wants all his fellow church members to have jobs. This is why he wants to extend his business into areas not currently served for which he will need salespeople. This way he intends to help his congregation's brothers who don't have jobs to produce their own earnings. His greatest challenge is when health problems arise in his family; this is when his income is adversely affected because he's an excellent member of the family. However, he is consistent in his work and is very responsible; this is why he always gets ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 41 years old, married with five children, aged between 1 and 13 years old. Julie and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Julie makes a living selling a small quantity of soft drinks (juice) and some cakes in her small shop in order to earn the daily food of her family. The hours of her business are from 6 AM until late in the evening hours.

Julie has an idea of expanding her shop through adding a variety of drinks such as sodas and many kinds of juice plus food supplies such as cookies, cakes, etc... To this end, she would like to request a Kiva Loan via Vision Finance Company. Once she gets this loan, she hopes that by purchasing a variety of soft drinks and food supplies, her customers will increase as well as the profits. With these profits, she will of course use one portion taking care of her family then the other portion will be used in keeping up the sustainability of her business.

loans.use: Additional soft drinks and some food supplies for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester was born in 1966 and is a widow with 9 children aged between 6 and 20. Ester lives in the Nyabihu district, in the western province of Rwanda, approximately 3 hours from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. This place is a tourist region where Lake Kivu is located.

Ester owns a small business selling the soft drinks (SODA); this business is profitable simply because of the number of tourists in this region. Ester works hard in order to get all basic needs for her family.  Ester is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more soft drinks for sale. 

With this loan, Ester will be able to earn more profits which will be used to reinvest in her business as well as for feeding her children. The hours of her shop are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day except on Saturday, since 2007. Ester does not get time to socialize with her family, simply because she is the only breadwinner for her family.

loans.use: Additional soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Alikalie

texts.en:
Alikalie is married with two children and five dependents.  His wife is also a businesswoman.  He has been in business for about five years.  He owns a shop that is located by the Ferry Terminal in Freetown, where he sells drinks and provisions.  He spends most of his time in the shop, helped at times by his younger brother who stays with him.

Adikalie is seeking a loan to help him acquire more stock, thereby increasing his profit.  He hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to care for his family's daily needs. He also plans to expand his shop.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass K. is a businessman who sells cosmetics and hair products.  He owns a store that is located in a market commonly known as Portee market in Freetown.  He is married with three children.  Over the years his business has grown from a small table to that of a shop that he now owns.

Knowing that with more capital his profit will be increased, Abass is seeking a loan to add to his present capital to buy more stock, and make more profit that will enable him to respond to his family's needs.

Abass is a client with a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair products to sell.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en:
Kadijatu B. is a single mother with two kids. She separated from her husband some years ago.  She has four dependents other than her children staying with her. She rents a shop in a market area called Fire Burn in Freetown, and sells textiles.

In the early stages of her business career she started off by selling confections, but because the profit was small she then went into textiles and has been in it for five years now.

Kadijatu intends to buy more stock and use the proceeds from this loan to care for her family and grow her capital.

loans.use: To buy more textiles to sell

loans.name: Abies

texts.en:
Abies owns a cosmetics shop where she sells items like powder, body creams, bathing soap, olive oil and more. She also sells beads which are used to beautify oneself after being dressed for an occasion or a normal outing, especially for the ladies in this part of the country.

Due to high patronage, Abies wants to stock her shop with more goods as this attracts more customers and increases sales. She hopes for loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and beads to sell.

Abies is 38 years old and is married with four children; they live in Benin City, Nigeria. Her youngest child is 3 years old and she is in school. Abies’ dream is to give her husband all the financial support that he needs to educate the children to the university level. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and beads to sell

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
Sadiatu started business twenty years ago as a fish monger.  After ten years hawking fish around the town, she was allotted space in the main market by the town council.

She gets her supply of ice fish from a local cold room in the town.  Her main problem has been preserving the fish. She normally buys ice in the evening to preserve unsold stock but this is costly and eats deep into her profit.

She wants a loan so that she can fix up a small cold room and source her stock directly from the fishing company. That will help increase her profit margin.

Sadiatu is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: To fix up a cold room to store fish.

loans.name: C2136 Abaticumugambi Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old, married with 3 children aged between 2 and 8. Vestine and her family live in the Gasabo district, Kigali province, in a village called Kabuga where her business is located.

Vestine owns a small business selling green bananas in her region which is a very important business because it is profitable. Vestine is the leader of a group which contains 5 members; all of them are women except one; all of them have the same business. Vestine who is the leader has an experience of 3 years in this field but her seed money is not enough to attract customers by having more green bananas. Now Vestine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more green bananas to sell. With this loan Vestine hopes to earn more profits which will allow her to sort out some family problems.

loans.use: additional green bananas for sale

loans.name: Joseph M.

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old, married, and he has two children.  He is a welder and his wife is a petty trader dealing in assorted soft drinks. Joseph left school in form 4 as a dropout.  He has been a welder for the last ten years.  He worked for a boss who trained him in welding for eight years. Two years ago, Joseph decided to establish his own metal workshop.

He said that the demand for metal doors and windows has increased over the years because of the upsurge of armed robberies.  He is not able to meet all the orders placed by customers because he is limited by inadequate working capital and too little equipment.  That is the main reason why Joseph needs the loan.  

He wants to buy more machines, welding equipment and materials so as to increase his production. If he is successful, he wants to erect his own house. Joseph is very enthusiastic and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy machines and welding equipment

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed J. is a hairdresser and a dealer in cosmetics. Born in 1969, he is married with four children. 

Mohamed has a small beauty salon and cosmetic shop along one of the busiest streets in the town.  He has two female trainees in the salon and more people are asking him to train them in hairdressing. He has a plan to rent a bigger space so that he can help them. 

In fact that is why he needs the loan. Mohamed believes that hairdressing can provide employment for a good number of youths and he wants to help in that direction.

He is very hopeful and believes that his vocation is profitable and can help him to realize his dreams in the near future.

loans.use: To rent a larger space for training

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a 38-year-old married man with three children, two of whom attend school.  He has a produce shop in Kawangware in Nairobi.  He sells oranges, tomatoes and bananas.  He has been in this business for four years and he feels that his business has expanded and improved since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges and bananas.  He hopes to be very competitive in this business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of produce

loans.name: Icyubahiro Group

texts.en:
Assia is 32 years old and she is single.  Assia is the president of a group called 'Icyubahiro'.  This group consists of 3 people who operate businesses selling clothes in Rwamagana, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  This is their 6th successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from 8 AM until 6PM every day.

Assia and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing a variety of clothing styles (for babies and children, men and women).  With this business expansion, this group hopes to attract more customers as well as increase sales.  If this is successful, Assia and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to reinvest in their business in order to keep the progress of their business as well as building a secure future for each member's family.

loans.use: Additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay off debts

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old, married to Monica Wangari and has two school-going children.  He has been doing farming for the last nine years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy more seedlings to plant and also get a water pipe which he will use to sprinkle his plants with water.  Naivasha does not have consistent rainfalls so the farmers here depend on irrigation.

He also wants to venture into dairy farming in future.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings and a water pipe.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou S. est un tailleur qui habite dans la localité  de Camberene. Il exerce cette activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis aout 2002 et  a déjà rembourse 7 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs .L’objectif de ce crédit est l’achat d’une seconde machine à coudre dans le but de rendre plus performante son activiste de couturier et par conséquent d’accroitre sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses de survie de sa famille. Monsieur S. est marie et père de 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou S. is a tailor who lives in the village of Camberene. He has been carrying out this acitivity for more than 30 years. Since August 2002 he has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank in Camberene which belongs to the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual loans and savings institutions), and he has already repaid seven previous loans. He is applying for a loan of 250,000 francs. The purpose of this loan is to buy a second sewing machine in order to make his sewing activity more productive and thereby enlarge his customer base. The increase in his profits will allow him to cover his family's living expenses more easily. Mr. S. is married with five children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 39 years old, married to Teresiah Wambui and has two school-going children.  He has been in dairy farming for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his next loan after paying his first loan of Kshs 50,000 well and on time.  He plans to use proceeds from this loan to buy another dairy cow to increase his milk production.

Paul also has plans to venture into real estate in future, by buying a piece of land and building houses for rent.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en: Minkailu, who deals in used clothes and shoes, started his business in 1995 during the war as a displaced person.  After the civil war, he returned back to his home town and continued with the same business.  He is married with five children.  Life has not been easy for him, but he has been able to maintain his business and this will be his third loan with ARD.  He wants to increase his working capital so as to vary his stock and increase sales.  His main focus is to keep his children at school with the proceeds of his business.  He has a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy used shoes

loans.name: Abasaruzi Group

texts.en:
Esther is 24 years old and she is still single.  Esther is the president of a group called 'Abasaruzi' and this group is widely known in the business of selling second-hand clothes.  They operate their business in the Rwamagana market, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  Their business hours are from 8 AM until late in the evening hours.

Esther and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through purchasing a variety of additional clothing styles.  Through the use of this loan, Esther and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will be used in the further reinvestment in their business.  The savings from additional profits which are not reinvested in their business will allow them to build a secure future for their families.

loans.use: Additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia W. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, vive en una casa de cemento. Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos uno de 25 y otro de 8 años.

Hace ya 2 años empezó con la venta de plásticos cuando uno de sus familiares le incentivo vender a sus vecinos tarrinas, lavacaras, sillas etc.

Ahora ella tiene en casa su negocio en donde vende todo tipo de plásticos. Trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es salir a ofrecer sus productos con la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, tarrinas, lavacaras para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya un local donde ofrecer mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Cecilia W. is 45 years old. She lives in the outskirts of the city on the Perimetral de Guayaquil. She lives in a cement house. She is a single mother of two children; one is 25 and the other is 8. Two years ago, she began to sell plastic products when a relative gave her an incentive to sell plastic containers, tubs, chairs, etc. She now has a business in her home where she sells all types of plastic products. She works from 9:00 am until 9:00 pm every day. One of the problems she has is going out to sell her products with the crime in the area where she lives. With the loan she wants to buy chairs, containers, and tubs for her business. In the future, she wants to have a locale where she can better offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONTAINERS, TUBS, CHAIRS

loans.name: Venant

texts.en:
Venant is 34 years old, married with one child who is 14 years old.  Venant and his small family live in the Kicukiro district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Venant has been selling a variety of clothing styles since 2008 and the hours of his business are from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

Venant needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing many trousers and women's clothes, as they are highly demanded in his business.  With this loan, Venant hopes to increase his sales as well as his profits.  Those profits will be used in the further reinvestment of his business as well as taking care of his family.

loans.use: Addtional clothes for sale

loans.name: C2135 Omega Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 36 years old, married with three children aged between 4 and 12. Innocent and his family live in the Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, not far from  international airport of Rwanda.

Innocent is group representative ( OMEGA in local language) and his group contains 5 people; three are men  and two are women. Although Innocent is the leader he also has his own shop which sells different kinds of products such as rice, salt, sugar,  beans, and so on.  Innocent’s wife is also a business woman. Both work hard for their family. Innocent is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various products for his shop which will allow him to earn more profits. With extra profits Innocent needs to save money for his future and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Additional products for sale

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old, married with 5 children who are aged between 3 and 12 years old.  Chantal and her family live in Rwamagana, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  Chantal has been in the business of sewing various styles of clothes (for children, men and women).  Chantal starts her work from 8 AM and continues until late in the evening hours.

After 17 years in this profession, Chantal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase some additional sewing machines and clothing items.  With these additional sewing machines, Chantal will create more jobs for the people from her community and in addition, her profits will increase improving the standard of living  for her family.  Through her business expansion, Chantal will also be able to save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: Additional sewing machines and some sewing items

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 33 year old man married to a primary school teacher looking after five people in his home stead. He dreams of constructing a modern home for his family. His business interests are butchery and car washing in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has ten years of experience in butchery and four years in car washing. Before doing all that, he was a luggage carrier in Kampala, Uganda’s capital city. He then worked in some one else’s butchery before starting his own using small credit. He believes with more credit from Hofokam he will be able to transform his car washing bay into a modern one.  The  purpose of this loan is to buy cows for his butchery for selling as beaf.

loans.use: cows for selling as beaf

loans.name: Sarah Kaija

texts.en: Sarah is a 39 year old single mother of three children and the bread winner in her family. She stays and does her business in Fort portal Uganda selling clothes, shoes, blankets and children wear.  She started as a hawker of clothes then rented premises jointly with her sister but with the help of the Hofokam loan, she managed to get her own full premises in which she operates alone.  Her dream is to whole sale clothes, shoes, blankets and children wear to retailers. she used the loan to pay school fees for the children and added more clothes, shoes and children wear stock in her business.

loans.use: paying school fess and purchasing cothes, shoes and children wear

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 28 years old and is single but he takes care of two dependent relatives, the first being 20 years old and the second being 22 years old. Ernest lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Gatsata. One of the family works as a teacher in the primary school and another is a nurse in a hospital. The dependents, even if are old enough, don’t have jobs which can give them monthly incomes, the reason why they are in Ernest’s charge.

Ernest owns a small shop selling different kinds of products such as cooking oil, rice, beer, soft drinks, and so on. He has been in this business since 2003, ensuring that he has enough experience in this field.

The reason why Ernest is requesting a loan is for the purpose of expanding his business because it is profitable. With this loan he will be able to earn more profits which will help him to solve his problems and save money for a secure future.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: L. Juliette est née le 25 mai 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a 10 ans que Juliette habite au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou.  Juliette est mariée à DOSSOU-YOVO Alfred, un entrepreneur retraité.  Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est encore à sa charge.  Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Juliette n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Juliette vend des produits divers (riz, conserves, farine de manioc, sucre, savons en poudre, huile d’arachide, pâtes alimentaire, etc.) dans sa boutique.   Juliette exerce cette activité depuis 32 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Juliette a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Juliette sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.  Juliette ambitionne plus tard réaménager sa boutique et faire une caisse à étagère vitrée dans laquelle elle pourra exposer les produits cosmétiques pour la vente.
texts.en:
L. Juliette was born on May 25, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou for ten years.  She is married to DOSSOU-YOVO Alfred, a retired entrepreneur.  The couple have five children, who have all had schooling.  One of the children is still in their care.  Juliette lives together with her husband and child. And the couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Juliette attended primary school only.  To provide for herself, she sells a variety of goods (rice, canned foods, cassava flour, sugar, soap powder, peanut oil, pasta, etc.) in her shop.  She has been in this business for 32 years and gets he supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.  She's requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers further.  Juliette's ambition for later on is to fix up her shop and to make a glass case with shelving in which she'll be able to display her cosmetics for sale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanut oil, rice, charcoal, canned foods, milk, and powdered milk

loans.name: Esmilce Jamileth

texts.es: Esmilce de 30 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como Medico General Asistencial desde hace 4 años  en el Hospital de Nueva Guinea, vive en su casa junto a sus sus padres y demas familiares, a pesar de ser joven y no tener hijos es muy responsable, pues apoya a sus padres en lo mas que puede con los gastos de la casa. Está solicitando su 3er crèdito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, poniendole el piso y repellando su habitacion y contar con mejores condiciones. Esmilce se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, actualmente esta estudiando su segunda  carrera en la Universidad Martin Lutero Recinto Nueva Guinea ya que desea ser una gran profesional. Ella se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es  tener salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Esmilce is 30 years old. She is single and has worked as a General Medical Assistant for four years in the Hospital de Nueva Guinea. She lives at home with her parents and other family members. Despite her youth and not having children, she is very responsible. She supports her parents as much as she can with the household expenses. She is asking for her 3rd loan to invest in improving her housing, putting in a floor and re-plastering her room and have better conditions. Esmilce is a very responsible, honest, hardworking woman who is much loved by her co-workers. Presently she is getting her second degree from the Universidad Martin Lutero Recinto Nueva Guinea since she wants to be a great professional. She is grateful to the AFODENIC Institution since with the previous loans she has bought appliances and has improved her housing. Her dream is to be healthy and have steady employment.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconditioning her room, re-plastering and flooring.

loans.name: C2348 Abahuzarugwiro Group

texts.en:
Florence was born in 1974 and is married with six children aged from 2 to 12 years. She and her family live in the Gasabo district, Kigali province, in the region called Kabuga.

Florence owns a small business in the market selling cassava flour. Her husband has no job and that is the reason why Florence works hard to provide all the needs of her family.

Florence is the leader of a group called Abahuzarugwiro in the local language; this group contains eight members. Each member has a different business such as timber and foodstuffs. As all of them are women, they work hard in order to resolve their particular problems.

Florence, who is the leader, has two years experience. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to four in the evening every day, even during the weekend. Right now, Florence’s seed money is not enough to attract more customers and this is the reason why she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more cassava flour.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en:
Cesarie is 28 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 4 years old. She and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Cesarie is a proven entrepreneur wholesaling cartons of clean water and hygiene paper. She has been in this business for about twelve years. She is very enthusiastic about her business because it helps in her daily life. Her business hours are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Cesarie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. She plans to add to the quantity of her existing business and also add a new business wholesaling some cosmetics products including soaps, body lotions, etc.

If this plan is successful, Cesarie will hopefully earn more profits than with her previous business. With these profits, she will use one portion for further reinvestment in her business and the other portion will be used in building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her business and for a new wholesale business

loans.name: Women In Need Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Women in Need' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their business inventories. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding and clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Sallay C. (pictured 3rd from left) is the leader of this group. She is approximately 40 years old. She was born in Makeni and is married with 5 children. 3 of her children are attending secondary school and 2 in primary school. For many years now, Sallay has been selling rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of the loan, Sallay will buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco was born in 1978. He is married and does not have his own children but he does take care of four dependents who are relatives aged between 3 and 12. He lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Jean Bosco is a man of great ability in the business of sewing clothes; his business is well known and organized, which is an advantage for him. He employs one person in his business as a helper so that his business runs smoothly. This is his third year of successful operation in this business. The hours of his business are from seven in the morning to six in the evening every day except Saturday.

Jean Bosco is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a new sewing machine and some clothing items. With the new machine and clothing items, he will be able to serve more customers on time and he also hopes that his profits will be increased.

Jean Bosco expects to earn more profits which in turn will be used for reinvestment in his business and for building a secure future for himself.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and some clothing items

loans.name: Humberto Javier

texts.es: Humberto Javier de 40 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Alba Marina Garcia, con quien tiene una niña de nombre Javiera Nazaret de 8 años de edad estudiando 3er grado de primaria.   Ademas tiene otro hijo producto de su primer matrimonio llamado Leo David de 16 años de edad a quien apoya economicamente.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para la construccion de los servicios higienicos de su casa, pues el anterior se esta deteriorando. Cabe señalar que don Humberto con su credito anterior reparo parte del techo de su casa que se encontraba en mal estado, aunque hasta ahora sera beneficiado con el fondo kiva, expresa que solo con los creditos  es que los asalariados pueden mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto Javier is 40 years old and married to Mrs. Alba Marina Garcia. They have an 8 year old daghter, Javiera Nazaret, who is in third grade. He also has a 16 year old son from his first marriage named Leo David whom he supports financially. He is asking for his second loan to build a bathroom for his house, as the previous one is deteriorating. It should be noted that Mr. Humberto used his previous loan to repair the roof of his house that was in bad shape. The benefits of Kiva along with the loans allow him to improve his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'In God We Trust'. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families' well-being. 

Alpha Y. K. pictured on the left is the leader of this group. Alpha was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. The 55-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have 4 children. Three of his children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. For 15 years now, Alpha has been selling different types of bags – traveling bags, school bags, etc. With his share of the loan, Alpha will buy dozens of bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy dozens of bags to add to his business

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es: Arnoldo S. Sauceda, cuenta con 25 años de edad, Soltero vive con su familia materna, lleva 8 años elaborando antojitos, debido a que necesita de más ingreso, se acercó a la asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprar una carreta para la venta de productos alimenticios ya que en el lugar donde vende hay mucha demanda, debido a esa circunstancia el decidió aprovechar ese recurso para poder crear otra fuente de trabajo y continuar generando más ingresos y así también poder cambiar sus condiciones de vida tanto como la de él y como la de su familia.
texts.en:
Arnoldo S. S. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his maternal family. He has been making snacks for the past 8 years. Because he needs more income, he approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to be able to purchase a cart to sell his food products, since there is a lot of demand in the area where he sells. As a result of his circumstance, he decided to take advantage of this resource to be able to create another source of work and continue to generate more income so that he can also change the living conditions of both him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart for fast food

loans.name: Cecilia Juanita

texts.en:
Cecilia Juanita is 40 years old and lives in Guayaquil with her husband and five children, ages 16, 12, 9, 7, and 3. Cecilia`s house is made of cement and has electricity and water only. Her husband is in the military and all of her children are in school.

Cecilia started out with a small store in her house selling drinks. At the time, her father-in-law was selling shoes and gave her a few pairs to try selling in her store. Cecilia did well selling shoes and so decided to sell them exclusively. With previous loans she was able to rent a space on a main street to sell her shoes, and her revenue consequently increased. Two difficulties of Cecilia´s work are the delinquency of some clients and the fact that she has to work alone sometimes.

With the loan, Cecilia is going to buy boots to increase the inventory of her store. She would like to one day have more stores to sell shoes and would like to use the extra income to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy boots for her business

loans.name: Apu Anta Killka Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU ANTA KILLKA”, ellos están ubicados en el distrito de Chinchero a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a socios que se dedican íntegramente a la artesanía casi el 70%, otros son guías de turismo en la zona, tenemos 2 profesoras, uno de los socios es albañil, otro socio carpintero, otra socia vende comida y otra vende salchipapas.  Nuestra socia es la Sra Celsa A., ella tiene 3 hijos y es casada, su esposo es albañil, la socia tiene una tienda de artesanía cerca a la plaza antigua de chinchero, nuestra socia tiene planeado agruparse con otros artesanos y en este grupo ellos darán alojo a los turistas, están realizando el turismo vivencial participativo en la zona de chinchero, tiene a guías de turismo que hablan ingles y explican a los visitantes sobre las costumbres de la zona, los tejidos, artesanía de la zona y la gastronomía, ellos darán hospedaje a los visitantes en sus respectivas casas entonces están implementando todo y también incrementando sus productos para implementar sus negocios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de artesanía y mejorar su vivienda, para recibir a turistas en su casa y hospedarlos con todas las comodidades posibles.

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the Apu Anta Killka communal bank. They live in the Chinchero district, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The group members work in retail sales. Among the bank members, 70% of the members work completely in handicrafts, others are tour guides in the area, two are teachers, one is a builder, another is a carpenter, another sells food and another sells salchipapas. Celsa A. has 3 children and she is married. Her husband is a builder and she has a handicraft shop near the former plaza of Chinchero. She plans to join together with other artisans and among them, they will provide lodging to tourists. They are active in homestay tourism in the Chinchero area – they have tour guides that speak English and explain the area customs, weavings, handicrafts and gastronomy to the visitors. They will provide lodging for the visitors in their respective homes, thus implementing everything and increasing their products to set up their businesses. Celsa is requesting a loan to set up her handicraft shop and make housing improvements so that she can receive tourists in her home and house them with all of the possible commodities.

All of the group members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make their loan repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her handicraft and homestay tourism business

loans.name: Diodio

texts.fr: Madame Diodio D. est une femme de 51 ans ouakamois, qui est sociétaire depuis seulement un an. Elle très connue dans le commerce et la vente de fruits. C’est une activité qu’elle a exerce pendant 15 ans. Elle est parent bénéficiaire, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son statut de soutient de famille lui a donne l’idée de s’activer dans une activité qui peut lui générer des profits. Ce qui l’intéresse surtout dans cette occupation c’est la rapidité de la vente. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat des produits vendus. Son objectif est d’accroitre sa capacité de vente et de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Diodio D. is a 51 year old woman from Ouakam who has been a member for only a year.  She is well-known in commerce and for selling fruit.  She has been in this business for fifteen years.  She is a recipient parent, married, and the mother of eight children.  Her status as breadwinner inspired her to be active in work that can generate profits for her.  What is most interesting to her in this occupation is the rate of sales.  Diodio is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for buying the products she sells.  Her goal is to increase her sales capacity and to diversify her products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Juan Agustín

texts.es: El señor Juan Agustín V. C., cuenta con 53 años de edad, casado, vive con su propia familia, en la actualidad Don Juan  tiene el oficio de Artesanía “Elaboración de cortes típicos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder sufragar unos gastos personales que se presento, el poder comprar unos bienes, de esa pequeña ayuda el podrá mejorar su condición de vida, como también podrá aumentar los bienes que le corresponde, para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan Agustín V. C. is 53 years old, married, and lives with his own family. Juan currently has the job of making traditional clothing. He approached Asociación ASDIR for a small loan to be able to defray some personal costs and be able to purchase a few goods. With this small help, he will be able to both improve his living conditions and increase the goods he owns so that his family is not lacking anything.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (purchase of raw material)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: House construction

loans.name: Marcia De Jesus

texts.es: Marcia de 37 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Wilber Duarte, con quien procreo 2 hijos, Wilber de 7 años estudiando el 2do credo y una bebita de 20 meses de nombre Milagros.  Marcia trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa desde hace 13 años como enfermera, su esposo tambien es enfermero pero trabaja en el Centro de Salud de Santo Domingo.  Esta solicitando su 9no credito y espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva, pues desea poner la ceramica a la sala de su casa, ya que actualmente es embaldozada, y como la bebé esta en la edad de jugar en el piso desea lo mas pronto posible ejecutar este pequeño proyecto para evitar enfermedades, y si el dinero lo permite mejorar el baño,  expresa que gracias a los creditos que se le han concedido en esta institucion ha ido mejorando poco a poco su casa, construyendo su cocina y poniendole ceramica a los cuartos y al comedor.
texts.en:
Marcia is 37 years old and married to Mr. Wilber Duarte, with whom she has two children: 7 year old Wilber, who is in second grade, and a little 20-month daughter named Milagros. Marcia has worked at the Asuncion de Juigalpa Hospital for 13 years as a nurse. Her husband is also a nurse, but he works at the Health Center of Santo Domingo. She is asking for her ninth loan and hopes to be able to rely upon Kiva's support. She wants to tile her living room, and since the baby is of an age to play on the floor she wants to complete this little project as soon as possible to avoid illnesses. If there is money left over, she would like to make improvements to the bathroom. She shares that thanks to the loans provided to her by this institution, she has been improving her house little by little, building a kitchen and tiling the bedrooms and the dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile the living room and improve the bathroom

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 33 year old man married to a primary school teacher looking after five people in his home stead. He dreams of constructing a modern home for his family. His business interests are butchery and car washing in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has ten years of experience in butchery and four years in car washing. Before doing all that, he was a luggage carrier in Kampala, Uganda’s capital city. He then worked in some one else’s butchery before starting his own using small credit. He believes with more credit from Hofokam he will be able to transform his car washing bay into a modern one.  The  purpose of this loan is to buy cows for his butchery for selling as beef.

loans.use: Cows for selling as beef

loans.name: Aminata Tiguidanké

texts.fr: Aminata Tiguidanké DIALO est une femme de 37 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 2003, elle a 13 cycle d'existence dans ledit Banc Villageois. Elle a une boutique à domicile et son prêt lui permet de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises de payer son électricité et de payer également les frais de transport de sa marchandise. Avec ses bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Aminata Tiguidanke Dialo is a 37-year-old married mother of 6. She has been a member of the community bank Velingara Foulbe since 2003. She runs a store from her house, and the loan allows her to better restock her merchandise, pay for her electricity, as well as pay for the shipment of her products. With the profits made, she is able to help her husband take care of the family expenses, as well as take care of her individual needs.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions, wigs and a hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gina Alexandra

texts.en:
Gina Alexandra, 28 years old and living in a cement house with all the basic services in Guayaquil, has two children, ages seven and six, and stopped working when she had the children to take care of them. Since then, however, her husband left her and she is now a single mother selling sandals to earn an income for her family. One difficulty of her work is protecting her store from thieves.

With the loan Gina will buy women´s and children´s sandals to sell in her store. Over time, she would like to grow her business and sell all types of shoes.

loans.use: To buy women´s and children´s sandals

loans.name: Nidia Sabina

texts.es: Nidia Sabina es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues todos los días labora en su vivienda. Porque es aquí donde está ubicado su establecimiento que es una pulpería. Ella inicio este negocio porque anteriormente su Papa se dedica a atender la pulpería con el paso del tiempo el fallece y le hereda la pulpería, pues él no quería que todo el esfuerzo que había realizado se derrumbara fue así que Nidia empezó a hacerse cargo de este medio de vida. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 18 años que está a su cargo pues ella se preocupa en proporcionarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, galletas, detergentes entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Nidia Sabina is a very assiduous woman who works from home, where her general store is located. She got into this business because her father used to own it and after he passed away, she inherited the store because he did not want all his efforts to go to waste. This was how Nidia took charge of the business. She has an 18-year-old son who is under her care, so she is concerned with giving him the necessities. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase candy, juice, other beverages, bread, cookies, and detergent, among other goods. She dreams of launching her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José tiene 44 años, el se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de carpintería, hace mas de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Reynaldo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y para él ha sido muy importante esta oportunidad. Reynaldo es muy famoso en su cuadra por la calidad de sus productos, ya que esto es algo le gusta realizar el se levanta muy temprano, pues si tiene algunos encargos pendientes le gusta entregarlos a tiempo y así mejorar el servicio con sus clientes. Este es el motivo que lo impulsa a realizar este financiamiento con el fin de obtener el capital de trabajo necesario. El sueña con mejorar su vivienda ya que últimamente no ha podido, pues los materiales de construcción son muy caros.
texts.en:
Reynaldo José is a 44-year-old man who has been working as a carpenter for over 13 years. Reynaldo has a strong desire to get ahead in life. He has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time now, and this is an opportunity that has been very important to him. Reynaldo is very well-known on his block because of the quality of his work. Woodworking is something he likes, and he wakes up very early in the morning whenever he has work orders because he likes to deliver them on time, thus improving customer service. He is requesting this loan out of a need for working capital. He dreams of improving his house because he has not been able to do so lately as construction materials are so expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of 4 unemployed children. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years, and with her business she helps her husband with the family income. She owns an agriculture tent where she cultivates all kinds of fruits and vegetables according to the season. And she distributes her harvest to the agriculture market in her village to be sold.

Today, Theresa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance on the agriculture tent in addition to preparing additional tents to increase her harvest and make more profit for her family.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on the agriculture tent in addition to preparing additional tents

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam es una joven de 29 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos, que trabaja mucho para poder sobresalir adelante y poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos.  Solo cuenta con el apoyo de su madre el cual la impulso para que trabajara independiente y pudiera cuidar de sus hijos. Al comienzo palmeaba tortilla ya que su mama tenía un puesto, luego comenzó a comprar productos de cosméticos, ropa y vendía ambulante por las calle de Managua, con las ganancias comenzó hacer nacatamales, vigoron, vaho los fines de semana. Luego opto por financiamiento que logro invertir mas en ropa, zapatos, cosmético en su casa de habitación y con sus ganancia esta haciendo comida, desayuno para la personas que trabajan en zona franca y los fines de semana la venta de nacatamales. Con este préstamo comprara ropa para dama, niños y caballeros, productos cosméticos para seguir aumentando su inventario como mejorar las ganancias ya que solo depende de sus ventas para alimentar  a sus pequeños hijos. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa ya que falta repellar las paredes, embaldosar para una mejor higiene, cambiar puerta es por eso da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible esta inversión.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 29-year-old single mother with 3 children. She works arduously to get ahead so that she can provide her children with a good education. She receives support solely from her mother, who compelled her to be self-employed so that she can take care of her children.

At first, she used to make handmade tortillas because her mother had a tortilla stand. Later, she started selling cosmetics and apparel as a street vendor in Managua. With the profits she earned, she started making nacatamales (Central American tamales), vigoron (traditional Nicaraguan fast food), and vaho (a mix of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves) on weekends. She then opted to take out a loan and invested it in purchasing more apparel, footwear, and cosmetics to sell them from home. With those profits, she started making breakfast and lunch for the people who work in the Free Trade Zone. On weekends, she sells nacatamales.

With this loan, she will purchase more beauty products, as well as clothing for men, women and children so that she can keep increasing her inventory and profits because she depends on this money to be able to feed her young children.

She plans on making household repairs because she needs to have the walls plastered, lay down tile for added hygiene, and replace the doors of her small house. She gives thanks to the institute for making this investment possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and apparel

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Nieves A. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, tiene una cafeteria, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en cercanias del centro de la ciudad de El Paraiso. 
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre los gastos del hogar en un 100%.
Es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas que trabajan y ya no depènden de ella.
Les brinda el cuidado a sus tres nietos cuando sus hijas andan trabajando.
su negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia ya que cuando sus hijas estaban pequeñas se separaro de su esposo y le toco hacer las veces de madre y padre.
Blanca nos comento que uno de los factores que le permite producir sus buenas y sabrosas golosinas es la compra de buenos productos para hacerlas, la selección de los materiales para hacerlas, buenas verduras, carnes, tortillas, especias, etc.
Esto le a permitido mantener una excelente clientela generandole asi mejores ventas.
Necesita el credito para comprar mas comida ya que estos dias a tenido mas clientes y a veces no cubre con todas las necesidades de todos sus clientes.
se siente muy feliz ya que cada dia que pasa su negocio esta creciendo mas y mas.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca Nieves A. sells street food for a living. She has a snack bar located in her home near downtown El Paraiso.

She is able to pay for 100% of the household expenses with the profits that she earns from her business. She is a single mother with three daughters who are all employed and no longer depend on her financially. She takes care of her grandchildren while her daughters are at work.

Her business has allowed her to help her family get ahead because when her daughters were younger, she was legally separated from her husband, so she had to be both their mother and father.

Blanca states that one of the things that allows her to make such tasty treats is that fact that she purchases high-quality products and ingredients, such as choice meats, vegetables, tortillas, spices, etc. This has in turn allowed her to maintain a solid clientele, thus boosting sales.

She needs this loan in order to purchase more food because she has been getting more patrons lately, and she sometimes does not have enough food to satisfy everyone. She feels very happy because her business is growing more and more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meats, vegetables, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Cathérine S. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 2 petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 6 ans. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et prendre en charge ses deux petits fils elle a développé à domicile un petit élevage de porcs. elle prend une charrette en location pour aller chercher de l'aliment de porcs constitué essentiellement de débris de cuisine et restes d'aliments humains. Son objectif est d'assurer la nourriture et la dépense quotidienne pour elle et ses petits fils
texts.en:
Cathérine S. is a 62-year-old widow who lives with her 2 grandchildren. She has been a member of the community bank of Velingara Foulbe 2 for the past 6 years. To take care of her own needs, as well as of those of her two grandchildren, she started a small home-run pig farm. She rents a cart to go get pig food composed primarily of food leftovers. Her objective is to secure food and daily expenses for her and for her grandchildren.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business activity

loans.name: Rodny Ariel

texts.es: Rodny Ariel de 26 años de edad, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años en el area de programacion de proyectos, esta casado con la Sra. Thelma Martinez quien se encarga del cuido de la casa y la familia.  Rodny esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de hacer las divisiones de los cuartos de su casa, ya que actualmente solo consta de un cuarto grande y quiere dividirlo en 2 cuartos para mayor comodidad de la familia, ademas si el dinero lo permite pretende comprar materiales de construccion para posteriormente seguir mejorando su casa, pues el mayor sueño que tiene es tener su casa bonita para cuando lleguen los hijos poderles brindar comodidad.
texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Rodny Ariel works in the planning department of the Juigalpa City Hall. He is married to Mrs. Thelma Martinez, who looks after the family and the house. Rodny is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC with the aim of making rooms in his house because it is currently one big room. He would like to divide it into 2 rooms so that his family can be more comfortable. Furthermore, if money permits, he intends to purchase construction materials so that he can keep improving his house later on because he has always dreamed of having a beautiful home so that when his children come along, he can provide them with comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make rooms

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 27 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  Gorette and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  In this area, Gorette operates a business selling new shoes, specifically shoes for women.  This is her fifth successful year in this business.  Her business is open from 8 AM until late in the evening hours.

Gorette needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by adding men's and children's shoes as they seem to be in high demand.  With this additional business, Gorette will hopefully earn more profits.  With these profits, she has a goal of reinvesting in her business so that she can maintain the sustainability of her business and save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
María M. de 51 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, vive en una casa de cemento. Su esposo trabaja en una camioneta haciendo fletes con el tienen 3 hijos.

Hace ya 10 años empezó con el restaurante, le gusto cocinar para mucha gente y continúo con esta actividad con la ayuda de su esposa.  

Ahora ella tiene en su casa el restaurante en donde vende todo tipo de platos a la carta. Trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia del sector donde vive y las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena para poder construir mejor el local de comidas. En el futuro quiere tener su casa bien construida y tener una línea de restauran en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old María M. lives in a cement house in an urban area of el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Her husband transports cargo for a living, and they have 3 children together.

Ten years ago, she launched her restaurant. Because she really liked cooking for many people, she continued this business with the help of her husband.

She now has her own restaurant at home, where she sells all types of meals à la carte. She works from 4:00 pm to 11:00 pm every day. However, two problems that she faces are the rain and the crime in the area.

With this loan, she would like to purchase cement, bricks, and sand so that she can reinforce her restaurant. In the future, she would like to have a well-built house and her own restaurant chain throughout Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, bricks, and sand

loans.name: Delfina Lucia

texts.es: Doña Delfina Lucía Menchú Ordóñez  cuenta con 32 años de edad, es soltera. Es Artesana y se dedica a la “Elaboración de cortes típicos” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, lleva 10 años de elaborar cortes típicos en su residencia. Actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante su negocio, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Delfina Lucía Menchú Ordóñez is 32 years old and single. She is a craftswoman who makes traditional clothing for a living. She has two sewing workshops and has been making clothing from home for 10 years. These days, demand has grown, but her financial situation does not allow her to increase capital. For this reason, she now turns to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of purchasing raw materials, thus allowing her to boost sales, help her business make progress, and improve her living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José T. de 40 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa vende cosméticos con ella tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10, 12 años.

Inicio vendiendo pan en una bicicleta en casi todo Guayaquil, después de un largo tiempo compro los hornos.

Ahora el trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días, el tiene una producción de 600 panes diarios, el alquila un local cerca de su casa. Una de las dificultades que ha tenido es la delincuencia que hay en el sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, levadura, leche para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio para la panadería.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old José T. lives in an urban area of el Suburbio de Guayaquil. His house is made of concrete and the only utilities he has are electricity and running water. His wife sells cosmetics. They have 3 children ages 8, 10, and 12.

He started out selling bread on a bicycle throughout most of Guayaquil. After a while, he purchased ovens.

He now works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm every day. He produces 600 loaves of bread daily in a business space that he rents out near his house. One of the problems he faces is that he works in a crime-ridden area.

With this loan, he would like to purchase flour, yeast, and milk for his business. In the future, he would like to have his own bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and milk

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es: Marisela vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 22 años de edad, se dedica ala venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, casada y con una bebe de 5 mese de nacida, anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca renuncio y con su liquidación y dinero que dio su esposo producto de su trabajo en zona franca como operario, invirtió en ropa, zapatos y cosmético que vende ambulante y por encargo a sus clientes pues tiene dos años en este negocio lo que espera es poder crecer para  poder ir a los departamento a vender ya que las ventas le han comentado que son buenas. Su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa algún día ya que habita en casa de su suegra es por eso desea invertir y  ir ahorrando para poder lograr el objetivo junto con su esposo. Este financiamiento comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, zapatos, cosméticos y otra variedad de productos que encargan sus clientes lo que espera es vender mas y ganar mejor para poder cubrir las necesidades diarias de  su familia y ahorrar para hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Marisela is 22 years old, she is married, has a 5-month old daughter, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She sells clothing, shoes, and toiletries. Previously she worked in the free trade zone; upon quitting she took her severance pay and combined it with money provided by her husband (from his job in the free trade zone) and invested it in purchasing clothing, shoes, and toiletries. For the past two years she has been selling her products on the street and by request to direct clients. She now wishes to expand her business and sell directly to department stores, as she's often been told that her products are quite good. She currently lives in her mother-in-law's home and hopes to someday purchase her own house. She wishes to invest in her business and save money so that she and her husband can reach this goal. This loan will be used to purchase men and women’s clothing, shoes, toiletries, and other products requested by her clients. She hopes to be able to sell more products and earn more money in order to cover her family's daily expenses, as well as save money to purchase a house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and toiletries to increase her sales

loans.name: Rutila

texts.es: Rutila tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar. El inicio de su negocio surge por la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida, por lo que siempre se ha interesado en mantenerlo aunque no ha sido fácilmente ya que la situación esta difícil, esto no la desanima a continuar pues a ella le gusta su negocio y con las ganancias ha mejorado ciertas cosas en su vivienda. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, perfumes, cremas y colonias. Rutila sueña con establecer un negocio amplio en su casa.
texts.en:
Rutila is 54 years old, her economic activity is the buying and selling of clothes. For more than ten years she has been dedicated to this activity, since she was very young she has liked to work. The beginning of her business was out of the necessity to improve the conditions of her life and she has always been interested in maintaining the business although it hasn't been easy because the situation is difficult. This hasn't discouraged her from continuing because she likes her business and with the earnings she has improved certain things in her life. She is seeking this loan to buy underwear, pants, tank tops, skirts, dresses, perfumes, creams and colognes. Rutila dreams of establishing a big store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase underwear, pants, tank tops, skirts, dresses, perfumes, creams and colognes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Cristina, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 50años de edad, la socia es  casada y tiene 3 hijos de  26, 20, 15 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene una tienda abarrotes en el que vende todo tipo de productos y hasta un poco de artículos de librería, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar  productos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche entre otros y de este modo seguir apoyando en la educación de sus hijos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Cristina, belongs to the community banking group "CAPAC QOYA." Our member lives in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. Our member is 50 years old and is married. She has 3 children who are 26, 20 and 15 years old. Our member alternates between her activities of the home with those of the retail store. She has a grocery store that sells all types of products and even a small amount of library items.
