Our member is asking for a loan to be able to purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles and milk, among others, so that she can continue to help with the education of her children. Our member is thankful for the opportunity offered and promises to fulfill the payment of the different fees within the established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk and more.

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
la sra. Yecenia G. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio Santa Lucia frente a la Iglesia Casa Pastoral, Alauca El Paraiso. 
Yecenia se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo, tiene su negocio hace varios años.
en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas carne al por mayor para tener bajos costos de compra y mayores ganancias.
Yecenia dice sentirse muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia que pasa, las carnes son muy vendidas en esta zona, sus mayores dias de ventas son los fines de semana.
con este credito saldra adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Yecenia G. is 37 years old, she lives in the neighborhood of Santa Lucia.Yecenia sells red meat and pork, she has had her business for several years. She currently needs this loan to buy more meat wholesale to have lower purchasing costs and higher earnings. Yecenia says that she feels very happy because her business is growing with every day that passes, the meats sell well in this area. Her best days for sales are the weekends. With this loan she will get ahead with her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red meat and pork

loans.name: Jappo Liggey Asf N°4 Group

texts.fr:
Jappo Ligguey ASF est une association mixte composée de plusieurs personnes microentrepreuneuses. Elle a été créée en 2009 par un groupe de femmes pour  rassembler  tous leurs  paires microentrepreuneurs  du  quartier  Angle Serigne Fallou  (ASF) autour d’un même idéal  « l’entraide  pour travailler ». Elle est dirigée par Madame Marie Ndiaye D. et  est scindée en plusieurs sous groupes de 5 sous l’influence de l’agent de crédit de la caisse U-IMCEC Moda Kane pour  que tous  les membres  puissent  bénéficier mieux des services d’U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que certains sous groupes ont déposé leur demande de crédit de 500 000 FCFA qu’ils vont se partager en part égale. 
Quant au  sous Jappo Liggey ASF n°4, elle est gérée par la présidente de l’association Madame Marie Ndiaye D.. C’est une femme mariée avec 5 enfants tous majeurs qui s’active dans le commerce de tissus depuis 1986. Cependant, Madame D. voudrait se lancer dans l’aviculture sous l’influence de son amie avicultrice. Elle compte avec sa part du prêt, ses 100 000 FCFA, démarrer l’activité en achetant  50 poussins et tout le nécessaire. Ainsi ce prêt va lui permettre de diversifier ses activités afin de bien gérer ses besoins et ceux de sa maison.
Pour les autres membres du sous groupe, ce prêt leurs permet de renforcer leurs activités. Elles sont entre autre :
 La trésorière Madame Fatou S. s’active dans le  commerce de tissus Thioupes (indigo) et de bol depuis 30 ans. 
Madame Ndeye salla N. la plus petite du sous groupe, coiffeuse depuis 6 ans entend acheter des produits cosmétiques, mèches et greffages pour son salon de coiffures  qu’elle gère avec ses 6 apprentis.
 Madame Mame Thioro D.  qui vend du petit déjeuner et du jus local  dans un coin du quartier depuis 4 ans 
Et Madame Diago M.  avicultrice de poulets de chair  depuis 3 ans et qui a formé Madame la présidente au métier.
texts.en:
Jappo Ligguey ASF is a mixed association composed of several micro-entrepreneurial individuals.  It was created in 2009 by a group of women to bring together all of their micro-entrepreneur peers in the Angle Serigne Fallou (ASF) district to focus on the same idea: mutual aid for doing work.  The association is lead by Ms. Marie Ndiaye D. and is divided into several sub-groups of five under the guidance of the agent of the lending group U-IMCEC Moda Kane, so that all the members may better benefit from U-IMCEC services.  Thus, some of the sub-groups have submitted their loan request of 500,000 francs CFA for sharing equally among themselves. As for the sub-group Jappo Liggey ASF n°4, it is managed by the president of the association Ms. Marie Ndiaye D..  She is a married woman with five children, all of age.  She has been active in the commerce of cloth since 1986.  However, she would like to get started raising poultry, with the help of her friend who is a poultry farmer. And she plans on using her share of the loan, the amount of 100,000 francs CFA, to start this business by buying fifty chicks and all the necessities.  And so, this loan is going to enable her to diversify her business in order to do well managing the needs of her house, as well as her own.  For the other members of the sub-group, this loan enables them to bolster their businesses.  Included are: The treasurer Ms. Fatou S. has been active in the commerce of thioupes fabrics (indigo) and bowls and basins for thirty years. Ms. Ndeye salla N., the youngest in the sub-group, has been a hair stylist for six years.  She intends to buy cosmetics, hair extensions, and weaves for her hair salon, which she manages with six apprentices. Ms. Mame Thioro D. has been selling breakfast and local juices in her neighborhood for four years.  And Ms. Diago M. has been a chicken farmer for three years.  She trained Madame President in her trade.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on a variey of goods

loans.name: Tatimalap Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Tatimalap'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Fatu K., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group. Fatu was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. The 40-year-old (approx.) is married and they have 8 children – 6 are still attending secondary school and 2 are already grown-up and on their own. For 5 years now, Fatu has been selling firewood. With her share of the loan, Fatu will buy piles of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. She speaks Ibo and English languages fluently. She owns a palm oil mill where she mills and sells palm oil to her customers in Benin City. She buys palm oil fruit from farmers. Palm oil is derived from palm fruit. This business is very lucrative, as palm oil is used to prepare most local delicacies in Nigeria. She has been in the business for 2 years now. With the profit from the business, she could assist her husband, who is a commercial driver, in providing for her family's needs, like food and clothing, etc.

Nkechi hopes to improve and expand her business. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more palm oil fruit to mill and to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit to mill and to sell

loans.name: Diénabou Messin

texts.fr: Diénabou Messin S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu à y recevoir 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme, elle achète sa marchandise en grande quantité pour revendre au détaille dans son quartier et au marchés hebdomadaires. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la dépense quotidienne de la famille, de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Diénabou Messin S. is a 34-year-old divorced woman who lives with and takes care of her 3 children. She has been a member of the community bank of Vélingara Foulbé for the past 6 and a half years, and she received 13 loans that she managed well and reimbursed properly. Diénabou is a seller of palm oil. She purchases her merchandise in large quantities to resell it afterward in her neighborhood and in the weekly markets. Her profits allow her to take care of her family's daily expenses, of the needs of her children, as well as of her own.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona tiene la edad de 57 años, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, procreo siete hijos todos mayores de edad, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos desde su juventud ya que sus padres no pudieron dar estudios por que eran muy pobres y de escasos recursos. Lo que se le dificulta  a uno para poder encontrar un trabajo donde la paga sea buena. Ella construyo su casa gracias a la ayuda de una hija que tiene en Costa Rica la cual viajo para poder trabajar allá, ya que se le hizo difícil encontrar un trabajo a qui, lo cual envía remesa quincenal y con su salario y los prestamos logrado construir. Lo que desea con este financiamiento es poder terminar un cuarto en donde falta levantar paredes, repellar, embaldosar, poner techo y puertas lo que espera lograr terminar para poder tener mejor espacio y comodidad. Sus planes es seguir trabajando es por eso lava y plancha ajeno también para obtener otros ingresos ya que su salario es bajo y así poder cubrir sus necesidades. Y ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona is 57 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación, she has had seven children, all are of older ages. She has worked in domestic services since her youth because her parents couldn't afford her studies because they were very poor and had few resources. She finds it difficult to find a job where the pay is good. She built her house thanks to the help of a daughter in Costa Rica who traveled to work there because she found it difficult to find work here, her daughter sends remittances twice a week. With her salary and with loans she has been able to build. What she wants with this loan is to be able to finish a room that still needs walls, plaster, tile, a roof and doors. She hopes to be able to finish so that she can have a better, more comfortable space. Her plan is to continue taking in laundry and ironing work and also to obtain other forms of income because her salary is low and this is how she is able to cover her necessities and to help her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, beams and corrugated metal to finish the construction of a room and be able to have more space.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Margoth, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hija de 19 años de edad, nuestra socia es una mujer muy optimista y muy trabajadora, ella vive con sus hija en Coya, distrito de Pisac; Nuestra socia acostumbra correr todas las mañanas  por el bosque y llega a su casa para preparar el desayuno para ella y su hija, después se va a abrir su negocio que esta ubicado a media cuadra de la plaza principal de Coya, nuestra socia abrió una tienda muy bonita e instaló un locutorio, también adquirió un grupo de celulares nuevos para venderlos en su zona, nuestra socia también le hizo un espacio a una vitrina donde vende regalitos y artículos de librería. La socia que es una mujer muy emprendedora requiere el préstamo para comprar celulares y aumentar su mercadería, ella desea crecer y poner una sucursal el otro distrito del valle sagrado de los incas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Margoth, belongs the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank. She lives in the district of Coya-Pisac, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has one 19 year old daughter. The member is a very optimistic and hard-working woman. She lives with her daughter in Coya, Pisac district. She is accustomed to running all morning in the forest to arrive at home in order to prepare breakfast for herself and her daughter. Afterwards she opens her business which is located half a block from Coya’s main square. Our member opened a beautiful store and installed a phone booth. She also acquired a group of cellular phones to sell in her area. She also has a display cabinet where she sells small gifts and office supplies. The member is a very entrepreneurial woman who is requesting the loan in order to buy cell phones and increase her merchandise. She wants to grow her business and put a branch in another district, the valle sagrado de los incas district.

She is grateful for and values the opportunity offered to her through this resource and she promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is a very entrepreneurial woman who is requesting the loan in order to buy cell phones and increase her merchandise. She wants to grow her business and put a branch in another district, the valle sagrado de los incas district

loans.name: Yasmina Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Yasmina Elena A. cuenta con un pequeño SALON de entretenimientos, juegos de video  denominado  SAMIR actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años, esta casada y es madre de familia, tiene un hijo.
Con los ingresos que le genera este negocio suple algunos gastos personales y estudios de su hijo. 
el credito que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio ya que tiene que estar actualizando sus consolas de videos que ese desgastan por el uso y actualizando sus juegos ya que sus clientes en su mayoria son jovenes y niños a los que tiene que tener satisfechos y bien entretenidos.
texts.en:
Yasmina Elena A. has a small entertainment room with video games named SAMIR. She has dedicated herself to this work for more than 5 years. She is married and is a mother; she has one son. With the revenue from this business she pays for personal expenses and her son's education. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her business to upgrade her video machines which are wearing down from use. She also plans to upgrade her games as most of her customers are young people and children and they are the ones who must be satisfied and entertained.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video games and materials to maintain the machines.

loans.name: Grupo Sicalbe 2 Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas que viven a 60 kilometros de la ciudad. Se han reunidos para un proyecto de Mini riego, ya que se dedican a la siembra de tomates, cuentan con experiencia alrededor de 5 años como grupo, ya que es un producto calificados su produccion se vendidos en paises de Centro America. El agua que utilizan proviene de nacimientos de las montañas del mismo lugar de Momostenango, ellos residen en la Aldea Xequemeyá, actualmente cuentan con el proyecto de agua de miniriego, pero no tienen accesos a financiamiento debido a que son de escasos recursos economicos. Es la primera vez que solicitan su prestamo en ASDIR. De acuerdo al estudio realizado se verifico la actividad economicas y los terrenos de cultivo de tomate con que cuentan. Por esta razón se considera al momento de incrementar su capital de agricultura hará que las personas aumenten sus cosechas, y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos economicos, de la misma manera mejorará sus condiciones de vida, como también ayudarán a las personas del lugar a que los productos que venden sean mas baratos que en el mercado del lugar.
texts.en:
This group of people lives 60 miles away from the city. They have joined together to work on a Micro-irrigation system since they grow tomatoes. They count on the 5 years of experience they have earned since their product is well-known and sold throughout Central America. The water they use comes from the Momostenango mountains. They live in the small village of Xeqeumayá. Currently they depend on the Micro-irrigation system but lack the funding due to scarce economic resources. This is the first time they request a loan from ASDIR. According to the study undertaken, the financial activities of the borrowers and the land they use for planting tomatoes, were verified. This is why they consider this the right time to increase their funds. This will help build up their crops to earn more, improve their standards of living, and sell their product at a lower price than the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Micro-irrigation

loans.name: Harry

texts.fr: Harry D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est veuve et mère 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu 13 expériences avec le crédit. Son prêt lui permet de développer un petit commerce d'huile de palme. Elle achète sa marchandise au grand marché hebdomadaire (à caractère sous régionale) pour aller revendre vers la capitale et autres régions du nord du pays. Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Harry D. is a 53-year-old widow with three children to care for. She has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé2 “Banc Villageois” loan group for 6 ½ years and has had 13 previous experiences with credit loans. Her loan allows her to develop a small business selling palm oil. She buys her product at the big weekly market covering the whole sub-region, and resells it in the capital or other regions to the North of the country. Her ambition is to ensure her family is taken care of.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: We Believe Weself Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'We Believe Weself'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Memunatu K., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group. Memunatu was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. The 32-year-old is married to a teacher and they have 3 children who are attending primary school. For many years now, Memunatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth). With her share of the loan, she will buy working materials like white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder and pay experts to make designs on the white cotton.

loans.use: Buy working materials like white cotton, inks, caustic soda, etc. and pay experts to make designs

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.en:
The Fe Groups is a new group to ADIM, consisting of three woman entrepreneurs and workers; the coordinator is the young Gessell C. J. who, like many Nicaragüenses, works in the Zona Franca for minimal earnings and sees the necessity of credit. Gessel will use the loan to sell Avon cosmetics which will help at home so she can support her two children, one only two months old, the other three years old.

Amparo Pinedad also works in the Zona Franca. She will use the loan to help with costs associated with starting her business where she sells clothing, jewelry, accessories, and lingerie. The third member of the group, Andrea Isabel Q., has a very popular restaurant where she makes fried food, soups, vigoron and baho (both typical Nicaraguan dishes).

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Veronica Leticia

texts.es:
Verónica Rodríguez de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil,su casa es de cemento. Su esposo vende pescados en una bicicleta con el tiene un hijo de 10 años.

Ella empezó como empleada domestica, cuando la despidieron ella compro pescados en el mercado de Guayaquil y decidió que esa iba a ser su actividad.  

Ahora ella trabaja en las afueras de su casa vendiendo pescados y camarones todos los días, su esposo la ayuda con la venta de los mariscos en bicicleta. Vende los pescados a $ 2.00 la libra, los camarones a $ 2.00 la libra y el calamar a $ 2.00 la libra. Una de las complicaciones es la delincuencia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados, camarones y calamar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local de venta de mariscos.
texts.en:
Verónica Rodríguez, 30, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil along the city's Perimetral (ring road) in a cement house. Her husband sells fish from a bicycle. They have a son who is 10 years old. She started out as a domestic employee; when she lost that job she bought fish in the market in Guayaquil and decided that this was going to be her main economic activity. Now she works in the area outside her home selling fish and shrimp each day. Her husband helps her with the sale of shrimp on his bicycle. She sells fish at $2.00 per pound, the shrimp at $2.00 per pound and the calamari at $2.00 per pound. One of the complications of her business is dealing with crime. With this loan she wants to buy fish, shrimp and calamari for her business. In the future she wants to have a place to sell seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and calamari

loans.name: Makump Family Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Makump Family'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Idrisa T. pictured on the right is the leader of this group. Idrisa T. was born in Makump village about 5 miles from Makeni. The 35-year-old is married with 7 children – 4 in secondary school and 3 in primary school. For many years now, Idrisa has been selling mints, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy mints, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. wholesale for resale

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 2004 et a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend à domicile de l'huile de palme des produits halieutiques et des oignons. Avec ses bénéficies elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is a 26-year-old woman, married with two children. Since 2004 she has belonged to the Village Bank of Vélingara Foulbé2, from which she has had ten loans. She sells palm oil, fish products and onions from her home. With her profits she helps her husband take care of the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Jappo Liggey Asf N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Jappo Ligguey ASF est une association mixte composée de plusieurs personnes microentrepreuneuses. Elle a été créée en 2009 par un groupe de femmes pour  rassembler  tous leurs  paires microentrepreuneurs  du  quartier  Angle Serigne Fallou  (ASF) autour d’un même idéal  « l’entraide  pour travailler ». Elle est dirigée par Madame Marie Ndiaye Diouf et  est scindée en plusieurs sous groupes de 5 sous l’influence de l’agent de crédit de la caisse U-IMCEC Moda K. pour  que tous  les membres  puissent  bénéficier mieux des services d’U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que certains sous groupes ont déposé leur demande de crédit de 500 000 FCFA qu’ils vont se partager en part égale. 
Pour le sous groupe Jappo Ligguey ASF N°1, nous retrouvons Madame Magatte B. la présidente, Madame Amy K., Madame Anta S., Madame Yacine T. et Madame Ndoumbé G. qui s’activent toutes dans le commerce et souhaitaient un prêt de 500 000 FCFA qu’elles vont se partager à part égale pour renforcer leurs activités. 
Madame Magatte B. restauratrice dans son quartier depuis 3 ans compte acheter avec  sa part des produits pour renouveler son stock. Elle est aidée par ses enfants  et compte développer son business pour gagner des parts de marché et devenir la plus grande restauratrice du coin ou de Thiès. Cette femme très dynamique est mariée mère de 9 enfants  et compte une cinquantaine d’années dans sa vie.
Madame Amy K. la trésorière vend divers produits (fruits, couscous, …etc) depuis 21 ans dans son quartier Anle Serigne Fallou (ASF). 
Madame Anta S. est dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures. Elle ne gère pas une cantine mais fait le commerce ambulant, une façon pour elle de mieux trouver des clients.
Madame Yacine T. vend des parfums  et le soir elle vend de la soupe à coté de la cantine de sa maman.
Madame Ndoumbé G. vend de la crème glacée chez elle et dans l’enceinte de l’école coranique du quartier.
texts.en:
Jappo Ligguey ASF is a mixed association composed of several micro-entrepreneurial individuals.  It was created in 2009 by a group of women to bring together all of their micro-entrepreneur peers in the Angle Serigne Fallou (ASF) district to focus on the same ideal: mutual aid for doing work.  The association is lead by Ms. Marie Ndiaye Diouf and is divided into several sub-groups of five under the guidance of the agent of the lending group U-IMCEC Moda K., so that all the members may better benefit from U-IMCEC services.  Thus, some of the sub-groups have submitted their loan request of 500,000 francs CFA for sharing equally among themselves. For the sub-group Jappo Ligguey ASF N°1, we have Ms. Magatte B. as the president, Ms. Amy K., Ms. Anta S., Ms. Yacine T., and Ms. Ndoumbé G.. They are all active in commerce and wish to have a loan of 500,000 francs CFA, which they are going to share equally among themselves for bolstering their businesses.  Ms. Magatte B. has been a restauranteur in her district for three years and plans to use her portion to replenish her inventory.  She is assisted by her children and intends to develop her business to win a share of the market and to become the greatest restauranteur in the neighborhood or in Thiès.  She is a very energetic woman, married, and the mother of nine children.  She is fifty-something now.  Ms. Amy K., the treasurer, has been selling a variety of goods (fruit, couscous, ... etc.) for 21 years in her district of Anle Serigne Fallou (ASF). Ms. Anta S. is in the business of fabrics and shoes.  She doesn't manage a stall but goes from place to place to make her sales, which is a better way for her for finding customers. Ms. Yacine T. sells perfume.  In the evenings, she sells ice cream at her place and within the Koranic school of the district.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on a variety of goods for their businesses

loans.name: Margarita Rosa

texts.es:
Margarita Rosa Y. R. es una empresaria cartagenera de grandes metas que sueña con que su negocio de venta de comidas crezca tanto, que sus productos sean reconocidos en toda la ciudad y que algún día, ella sea identificada como una gran empresaria colombiana. Inició su actividad de vender almuerzos hace tres años; inicialmente elaboraba la comida en su casa vendiéndola a sus vecinos, hasta que uno de ellos le comentara que donde él trabajaba no había quien vendiera almuerzos; fue así como Margarita se instaló en la Zona Industrial de Mamonal, lugar cercano a Cartagena que concentra  muchas empresas importantes del país. En ese momento  prestó un dinero para comprar la materia prima y preparar los almuerzos, que requería ser devuelto al día siguiente. 
Poco a poco fue creciendo su clientela y como el negocio ameritaba una inyección de capital, se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que le agradece haberle dado la oportunidad de sacarlo adelante, aumentar un poco su ingreso y reemplazar el préstamo que debía devolver al día siguiente. Este crédito con un monto de $2.000.000 es su segundo financiamiento y con él va a comprar materia prima para la preparación de sus comidas y sillas y mesas que adecuarán su negocio. Como la Fundación la ha  apoyado personal y financieramente,  hoy siente que debe serle fiel; su crédito anterior la ayudó a aumentar sus ganancias y a crecer en cobertura en el sector en que trabaja con servicios de mejor calidad; tiene dos empleadas y se siente contenta porque está generando ingresos familiares en otros hogares que están como el suyo.
La señora Margarita considera que su mayor dificultad fue enfrentar la vida sola con sus tres hijos; pero gracias a Dios pudo salir adelante y hoy se siente feliz  sabiendo que está esforzándose, para que sus hijos avancen; a ellos les ha enseñado que la vida no es fácil y que con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho amor se logran propósitos. Esta su lección,  la ayuda a entender las dificultades como parte de la vida y del negocio; por ejemplo: en tiempos de ventas bajas, cuando  no genera  los ingresos suficientes para responder a requerimientos  superiores a las necesidades básicas de su familia y  de su negocio, ella logra salir adelante aunque retrase el cumplimiento de sus sueños, porque ella sabe que es prioridad reinvertir en su negocio, para asegurar su sosteniendo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
. Margarita Rosa Y. R. is a businesswoman from Cartagena who has ambitious goals for her food business; she hopes it will grow to such an extent that her products will be known city-wide and that, some day, she will be recognized as one of Colombia’s greatest businesswomen. She started her business selling breakfasts three years ago. Initially, she made the meals at home and sold them to her neighbors until one of them mentioned to her that where he worked there was no one selling meals. This was how Margarita set herself up in the Mamonal Industrial Zone, a site near Cartagena that concentrates many of the country’s important companies. She borrowed money that had to be repaid the next day to buy raw materials and prepare the lunches. Gradually, her customer base grew. Since the business needed an injection of capital, she called upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization to which she is grateful for giving her the opportunity to launch her business, to increase her income a bit, and to replace the money for that loan she needed to repay the next day. This $2.000.000 loan is her second one and she will use it to buy ingredients for her meals as well as tables and chairs for her business. Because the Fundación has supported her both financially and personally, she feels very loyal to it. Her previous loans helped her increase her profits and to expand her service area in her type of work with better quality service; she has two employees and she is happy because she is generating income in other homes like hers. Margarita considers her greatest challenge to be having to face life alone with her three children. However, thanks to God she was able to overcome and today she is happy knowing that she is making the effort for her children to advance. She has taught them that life isn’t easy but that with effort, dedication and lots of love, one can reach one’s goals. This is her lesson. It helps her to face difficulties as part of life and business. For example, when sales are down and they barely produce sufficient income to meet basic needs of her family and her business, she forges ahead even if she has to delay reaching her dreams because she knows that the first priority must be to reinvest in her business so that she can be sure to provide for her family’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Maricela Group

texts.en:
The Marisela Group consists of three woman: Marisela E., Karla E., and Santos Gutiérrez. The coordinator is Marisela, who began her business by selling cold drinks, ice creams, and ice. She would like the loan because she has decided to begin using her earnings to convert her business into one which makes and sells custom clothing.

The other members of the group are Karla, who began selling vegetables and other items in 2000, and Santos, who has been selling clothing for the past four years.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for the business

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna Y. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée à un homme polygame, elle mère de 8 enfants et vit avec sa coépouses dans la même maison. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 5 ans et y a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de crème glacé, de la bouillie de mil, du jus de fruits naturel et du couscous au lait. Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à prendre en charge sa progéniture et de participer aux différentes charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna Y. is 55. She is in a polygamous marriage, has eight children and lives in the same house as her husband's other wives. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Vélingara Foulbé2 for five years, and has had ten loans. She has a small business selling ice-cream, millet porridge, natural fruit juices and couscous with milk. She uses her profits to take care of her children and to share in paying for family activity.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up and selling palm oil and corn

loans.name: Sergio Genaro

texts.es:
Sergio Menéndez de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, en su casa cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposa trabaja con el en la farmacia tiene una hija de 1 año y 7 meses. 

El empezó vendiendo artículos para el hogar, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia decidió invertir sus ahorros en el mismo negocio que los padres tenían. 

Ahora el tiene su propia farmacia en un local de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 23h30 todos los días. Vende productos farmacéuticos, productos para laboratorios, laxantes, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos para laboratorios y medicamentos para la farmacia. En el futuro su sueño es tener 3 sucursales farmacéuticas.
texts.en:
Sergio Menéndez, age 30, lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house has the basic services of water and electricity. His wife works in the pharmacy. They have a daughter who is one year and seven months. He started selling articles for the home, but he did not have enough income to support his family. He decided to invest his savings in the same business that his parents had. Now he has his own pharmacy in a area of his house. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 11:30 p.m. everyday. He sells pharmaceutical products, products for laboratories, and laxatives, etc. With the loan he wants to buy products for laboratories and medicine for the pharmacy. In the future he dreams of having three branch pharmacists.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medications and products for laboratories

loans.name: Katherine Patricia

texts.es: En un sitio muy cercano al Centro Comercial Metro Centro, al Estadio metropolitano D. Futbol D. Barranquilla  y a una importante  vía vehicular, se encuentra  “Harrison Alta Peluquería “  el negocio D. Katherine Patricia R. D. L. R., ella es una joven que tiene un hijo D. 7 años D. edad y que inició este negocio en el año 2008, contando solamente con su conocimiento,  un lava cabezas, 3 sillas, pocas herramientas D. trabajo y muchas ganas D. ser exitosa; buscando una mejor ubicación para su negocio, donD. potencialmente hubiera más afluencia D. clientes, se trasladó D. otro barrio a la  Ciudadela 20 D. Julio, sitio donD. funciona hoy con 4 empleados fijos, es muy reconocida por su desempeño y vive muy contenta pues hace el negocio que más le gusta: vender belleza, armonía e imagen; con este propósito solicita su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor D. $ 2,300.000,para diversificar su oferta D. servicios, pues necesita para implementar su sala D. cosmetología comprar activos fijos,como camillas faciales, sillas D. maquillaje, sillas para niños y equipos especiales D. spa, donD. realice mascarillas, limpieza facial , masajes reductores entre otros servicios; su sueño es tener un Spa muy bien adecuado y más adelante comprar el local donD. funciona. Su mayor desafío es mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia, brindarle la mejor educación formal a su hijo y ser propietaria del local donD. funciona la peluquería, pues le va muy bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo persistente.
texts.en:
Katherine Patricia R. D. L. R.’ beauty salon, called “Harrison Alta Peluquería,“ is located very near the Metro Centro Shopping Center, Barranquilla’s Metropolitan Football Stadium and an important thoroughfare. Katherine is a young woman, who is the mother of a seven-year-old son. She started her business in 2008 with just her knowledge, a hair wash sink, three chairs and few work tools, but lots of desire to succeed. In an attempt to find a better location for her business, where potentially there would be more customers, she moved to another neighborhood: Ciudadela 20 D. Julio. Today, she operates there with four permanent employees. She is very well-known because of her good work and she is happy because she does the work she loves: she sells beauty, harmony and self-image. She is asking for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, valued at $2,300.000 to diversify the services she offers because she wants to set up a cosmetology salon and must buy fixed assets like: facials tables, make-up chairs, children’s chairs and special spa equipment to do facial scrubs, cleanings, massages, etc. Her dream is to have a well-equipped spa and later on to buy a location for it. Her greatest challenge is to improve her family’s standard of living, to proviD. formal education for her son, and to be the owner of the locale where her beauty salon is located because she does well thanks to her dedication and persistent effort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixed assets for her spa.

loans.name: La Sinceridad Group

texts.es:
el grupo la Sinceridad esta conformado por 4 integrantes los cuales son muy amigos y hace mucho tiempo atras se conocen, a continuacion se detalla las siguientes actividades de cada uno de ellos:

la sra. Sara Melissa G. C. tiene un año y medio de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “GABRIELA”
el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación en la Colonia La Concepción de la ciudad de Danlí, Sara se a ganado la clientela por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que les ofrece.- su negocio se muestra con buena presentación e imagen y el sector donde esta ubicado es de un ambiente agradable.


el sr. Wilmer Omar A. M. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de HOT DOGS,  actividad con la que cuenta con un año de experiencia. el cual opera rotulado en su carreta como HOT DOGS “Clásicos Delicia”
El Sr. A., lleva a cabo su actividad después de las 12:00 M. y él ya tiene los lugares donde se instala a vender, todos los días de la semana en horas de la tarde se ubica en “Lubricentros Romero” lugar donde llega mucha cantidad de personas a realizar y revisar los cambios de aceite de vehículos, y es el lubricentro que cuanta con mayor clientela en esta ciudad de Danlí.
Don wilmer también va 2 días por semana a vender a las fábricas de tabacos espacialmente los días de pago que son los viernes, y cuando la noche esta llegando el se ubica en la calle principal de la Colonia La Concepción.
Don Wilmer, esta solicitando su crédito ya que el mira que su negocio es bien rentable,  él inicio con el proyecto de hacer otra carreta especial para vender Hot Dog y ponerle vendedor que se la administre.

la Sra Mayra Lorena G. L. tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa nueva; actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante.
Doña Mayra, ya tiene los lugares donde sale a vender como ser: la aldea del Pataste, la cebadilla y en la Colonia donde vive.
La Sra. G. se ha sabido ganar la clientela por los precios que les ofrece y por las comodidades de pago que le da a sus clientes, ya que la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito y cuando va a los lugares a vender recupera dineros del producto que deja al crédito y tambien vende mercadería nueva.

la sra. Justa Elena G. L. su actividad principal es la venta de Paletas (Vasitos), choco bananos y juguitos, actividad la cual realiza desde hace dos años.
Nos comento que con este negocio se ha ayudado bastante ya que con los ingresos que le genera el mismo logro pagar la refrigeradora.
Ella vende su producto en su casa de habitación, sus clientes la prefieren por el exquisito sabor que le da a sus paletas.
Doña Elena, en el periodo escolar se va a vender en una nevera al centro de estudio de la colonia, lugar donde le va muy bien ya que nos comento que la mayoría de veces hay alumnos que se quedan sin comprar otras cosas  y deleitar de sus productos.
En la actualidad la Sra. Elena no cuenta con el capital de trabajo para abastecerse de materia prima para la elaboración de su producto y para la compra de los juguitos y en vista que el periodo escolar esta por empezar,  quiere satisfacer a todos sus clientes con la demanda de su producto, razón por la cual esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
The La Sinceridad group is made up of 4 members who are good friends and have known each other for a long time. Their various activities are detailed below: Sara Melissa G. C. has sold groceries for the last year and a half. Her store is called “Gabriela” and it is located in her home, which is in Colonia La Concepción in the city of Danlí. Sara has won over her customers with good service and affordable prices. Her store has a pleasant appearance and the area where it is located has an agreeable ambience. Wilmer Omar A. M. is a merchant; his main product is hot-dogs. He has been in this particular line of work for a year selling his product from a hot-dog cart called “Clásicos Delicia.” Mr. A. starts his business after the noon hour and he already has several spots where he sets himself up to sell. Every day, in the afternoon, he sets up at “Lubricentros Romero,” a place where lots of people come to have the oil in their vehicles changed and this particular “lubricentro” is the busiest in Danlí. Wilmer also goes twice a week to sell at the tobacco factories, especially on pay day, which is Friday. At nightfall, he can be found in Colonia La Concepción’s main street. He is asking for funding because his business is quite profitable; he is looking to get a second hot-dog cart and hiring someone to operate it under his supervision. Mayra Lorena G. L. has sold new clothing for two years; she sells both at home and door-to-door. Mayra has two main locations that she frequents to sell: the village of Pataste, La Cebadilla and her own neighborhood. Mrs. G. has won over regular customers thanks to her affordable prices and the easy payment plans she offers; most of her sales are on credit and, when she goes to the places where she sells to collect, she also sells new merchandise. Justa Elena G. L. sells popsicles, chocolate-covered bananas and juices; she has been in this line of work for two years. She related to us that the business has been very helpful to her because she was able to use the profits to buy a refrigerator. She sells her products from home. Her customers prefer her because of the exquisite flavor of her popsicles. During the school year, Elena takes a cooler full of her product to sell at the neighborhood school; she does very well here and she told us that often students will forego buying other snacks in order to enjoy her products. Currently, Elena does not have sufficient funds to get the ingredients she needs to make her popsicles and to buy the juices. Since the school year is about to begin, she wants to be able to meet the demand of all her customers thus, the reason behind this request for funds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira tiene 51 años de edad, esta Señora tiene una gran personalidad por lo que el carisma que ofrece a sus clientes es el mejor y esto les atrae mucho. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general pues ha logrado aumentar su inventario. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que sus inicios no fueran fácil, pero sirvieron de mucho para proporcionarle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar, pues siempre se ha hecho cargo de ella, ya que es Madre y Padre a la vez es por eso que trata de ofrecerle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la inversión de su capital de trabajo y no perder a sus clientes. Su deseo es establecer una tienda de cosméticos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yadira is 51. This lady is full of charisma and has a great personality-and these are what attracts her customers to her. Her business is selling merchandise in general and she has succeeded in increasing the variety of inventory. More than 31 years ago she started this business although it wasn’t easy to get started. The business helped her give her daughter the opportunity to study. She has always supported her since she is both mother and father, and thus she tries to give her daughter what she needs. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital and to not lose her customers. Her dream is to open a cosmetics store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Oumou Hawa

texts.fr: Oumou Hawa D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 3 ans et a eu à recevoir 6 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement et à temps. Elle est détentrice d'un restaurant à la gare routière de sa ville et le soir elle vend le dîné à domicile. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumou Hawa D. is 54 years old, married and mother of four children. She has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé2 "Banc Villageois” loan group for the past three years, and has received six previous loans, all repaid in full in a timely manner. She owns a restaurant at her town’s bus station, and in the evening prepares and home-delivers meals. She participates in taking care of her family’s food expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the financing of her commercial activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a new motorbike as transport

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: Larry de 33 años de edad, labora para el MINSA Chontales desde hace 15 años como conductor, tiene 2 niñas de su primer matrimonio, Brittany de 8 años y Yatzari de 5 añitos estudiando primaria y preescolar respectivamente, actualmente vive en union libre con la Sra. Yessi Navarrete quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar.  Anteriormente Larry fue beneficiado con kiva logrando la construccion de un cuarto para sus hijas, ahora esta solicitando su 6to credito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con kiva para poner ceramica a la salita de su casa, embaldozar el cuarto que actualmente es de tierra y si da comprar la puerta de la sala para brindarle mayor seguridad a su vivienda, pues como los 2 trabajan en el dia la casa queda sola y pueden llegar a su casa a robarle lo que con esfuerzo a comprado. Expresa que gracias a los creditos que le han financiado ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y espera poder seguir haciendolo con el apoyo de instituciones como kiva y AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Larry is 33 years old. He has worked for MINSA Chontales for fifteen years as a driver. He has two daughters from his first marriage. Brittany is eight years old and Yatzari is five years old. They are in elementary and preschool respectively. Currently he lives with Mrs. Yessi who helps him with his home expenses. Previously Larry had a loan from KIVA that helped with the construction of a room for his daughters. Now he is asking for his sixth loan. He hopes to continue his relationship with KIVA. He would like to install tile at the entrance of his house. Currently the location has dirt. He would like a door for the living room in order to give his home more security. Since the couple both work during the day the house is empty during this time. Anyone could come to his house and rob it using some effort. He is thankful for the credit that they have financed. He has been able to improve the living conditions for his family. He hopes to continue progressing with the help of institutions such as KIVA and AFODENIC

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile in the living room and tile the bedrooms.

loans.name: Salimatou Djidéré

texts.fr: Salimatou Djidéré D. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 4 ans et a 8 fois de suite bénéficié de crédits. Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés, elle achète sa marchandise en gros et revend au détaille dans son quartier. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salimatou Djidéré D., age 32, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's been a member of the Village Bank in Vélingra Foulbé 2 for four years, and already benefited from eight loans. She sells dyed fabrics, that she buys wholesale and retails in her neighborhood. The profits drawn from this business enables her to help support her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (retailing dyed fabrics)

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es:
Adalicia vive en Barranquilla y se dedica al comercio de mercancía  en general  y  también a la venta de productos y suplementos  naturales para la  salud mediante catálogos; con este propósito está aplicando  a un crédito por valor de $1.000.000, que invertirá en la compra de cobijas, toallas, ropa para damas y caballeros y suplementos naturales de su guía, encargados por sus clientes.
Adalicia, inició su negocio en  el año 1998,  al quedar su cónyuge sin empleo de una empresa donde trabajó por mas e 10 años; ella tomó parte de su liquidación y con el fin de  mejorar el ingreso del hogar, la invirtió en mercancía encargada por sus vecinos,  mercado inicial, que luego se  extendió hacia otros barrios de Barranquilla y también hacia otras actividades   a las que fue llevándola  la misma clientela:  servicio de  llamada a celulares  y a teléfonos fijos, así como también   hacia clientes que están empleados y  que su esposo le recomienda,  pues en la actualidad labora como vigilante; todas estas situaciones confluyeron, para que   mejorara  su  solvencia, poder sufragar los gastos domésticos  y seguir ampliando la microempresa de Adalicia. Ella sueña con que sus dos hijos casados  tengan una casa propia  y también  con  incluir en su negocio el servicios de internet al público,  porque   los clientes se lo han sugerido y ella está apostándole a esta idea en un corto plazo, teniendo en cuenta que en  7 de Abril, su barrio,  se realizan campeonatos  de futbol en la cancha Projunior, justamente  al frente de su casa, situación que hace suponer un buen  potencial comercial en esta zona.
Su  desafío actual es la atención de su madre,  que últimamente ha presentado dificultades de salud física y del lenguaje, combinadas con todas las actividades productivas y domésticas que ponen a prueba la fortaleza que tiene Adalicia pues es una gran mujer.
texts.en:
Adalicia lives in Barranquilla, Colombia, and makes a living selling general supplies and natural health supplements via catalog. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 COP, which she plans to invest in the purchase of blankets, towels, men's and women's clothing, and the natural supplements that her clients have ordered. Adalicia started her business in 1998 after her spouse lost his job at a business where he worked for more than 10 years. She took part of his severance pay and with the goal of improving her household's income, she invested it in stat-up supplies and sold them to her neighbors. Later she extended the business to other neighborhoods of Barranquilla and also attracted the same customers with another activity: offering cellular and land-line calling services, which also attracts workers and people whom her husband has recommended. She is currently working vigilantly to improve her solvency as all these activities converge so she can cover household expenses and further expand her small business. Adalicia dreams of her two married children having their own homes and also hopes to add internet services to her business, which her customers have suggested. She plans on adding it in the near future. Taking into account that her neighborhood, the April 7th barrio, holds soccer tournaments on the field just out front of her home, there is a lot of commercial potential in her area. Her current challenge is caring for her mother, who lately has faced health and language difficulties, which combined with all her business and household activities have tested the strength of Adalicia, who is a great woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, towels, men's and women's clothing, and natural supplements

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nancy C. de 23 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposo es chofer profesional, con el tiene 2 hijos.

Ella empezó vendiendo en un mercado verduras. Cuando obtuvo ingresos suficientes puso un pequeño local para vender granos y víveres. 

Tiene ya 8 años con la tienda de granos, arroz y otros víveres. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00. El Mani lo vende libra a $ 1.5, Garbanzo por libra a $ 1.3, Mate la libra a $ 0.50. Uno de los inconvenientes es la competencia que tiene.

Con el préstamo quiere granos, aceites, shampoo para su negocio. Uno de sus sueños es tener mas locales de venta de granos con empleados.
texts.en:
Nancy C. is 23 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil in a cement home with basic water and electric service. Her husband is a professional chauffeur, and they have two children. Nancy started out selling vegetables at a market, and when she had sufficient funds she set up a small store to sell grains and other provisions, and she now has eight years of experience in the business. She works with the help of her mother every day from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m., selling peanuts at a $1.50 a pound, garbanzo beans at $1.30 a pound and maté at $.50 a pound. One of the inconveniences is the amount of competition she has. With the loan, she plans to purchase grains, oils and shampoo for her business. One of her dreams is to have more stores to sell grains with employees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, oils and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock his store with food products and other items

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María Z. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de helados los que son ofertados por ella misma en el municipio de El Sauce siendo vendidos ambulantemente exponiéndose a la molestia del sol y el cansancio por caminar a diario.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de conos, miel  y sabores para la elaboración de helados y de esta manera continuar ofertándolos en las calles del municipio.
texts.en:
Ana María Z. stands out as a very hardworking woman. She sells ice cream, which she offers for sale in the town of El Sauce. Being a street vendor, she is exposed to the discomfort of working in the sun and exhaustion from walking each day. She is requesting a loan to buy cones, honey and flavors to make ice cream, so that she can continue to offer her products on the streets of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cones, honey and flavors for the production of ice cream

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mas que Vencedoras está ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues capital de la provincia del  Cañar, a 50 km de la ciudad  se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca uno de los sitios más turísticos y  visitados del Ecuador tanto por turistas nacinales como extranjeros, Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos, su gente es cordial y muy amable como nuestras socias que cada día trabajan para dar un mejor presente y futuro a los miembros de  sus familias.

 Martha vive en la comunidad de Zhizhiquin con  su esposo que  trabaja en el aserradero de su propiedad  y con sus cuatro hijos  de 13, 11, 8 y 5 años todos estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, juntos han logrado cimentar su casa propia a base de  mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.

La señora Martha ayuda a su esposo en el aserradero hace trece años y también se dedica a  los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de una vaca que posee. Se enteró de los beneficios de la institución por una amiga del banco comunal y ya lleva diez ciclos como socia,  los créditos le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado   va a comprar madera para tener un stock adecuado para sus clientes, su sueño es incrementar  su negocio  cada día más.
texts.en:
The Mas que Vencedoras (More than Winners) Community Bank is located in the city of Azogues, capital of the province of Cañar. Fifty kilometers from the city are the ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited tourist sites for natives and foreigners in Ecuador. Azogues and Cañar are famous for its craftwork, especially for making straw hats and ceramic products. The people are cordial and very kind, including the community bank members who work hard every day to provide a better present and future to their family. Martha lives in the community of Zhizhiquin with her husband, who works at a sawmill they own, and their four children, ages 13, 11, 8 and 5, who are all in school. Together they have been able to build their own home through a lot of hard work and sacrifice. Martha has helped her husband at the sawmill for the past three years and also dedicates herself to household chores and caring for a cow they own. She heard about the benefits of community banks from a friend who was a member, and has since taken out 10 loans, which has helped her grown her business. With the new loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase wood so she has an adequate supply for her customers. Her dream is to grow her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to have a sufficient supply

loans.name: Porfirio Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio A. es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica a la crianza de ganado en el municipio El Sauce en León donde tiene su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.
Actualmente el señor Porfirio está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de ganado específicamente en la compra de novillos para sacarles el máximo provecho y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su amada familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
Porfirio A. is a hardworking gentleman who raises livestock in the town of El Sauce in León where he has his family, composed of his wife and children. Currently Porfirio is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of livestock. Specifically, he will purchase young bulls so that he can take full advantage of this opportunity, and in this way obtain income to support his beloved family who depends on him.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock and sell cereals

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce, la señora María Emilia C. tiene su propia pulpería que ella misma atiende con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida. Ella ofrece variedad de productos como cosméticos y ropa. Ella siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante y por ello busca el apoyo en los créditos.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito el cuál será invertido directamente en la compra de la mercadería como cosméticos y ropa para surtir la pulpería ya que lo necesita mucho para salir adelante y así mejorar cada vez más el negocio.
texts.en:
María Emilia C. has her own store in El Sauce. She tends to it herself in order to earn income to improve her standard of living. She sells a variety of merchandise like cosmetics and clothes. She has always sought ways to get ahead in life and this is why she seeks help from these loans. Currently, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise like cosmetics and clothes to stock her store; she needs it in order to get ahead and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Olga Amparo

texts.es:
la sra. Olga Amparo H. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Alfonzo XII por la Iglesia de la Ciudad de Danli. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual le a generado ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia y su hogar, olga es una mujer de edad y esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ganarse la vida diariamente. 
tiene muchos clientes ya que la experiencia que posee en la elaboracion de las rosquillas es bastante y les da un sabor muy exquisito.
Olga necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las rosquillas ya que esta teniendo pedidos mas grandes y no le ajusta lo que esta produciendo.
dice sentirse muy feliz porque su producto se esta vendiendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Olga Amparo H. is 53 years old and lives by a church in the Alfonzo XII Barrio in the city of Danli. She makes a living making and selling pastries, which she has done for many years and has been able to generate income to be able to make headway for her family. Olga is an older woman, and this is the only source of income she has for daily living. She has a lot of customers because of her extensive experience in pastry making, and she gives her products a very exquisite taste. Olga is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies to make her pastries since she has been taking very large orders and she is not set up for it. She says she feels very happy because her products are being sold more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, flour, water, lard and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hugo Antonio

texts.es:
Hugo Antonio Jiménez Bermúdez is a veteran client of ADIM.  He lives in Managua with his wife and two children who are both at the age to go to school.  This gentleman who is 32 years old has had his business for four years, he sells plastic goods, cosmetics, and a small number of other products.  
Thanks to his loans with ADIM his business has been improving. With this loan he will work with his wife and purchase more merchandise; cosmetics, bed sheets, and plastic products for the business.
texts.en:
Hugo Antonio Jiménez Bermúdez is a veteran client of Kiva partner ADIM. He lives in Managua, Nicaragua, with his wife and two school-age children. He is 32 years old and has had his business for four years, selling plastic goods, cosmetics and a small number of other products. Thanks to his loans with ADIM, his business has been improving. With this loan, he will work with his wife and purchase more merchandise for the business, such as cosmetics, linens and plastic products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as plastic products, cosmetics, linens, etc.

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es:
El señor Fernando S. se dedica arduamente a laborar en su localidad en el municipio de El Sauce en León porque tiene la necesidad de beneficiar a sus tres hijos que se encuentran en la universidad y debe beneficiarlos con el apoyo en sus estudios.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en el pago de los estudios de sus tres hijos universitarios ya que deben de pagar la universidad y el señor Fernando lo hace con mucho gusto y entusiasmo porque está contribuyendo al desarrollo de sus hijos que en un futuro no muy lejano llegaran a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Fernando S. works hard in El Sauce because he needs to support his three children, who are in the university; he must support them with their education. He is asking for funds to be used directly to pay for his three children's university studies because they must pay tuition. Fernando does this happily and enthusiastically because he is contributing to his children's development so that, in a not too distant future, they may become great professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his children's university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a taxi-moto

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Martha M. dedica sus esfuerzos a la venta de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua donde  a diario ofrece los perecederos a todos los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y que ha sabido llevar el sustento a su hogar en medio de muchas dificultades atravesadas. Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de cebollas, tomates, chiltomas, plátanos, bananos, yuca, quequisque, naranjas, entre otros.

Con dicho crédito se beneficiará grandemente en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Martha M. sells fruits and vegetables in the Wholesale Market in Managua, where she offers her perishables daily to the customers who visit the market. She has distinguished herself as a hardworking woman who has managed to support her household in spite of the numerous difficulties she has faced. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of onions, tomatoes, peppers, plantains, bananas, yucca, taro root, oranges, and other items. This loan will benefit her business tremendously.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mildred Oneyda

texts.es:
la sra. Mildred Oneyda G. Mendoza tiene un año de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de carne de res y venta de charamuscas de leche; actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante.
Su compañero de hogar, después de que sale de las labores de campo, le ayuda a vender las carnes, pues el mismo sale a distribuir en una bicicleta a lugares circunvecinos de la zona de Pozo Bendito.
Mildred se ha sabido ganar la clientela por el buen producto que vende, y por los precios que ella les da.
sus charamuscas son muy sabrosas por esa razon es que muchas personas compran dicho producto ademas que esa zona es muy caliente.
texts.en:
Mildred Oneyda G. Mendoza has sold beef and charamuscas de leche (frozen treat served in a plastic bag) for the past year from home and door-to-door. Her roommate, once he finishes his work in the fields, helps her sell the meat; he goes out to areas neighborhing Pozo Bendito to make deliveries on his bicycle. Mildred has won over her customers through the good product she sells and the prices she charges. Her charamuscas are very tasty and this is why so many people buy them; besides, the weather in this area is very hot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, water, bags, milk, beef.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A., married and the father of two children, received senior high education. For some time now, John has been selling different shapes and sizes of wood for all purposes in Elmina. Some of his customers are carpenters, contractors and the like. His wife is a trader.

John uses his income in payment of school fees, bills and other financial obligations of the family and will use the loan to purchase more wood for resale. With the additional profits from his expanded business, John plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: John will use the loan to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell palm oil

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Adriana A. es propietaria de su propio negocio de ferretería donde ofrece todo tipo de artículos ferreteros y es muy visitada por los clientes por lo que siempre está buscando como lograr su satisfacción para que continúen comprándole los productos.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra útiles escolares para comercializarlos en la ferretería ya que al haberse acercado la época de estudio, ella desea que los clientes que le visitan para comprar los artículos ferreteros también puedan comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adriana A. has a hardware store in Managua's Mayoreo market where she offers all kinds of hardware merchandise; she is visited often by customers who are looking to satisfy their needs buying her products. She will use the funds to buy school supplies to sell in the hardware store because, as the new school term approaches, she wants the customers who come to buy hardware to also be able to buy school supplies for their children at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mighty Power Group

texts.en:
Mighty Power is a group of five borrowers led by Akine S., a 35-year-old single father of a five-year-old child, currently in kindergarten, whom he dreams of providing with a good education. Akine could not continue his education through university due to poverty. He lives in West Point, Monrovia, Liberia, a very crowded community whose high poverty rate pushes its residents to try many different ways to make a living.

For five years, Akine has been selling general goods such as soap and batteries at the Waterside Market. He buys his goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of his community. Because of the wide variety of goods in his shop, customers are encouraged to continue buying from him. Akine will use this loan to purchase more soap and batteries.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Akine, is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more soap and batteries.

loans.name: Nohemi Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. Nohemi Yolanda Z. se dedica al comercio desde hace tres años y su actividad principal es una pulpería y un molino para moler Maíz, negocios que operan bajo el nombre de pulpería y molino “LA BENDICION”.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la zona de el Pozo Bendito y sus clientes son los vecinos de la misma comunidad donde reside, y las personas que viajan a diferentes zonas del valle de Jamastran,  muchos de los viajeros se estacionan para comprar algunas golosinas y seguir el camino. 
En la actualidad, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio, ya que construyo una vivienda y esto la dejo un poco descapitalizada; es por esta razón que ella esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio y asi tener muchas ventas.
texts.en:
Nohemi Yolanda Z. has been in commerce for three years; her main activity consists of a grocery store and corn mill. The business is called: "La Bendicion." It is located on Pozo Bendito's main street and her customers are neighbors from the same vicinity where she lives and people that travel to various areas of Jamastran Valley; many of the travelers park to buy a snack and then continue along their way. Currently, she lacks sufficient funds to better stock her store because she built a house and this left her decapitalized. For this reason, she is asking for funding to stock her store better and so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, lard, cooking oil, beans, tortillas, bread, coffee, rice, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sardines, sauces, pastas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora María U. ha sobresalido por ser una excelente comerciante de ropa ofreciéndola en su localidad y siempre velando por el bienestar y sustento de su negocio que tanto le ha costado desarrollar.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa en especial ropa de interior y por este motivo ella espera que el crédito le sea otorgado porque le es de suma necesidad el invertir en la ropa para su respectiva venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
María U. is an outstanding clothing merchant in Managua's Mayoreo market; she is always looking to her business's wellbeing and support because it was such a struggle to develop it. Currently, she is asking for funding to buy clothing, especially underwear. She hopes the loan will be granted because it is of utmost necessity to invest in the clothing for its eventual sale in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Dora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dora S. de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 8 años. 

Ella empezó vendiendo artículos para casas. Cuando obtuvo ingresos suficientes puso un pequeño negocio de medicamentos y productos para laboratorios. 

Tiene ya 8 años  la farmacia vende medicinas de todo tipo y productos para laboratorios. Trabaja sola desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días.  Uno de los inconvenientes es la delincuencia que hay en su sector y ahora las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicamentos, bebidas y cereales para implementarlos como nuevas cosas en la farmacia. Uno de sus sueños en un futuro es tener otra farmacia.
texts.en:
Dora is 46 years old and lives in the suburbs on the perimeter of Guayaquil. She has a cement house, which has water and basic electrical service. She is a single mother with an eight-year-old son. She started her business by selling household furnishings. When she had earned sufficient income she began a small business selling medications and products for laboratories. For the past eight years her pharmacy has sold all types of medicines and laboratory products. She works alone from 7am until 9pm everyday. One of the inconveniences is the crime in her sector and also the rains. With this loan she want to buy medications, drinks and cereals in order to increase the new items in the pharmacy. One of her dreams for the future is to have another pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medications, drinks and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is a blacksmith. He’s 27 years old and still unmarried. He went to school and passed the intermediate-level exam. 

He needs this loan to enlarge his shop, to hire more employees, and to raise his income, and to get as many clients as possible. He is known to a reputable person among his peers. He gained a lot of experience in his field. 

He will use this loan to purchase materials, such as an iron welder, a generator and the other necessities of blacksmithing.

loans.use: To buy an iron welder and a generator

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Muy alegre atiende a sus clientes la señora Juana A. en el Mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece frutas y verduras de todo tipo a los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de verduras para la venta, específicamente para la compra de chayotes para comercializarlos y de esta manera generar ingresos para el sustento de su hogar ya que su familia depende de ella.
texts.en:
Juana A. very cheerfully tends to her customers at the Mayoreo market; she offers all types of fruits and vegetables to customers that visit the market. She is asking for funding to buy vegetables, specifically chayotes (alligator pear), to sell and generate income to support her family who depend on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a new generator and remodel the video center

loans.name: Tamara Group

texts.en:
The Tamara Group is new to ADIM. The woman are María Francisca Z., Josefa Mercedes F. G., and Julia Marcelina C. Sánchez. The coordinator of the group is Z.; she sells ice cream, cold drinks, and juices, and has a small food stand where she makes fried foods.

Josefa sells beverages, ice cream, and chocolate bananas, and Julia sells nacatamales, which is a typical Nicaraguan food, like a tamale filled with pork, peppers, onion, tomato, potato, and rice. The women will use the loans to purchase more products and ingredients for their respective businesses so they are able to produce and earn more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like basic grains, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Presentación

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Presentación, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 14, 4 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia trabaja con la artesanía, ella hace bisutería, realiza trabajos en alpaca y plata, níquel la socia hace joyas (pulseras, aretes, collares, pendientes y otros), Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para compra materiales de trabajo como son alambres de alpacas, de platas y de níquel, cuarzos y piedras pulidas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Presentación is a member of “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank, which is in Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 38 years old and lives with her life partner and their three children, who are 19, 14, and 4 years of age. She is an artisan; she makes articles in alpaca cloth and costume jewelry (bracelets, earrings, necklaces, pendants, etc.) in silver and nickel. She is asking for funding to buy supplies like: alpaca, silver, nickel, quartz and polished stones. She is grateful for the opportunity offered and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.
