Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wire, beads, quartz, polished stones, etc.

loans.name: Sincere Business Organization Group

texts.en:
Sincere Business is a group of 5 borrowers led by Boakai S.. He is 41 years old and is single with two children. One of his children is one month old, and the other is one year old. Boakai is a high-school graduate but could not continue his education beyond that due to a lack of financial support.

He and his family live in the Cow Factory Community, Jamaica Road, on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. He sells from a table on Randall Street in central downtown Monrovia. Boakai’s business is the sale of cosmetics. He buys wholesale and sells retail to customers. He has been running this business for more than 5 years and hopes to become a big business man. Boakai started by selling children's toys with funds given to him by his mother. In his business, he faces the challenge of a shortage of funds to use as working capital. He encourages customers by selling quality goods, and a good manner of approach. Boakai needs this loan to purchase more cosmetics for resale.

He dreams of giving his children a good future by sending them to school, and wants to build a cosmetics store.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Boakai is the one holding the sign. Uriah D. is inset at the lower right. This is the second time that the Sincere Business Organization has been listed for funding on Kiva, but the first time with Boakai as the group's leader. The prior listing for the group is at http://partners.kiva.org/lend/140043.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Ysela Yaneth

texts.es: YSELA TIENE 38 AÑOS, ELLA ES UNA CLIENTE CON UN BUEN MANEJO DEL NEGOCIO, UA QUE TIENEUNA AMPLIA  EXPERIENCIA,ELLA ES SOLTERA Y NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, SU NEGOCIO ES DE VENTA DE DIVERSOS PRODUCTOS COMO RECORREDORA, ES DOCENTE DE PROFESIÓN PERO A LA FECHA NO EJERCE, SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO Y ASI DE ESTA MANERA PODER IR CRECIENDO Y PODER CUMPLIR CON EL SUEÑO DE TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL Y ASI PODER TENER MAYORES INGRESOS QUE LE AYUDEN CON LA MANUTENCION DE SUS PADRES. SE LE PROPONE EL CRÉDITO POR CONTAR CON CAPACIDAD Y VOLUNTAD DE PAGO, ADEMAS DE SUS BUENAS REFERENCIAS PEROSNALES, EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE.
texts.en:
Ysela is 38 years old. She is a client with a good understanding of business. She has a lot of experience. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives in a house with her parents. Her business involves the selling of diverse products as a roving salesperson. She is experienced in her profession but until now she has not asked for a loan to be used to invest in her business. With this loan she could continue growing her business and reach her dream of having her own business location. If she had a fixed location she would have a greater income. This income could help support her parents She is asking for this loan knowing she has the will and capacity to repay it. In addition she has good personal references from the zone where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mercandise

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
A raíz de mucho esfuerzo, el señor Marlon G. ha logrado suplir su tienda general de variedad de productos en el mercado Mayoreo donde abre desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana con el fin de obtener ingresos para reinvertir en el negocio y también para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles y azúcar para continuar ofreciéndolos en el negocio y así suplir las necesidades de sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Marlon G., through much effort, has managed to stock his general store, located in the Mayoreo market, with a variety of products. He opens for business very early in the morning in order to generate income to reinvest in the business and to provide support for his home. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy rice, beans and sugar to continue to have them on hand so that he can meet the needs of his customers that visit him daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower runs a machine shop. He is 27 years old and married, and he completed the primary level of education. He wants this loan to buy tools for his shop, such as a lathe, and the other necessities. He wants to hire an employee to help him in his shop. He has been working in this field for almost seven years.

loans.use: To buy a generator and lathe

loans.name: Francia Nelia

texts.es:
la sra. Francia Nelia R. Lara se dedica desde hace ocho años a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación y las distribuye a dueños de pulpería de la comunidad donde ella reside.
Doña Francia actualmente esta elaborando su producto tres veces por semana, ya que su clientela va creciendo dia a dia, y la demanda de su producto es mas grande.
Francia nos comento que cuando inicio solo lo hacia una vez por semana y en cantidades pequeñas.
Los clientes prefieren su producto por la higiene con que son elaboradas y por el tamaño que les da y sobre todo el buen sabor que tienen.
Francia necesita el credito para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que esta es su unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Francia Nelia R. Lara has been dedicated to making and selling doughnuts for eight years, an activity that she carries out in her house. She distributes the doughnuts to owners of stores in the community where she resides. Señora Francia currently makes her products three times a week, since her clientele is growing day to day, and the demand for her products is greater. Francia teslls us that; when she started she only made doughnuts in small quantities once a week. The clients prefer her product because of the cleanliness with with she makes her doughnuts, their size and above all the good flavor that they have. Francia needs the loan to be able to do well and to have a better quality of life since this is the only source of income that she has to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, cheese, lard, firewood, and water for making doughnuts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin C. is a tailor and sells zippers, thread, fabrics and other sawing supplies at Elmina.  Benjamin has received a senior high school education. He is single and has one child.

Benjamin has been a tailor, and has been selling zippers, rope and fabric, for some time now. He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to buy more pins, needle, thread and other sewing materials to aid him in his work. He hopes to use any new profits from his business to save to save for his child's education, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more pins, needle, thread and other sewing materials for use in sewing work.

loans.name: Fe Y Vida Group

texts.en:
The Fe and Vida Group is a new group to Kiva field partner ADIM.  The coordinator is Señora Dominga Hernández, she is 53 years old, she began selling various things when she was young.  She currently sells broth, stew, soup, and also she creates handmade art and paintings. Dominga will use the credit to strengthen her existing business and to develop a business of selling clothing. 

Brenda F., another member of the group, has a small business selling fried foods from a street cart and on the weekends she sells food from her home. And the third member of the group is Sandra Cantarero, she used to sell tortillas, which is an exhausting job, so she has recently transitioned and begun selling cosmetics.

loans.use: As working capital for an existing business, and to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Keelin Ibeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Keelin Ibeth M. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa y calzado nuevo; actividad en la que cuenta con seis años de experiencia.
Doña Keelin, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender su producto se manera ambulante en diferentes colonias de la ciudad de Danlí, pero ahora ella tiene seis meses de estar ubicada en un puesto que alquila en el Bulevar y dice que sus ventas han mejorado.
Cabe mencionar, que donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio, es una de las calles mas transitadas por la población de este municipio, especialmente por las personas de las zonas rurales ya que esta calle es la que conduce al centro de la ciudad.
En la actualidad la Sra. Keelin M., no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio y en especial de todo lo que se necesita para esta época escolar, razón por la cual nos esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Señora Keelin Ibeth M. is dedicated to commerce and her main activity is the sale of clothes and new footwear, an activity in which she has six years of experience. Señora Keelin was previously dedicated to selling her product on foot in different colonies of the city of Danlí, but now she is located in a stall that she has rented on the Boulevard for six months and she says that her sales have improved. It should be mentioned that the location where her business is found is one of the streets that is most traveled by the population of this municipality, especially by the people of the rural zones, since this street is the one that leads to the center of the city. Currently Señora Keelin M. does not have sufficient working capital to supply her business with more merchandise, especially everything that is needed for this school term, which is the reason she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes for resale, especially for the new school term

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joaquín Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín Ramiro R. M., tiene 54 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa trabaja en los quehaceres domésticos, ellos tienen 2 hijos y labora como gestor de cobro en Casa Terán para el departamento de medicina.

Dentro de los principales problemas que poseen como familia esta, la delincuencia que amenaza a los pobladores del vecindario, es por esta razón que la familia tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la construcción de un muro al frente de su casa, esto con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad a la familia y darle un aspecto más presentable a la fachada de la vivienda.
Ellos son una familia unida que dentro de las prioridades tienen la remodelación de su hogar para poder brindarle a su familia un lugar más cómodo pero sobretodo seguro a cada uno de los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Señor Joaquín Ramiro R. M. is 54 years age and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married and his wife works doing household chores. They have 2 children and he works as a collection agent in Casa Terán for the department of medicine. The main problems they have as a family is the delinquency that threatens the people of the neighborhood. It is for this reason that the family made the decision to request a loan for the construction of a wall at the front of his house, with the main objective of giving security to the family and giving a more presentable aspect to the facade of the dwelling. They are a united family whose priorities include the restructuring of their home to be able to offer their family a more comfortable place and above all, safety to each one of the members of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wall in front of their home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur sells spare parts. He is 19 years old. He has a good reputation among his friend, specifically in his field of business. He has a lot of experience in his job. He has many clients due to the good quality of his spare parts. 

He is taking this loan to raise his average income and enlarge his shop, as well. It seems that he is a good bread-winner, because he is still young and has a lot of ambitions ahead.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Enrique Camilo

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce el señor Enrique Camilo R. se desempeña como un pequeño agricultor donde comercializa leche de sus propios animales de su finca ubicada en el caserío Esquipulas del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene alrededor de 50 años de experiencia en esta labor.
Ha tomado la decisión de hacer una cerca en su finca y es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito el cuál será invertido en la compra de alambres para utilizarla en la cerca y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su finca que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Enrique Camilo R. is a small farmer in El Sauce. He sells milk from his own animals on his farm that is in the Esquipulas settlement of El Sauce. He has about 50 years experience in this work. He has decided to build a fence on his farm and needs funds to do so; the money will be used to buy wire fencing so that his farm's, which so needs his attention, conditions will be improved

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wire fencing for his farm.

loans.name: Proyecto Group

texts.es:
Each of the female entrepreneurs in this group has the desire to support and better themselves. The coordinator of the Proyecto Group is Alexandra Yuliza L. P.. She has a fried food business where she sells popular food like carne asada, sliced enchiladas with cheese, and more.  She does this from her home so she can also manage her business refurnishing gates, windows, tables, and chairs.

María Auxiliadora L. González and Margina Elizabeth M. Rodríguez are also in this group. María runs a general store, and Margina sells pork which is very popular in Nicaragua.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Villa Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa Concepción”tiene  mas D. 2 años D. formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya , sus  integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas,pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 4 señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta D. frutas y verduras , venta D. comestibles artesanales como empanadas D. carne ,empanadas D. pollo ,empanadas D. jamón y queso ,venta D. mercaderías varias como :fideo ,azúcar , harina ,aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos ,venta D. ropas , venta D. remedios etc. 
Todas las integrantes del comité trabaja mucho con deseo D. brindar a sus hijos un futuro mejor  facilitando los materiales para su desarrollo y formación ya sea en cuanto a la educación, salud , vivienda.    
Así como todas las integrantes la señora Margarita realiza un trabajo muy sacrificado como los es la venta ropas en forma ambulante esto significa recorrer las casa D. los clientes.
Las actividades que realizan las clientas son:
texts.en:
The “Villa Concepción” group has been together for more than two years and works with Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of its members have already maD. progress with their businesses, but four are just beginning. Members of the group sell a variety of items. These incluD. fruits and vegetables, homemaD. foods such as meat, chicken, ham, and cheese empanandas, general merchandise such as pasta, sugar, wheat, cooking oil, soap, etc., clothing, and natural medicines. All of the members of the group work hard to proviD. a better future for their children, fulfilling their needs for education, good health, and home so that they can develop properly. Margarita is a member of the group who, like all of the members, makes sacrifices to get ahead. She visits the homes of her customers to sell them clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer clothing including dresses, t-shirts, shorts, and tank tops

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
el señor Luis Armando O. P. tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene dependientes,  vive con sus padres y se dedica al negocio de salon de belleza y cosmetologia, esta acividad la realiza desde hace 37 años y dice que le va muy bien con este negocio.
A podido ayudar a sus padres y sacar adelante a sus hermanos, esta solicitando el credito para la compra de tintes, cosmeticos y algunos accesorios que le faltan para su negocio.
 
el señor Luis el viaja todo los dias para su trabajo, comento que ese trabajo es su pasion que lo disfruta cuando lo realiza y que se siente bien consigo mismo, es una persona que no le gustan mucho las deudas, es honesto.
texts.en:
Luis Armando O. P. is 51 years old, single, lives with his parents, and does not have any dependents. For 37 years he has had a beauty salon and has done very well with this business. He has been able to help his parents and siblings get ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase hair dye, make-up, and other items needed for his business. Luis works every day at his job. But, he says that it is his passion and he truly enjoys it and it makes him feel good about himself. He is an honest person who does not like to have debts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dyes and other items for beauty salon

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cecelia will use the loan to purchase more maize and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of shoes and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make a coffee plant nursery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling charcoal

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna M. sells cloths and cooking utensils at Abura.  Memuna has a senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Memuna has been selling cloth for some time now. She is responsible supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls, clothing and other items which are highly demanded for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls, clothing  and other items for resale

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Concepción P. D., tiene 34 años de edad vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, es madre de 4 hijos, todos bajo su dominio y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su marido el cual trabaja como guarda de  seguridad.

Ella se dedica a vender productos de medicina Omnilife, ella los vende de manera ambulante y tiene establecido sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos que le traiga mejores ingresos para nuevas proyecciones o fuentes de trabajo que se planifiquen para un futuro tales como el montaje de una nueva empresa de distribución de esta marca, que tendría prevista instalar a un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción P. D. is 34 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is the mother of 4 dependent children and has the unconditional support of her husband, who is a security guard. Maria sells Omnilife medical products. She sells them from door-to-door and has an established clientele. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory so that she can increase her income and begin making plans for new business ventures. In the near future she would like to become an Omnilife distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Lucia Anabel

texts.es:
la sra. Lucia Anabel P. L. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Bella Orizonte, el Triunfo Choluteca, Lucia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser camisas, camisetas, blusas, toallas, pantalones, jeans, calsonetas, ropa de niños, ropa interior para dama y caballero, calsetines etc. 
tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, en estos momentos Lucia necesita el credito para comprar ropa y zapatos escolares ya que el periodo de clases comenzo y muchos padres necesitan comprar los uniformes y el calzado para sus hijos y ella no tiene el capital suficiente para comprar dichos productos.
texts.en:
Lucia Anabel P. L. is 37 years old and lives in the Bella Orizonte area of Triunfo in the Choluteca region. Lucia sells new clothing, including shirts, t-shirts, blouses, towels, pants, jeans, shorts, children's clothes, underwear, and socks. Lucia runs her business from her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and shoes, as the new school year is beginning and many parents need to buy uniforms and school shoes for their children and she does not have enough capital to buy the required merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and school shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marie Alphonsine

texts.fr: Marie Alphonsine est une femme de 64 ans, est mariée et a la charge de ses 3 petits fils et de 2 autres enfant qui lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle fait la transformation et vente de céréales, la vente de bouillie de farine de mil et de bois de chauffe. Elle participe aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Alphonsine, age 64, is married and has to support her three grandsons, as well as two other children. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO for eight and one half years. She transforms cereals, and sells cereals, millet porridge, and firewood. She takes part in supporting her family's various expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
1.Este comité se formó en el Barrio San lorenzo de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, la Sra. Zulma Valentina S. quien conoció el Programa a travez de las promocioners realizadas por la zona, y habiendo muchas interesadas en su cuadra  decidierón a participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, son 16(diez y seis) mujeres trabajadoras, las mismas con mucho entusiasmo se reunierón con el fín  de formar un grupo solidario en donde la responsabilidad era conjunta y  el trabajo de equipo. 
Una de las integrantes del comite es la señora Zulma quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad comenzó despues de iniciarse el comite. Actualmente la señora Zulma trabaja en salón que tiene frenta a casa, donde expone todas las mercaderías que tiene para la venta.
Ella tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar y su marido se dedica a la albañilería(construcción de casa), así los dos son muy sacrificados, pero luchan y salen adelante con mucha satisfacción ya que sus todos sus hijos estan culminando satisfactoriamente con sus estudios que es el sueño de Doña Zulma y su marido.
Ella agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda mutua que le brinda a ella y a sus socias.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the San Lorenzon neighborhood in Caaguazu City. Mrs. Zulma Valentina S. became familiar with the program through some promotions in her neighborhood; since there were many interested women on her block, they decided to form the Enterprising Women Group. The group consists of 16 hard-working women who enthusiastically got together to form a group with joint responsibility that depended on teamwork. One group member, Zulma, began to work selling clothing after becoming part of the group. Currently zulma sells the clothes out of the front room of her home where she displays her merchandise for sale. She has 4 school-aged children and her husband is a contractor for home construction. They are two self-sacrificing individuals who fight to help their family; they are very pleased that their children are doing well in school which is a major goal for Zulma and her husband. She is grateful to the Foundation for the support provided to her and her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and sweatshirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food preparation and sales

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Julia S. tiene la edad de 34 años, es comerciante desde hace 4 años, antes de obtener el negocio era estudiante de cocina y a la vez vendía comida ambulante, hoy en día se dedica al comercio y tiene una pulpería en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa de donde ella es originaria, vende todo lo que es granos, enlatados, leche, salsas, etc. Este negocio lo obtuvo porque anteriormente era de su mamá, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijos que están en la edad escolar.
Doña Julia trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 5 años y todos sus créditos han sido para invertir en su negocio, ya que esto le ha permitido mantener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Julia S., 34, has been a merchant for the past 4 years. Prior to getting her business she was studying cooking and peddled prepared food. Today, she is in commerce and has a grocery store in Chinandega's municipal market, which is where she's from. She sells all kinds of grains, canned goods, milk, sauces, etc. She got this business because it used to be her mother's. She has a partner and two, school-age children. Julia has collaborated with Ceprodel for 5 years now; she has used all her loans to invest in her business because this has helped her have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur runs a grocery store. He’s a 21-year-old young boy who has passed intermediate school. 

He will use this loan to purchase supplies and a vertical refrigerator, and to improve his shop. His income will rise as a result of this loan. He has a good reputation in the district and has a lots of ambitions and goals in his life.

loans.use: To buy supplies and a vertical refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items for a small general store such as batteries, candles, salt, bouillon cubes, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jorge Martín

texts.es:
Jorge Martín Z. C., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos, pero vive solo con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría y la alimentación de los mismos. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jorge tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge Martín Z. C., 39, lives with his life partner. He has two children but he only lives with his wife. He needs funds to buy supplies and remodel his pigsty. In addition, he wants to buy some pigs to raise and feed for them. The idea is to provide proper care for the pigs so that they will produce the best possible sales price when they are sold. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms given. Jorge has been in the business of raising pigs for many years. He hopes to provide his family with better cuality of life and economic stability in the future and to continue to develop both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and make improvements to the pigsties.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette M. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 25 prêts qu'elle a chaque fois bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est teinturière, elle achète du tissu blanc, le teint pour revendre à la population locale. Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à prendre en charge sa famille et à subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Maguette M., age 50, is a widow and lives with her three children, whom she has to support. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO for 12 years, and already benefited from 25 loans. All loans were well managed and repaid on time. She's a dyer, who buys white fabric to dye and resell to the local population. With her profits, she manages to support her family and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sustain her business (dying and selling fabric)

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.en: This committee is based in the Empalado Ari neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú.  Juana Sisinia B., who discovered the program through her neighbor, is the president of another group, and as she sensed significant interest in her neighborhood she decided to form a group to participate in the Women Entrepreneurs Program.  The group is comprised of 24 hardworking women who want to get ahead in life.  They have formed this group to support each other in their work.  Nevertheless the women work independently selling clothing, shoes and food.  They will receive loans of the following amounts: 1,000,000 gs, 800,000 gs, 600,000 gs, 500,000 gs and 300,000 gs to invest in their businesses.  They all hope to support their family with this loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flower, eggs, oil, sweets, noodles, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, cheese

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur sells household products. He is 53 years old and married, and he has six children. He opened this shop in his house to be the source of income for his family. He has a good reputation in the district and a kind and delicate style of the bargaining with his customers. As a result, he is the best at selling household supplies to the neighbors and the passersby. He is the breadwinner of a huge family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and a refrigerator

loans.name: Léa Sabine

texts.fr: Léa Sabine N. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 5 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 11 prêts qui lui ont servi à développer son activité de restauration. A côté de cette activité de restauration elle vend des bijoux, des sacs à main pour dame, des chaussures etc. Avec ses bénéfices elle assure le payement de la scolarité de son enfant de 10ans et augmente son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Léa Sabine N., age 36, is married and the mother of 2 children. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO for five and one half years, and already benefited from 11 loans who helped her bolster her food-serving business. In addition, she also sells jewelry, women's handbags, shoes, etc. With her profits, she pays her ten-year-old child's school expenses, and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her food-serving business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo R. M., tiene la edad de 42 años, está divorciado, y vive con la mamá y una hermana. No tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almácigo de café, de la variedad veranero, la idea es aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Guillermo cuenta con una hectárea de café con un suelo con buenas condiciones para este cultivo. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Guillermo también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Guillermo R. M. is 42 years old, divorced, and lives with his mother and a sister. He doesn’t have any children. He will use the loan to buy coffee seedlings, of the summer variety, with the idea of augmenting his production capacity and the area he can farm. Guillermo has one hectare of land that has an excellent base for this type of crop. He wants to give it proper maintenance so it yields a high quality product that will provide a greater profit at harvest time. This is his first time requesting a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very content with the opportunities they provide for him. Guillermo has also worked for many years in agriculture. He hopes to improve his standard of living in the future, and have a more stable financial situation, so he can continue to grow both as a person and as a farmer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming assistance (to buy coffee seedlings).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a grocery store. He’s 26 years old and single, and he passed the primary level of school.  

The purpose of this loan is to develop and enlarge his store and and to buy groceries, such as canned food and miscellaneous foods, to sell to his customers. He has been working for five years and has raised his income and the income of his parents, as well. This young guy has a lot of ambitions in his life. He can manage to achieve his goal through this profession. He has earned a fine reputation despite his young age. His shop is full of ready-to-eat food and all the neighbors are shopping at his store.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for his shop

loans.name: Pilar Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Pilar S. tiene la edad de 44 años se dedica a la venta de bolsas plásticas en el mercado municipal desde hace 12 años, antes de tener este negocio ella vendía miel de jicote y semilla de jícaro y de esta forma se ganaba la vida, su negocio lo inicio porque su tía la insto a que pusiera esta venta ya que también ella (la tía) se dedica a este mismo negocio. Doña pilar es madre soltera y con 2 hijos a los cuales ella les mantiene sus estudios.
Trabaja con Ceprodel desde el 2006 y se le han otorgado 16 créditos hasta la fecha, los cuales han sido para invertir en el negocio y poder tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que los créditos han sido de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Pilar S. is 44 years old, and has dedicated herself to selling plastic bags at the local market for 12 years. Before starting this business she earned a living by selling honey and gourd seeds. She started her enterprise at the suggestion of an aunt, who was also in this line of business. Pilar is a single mother with 2 children who she supports in their studies. She has been working with Ceprodel since 2006 and, to date, she has been granted 16 loans that she has invested into her business. This help has allowed her to improve her standard of living, and the loans have been a great help to her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various sizes of plastic bags.

loans.name: Antonio Andrey

texts.es:
Antonio Andrey M. P., tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos.Vive con sus padres y dos hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área de pasto idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Antonio Andrey tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Antonio Andrey M. P. is 20 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents and two brothers. The loan he wants is to purchase some calves and livestock feed. He wants to be able to maintain them well, so that he can earn a greater profit when he goes to sell them. He would also like to augment the number of animals he has, and to care for them under better conditions. He has a small area of grassland that is ideal for raising livestock. This is the first time he requests a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very content with the opportunities they have provided for him. In the future, he hopes to improve his family’s standard of living, to have greater financial stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a rancher. About FUDECOSUR:  The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Adji

texts.fr: Adji S. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est divorcée et vit sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis le 26 juillet 2007 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et de parfums et ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer sa nourriture et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Adji S., age 36, is a divorcee and lives without children. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO since July 26, 2007, and already benefited from five loans. All loans were well managed and repaid on time. She resells fabrics and perfumes, and her profits enable her to buy food and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her investment capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Help for his farm

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca V. tiene 57 años y está casada por más de 30 años, La señora se dedica a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases de productos lácteos, y su esposo además de ayudar con la producción de leche también se dedica a la siembra de diferentes productos en la zona de Chapare, como ser banano y palmito.

La señora Francisca  vive en la zona de Itocta en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubrimos que existen muchos productores de leche cruda en pequeña escala, y nos cuentan que el alimento para ganado lechero subió mucho este último mes por los diferentes problemas climáticos por los que estuvo pasando Bolivia. Por lo tanto la señora Francisca utilizara este crédito para la compra de alimento para su ganado lechero (soya y alimento balanceado) para que sus vacas no sufran de es escases de alimento, y su producción lechera no se vea afectada. 

La señora Francisca nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como siempre lo hizo, ver a sus hijos y nietos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para dejarles una herencia a sus hijos que les ayude en la vida. Que cada vez está más dura en el país.
texts.en:
Francisca V. is 57 years old and has been married for more than 30 years. She produces milk to sell to a company that markets a wide range of dairy products. Her husband helps her with the production of milk and also grows a variety of crops, such as bananas and hearts of palm, in the Chapare area. Francisca lives in the Itocta area of Cochabamba. As her home is far from the center of the city it is difficult for her to go to banks in search of loans. Luckily, CIDRE took the initiative to go to her area and discovered that there were many small producers of raw milk in the area who were having problems because the price of feed for milk cows had increased in the last month due to poor weather conditions in Bolivia. Therefore, Francisca will use this loan to purchase feed for her dairy cows so that they do not suffer from a lack of food and their production will not be affected. Francisca's dream is to continue producing milk as she has always done, to see her children and grandchildren have bright futures, and to one day have earned enough to be able to leave her children an inheritance that will help them in life, as conditions in her country are becoming more and more difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 45 year old mother of three children who go to school. She has been running “Hellys Dressmaking” Shop dealing in tailoring and dressmaking. She has been in business for 13 years and she has been doing well. She says that since joining Faulu Kenya, her business has grown tremendously. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 80,000 to add stock of fabric for her business. She hopes to become a designer and own a dressmaking school as well as produce high quality products. She describes herself as hardworking, focused and visionary.

loans.use: Add stock of fabric

loans.name: Las Soñadoras De Jilo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Soñadoras D. Jilo, porque las clientas son originarias del Municipio D. Jilotepec y comentan para ellas este crédito es como un sueño porque tienen una oportunidad D. crecimiento, lo que implica para ellas y sus hijos un mejor futuro. Está ubicado en Jilotepec en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por 10  integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Bibiana S. Avedaño es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudio una carrera técnica en Cultora D. Belleza, es estilista y tiene una hija D. 7 años. Ella se dedica a su estética, que inicio hace 9 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes, peróxidos, maquinas y accesorios para su negocio.

Martha D. Jesús B. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el sexto año D. Primaria, es Comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. cocteles D. frutas que inició hace 2 años y además también venD. Tupperware. Solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y recipientes desechables para los cocteles que venD.. La señora inicia su jornada laboral a partir D. las 5:00 am todos los días, prepara su fruta y sale a las calles a venderla en su triciclo, aprovecha el tiempo también para mostrar a la gente su catalogo D. toper y así atender sus dos negocios al mismo tiempo. La señora Martita como todos la conocen vive día con día una constante lucha por la supervivencia y la superación, ella es el sustento D. su hogar ya que tiempo atrás su esposo empezó a perder la vista progresivamente y no se explicaban porque, apenas hace unas semanas, le diagnosticaron al señor “Diabetes” y debido a las consecuencias D. la enfermedad él ya no pueD. trabajar. El hijo D. doña Martita esta estudiando la Licenciatura y trabajando ya que los ingresos D. su madre no son suficientes para el sustento D. la casa y la escuela, sin embargo doña Martita tiene un gran temor porque no quisiera que su hijo truncara su carrera por dedicarse al trabajo y aunque ella a pasado por momentos D. frustración en su vida esto no le impiD. seguir su lucha en busca D. un mejor porvenir. Al momento D. solicitar este crédito se muestra muy entusiasta porque es un apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio y así mismo obtener mayores ganancias y mejores ingresos para su hogar. Quiere este crédito para continuar con la venta D. cocteles y también espera a un plazo no muy lejano, nos platica, poder tener un local establecido que le permita continuar con sus ventas sin tener que sufrir las condiciones climáticas y tener también la posibilidad D. auto emplear a su familia.
texts.en:
They call themselves the Las Soñadoras D. Jilo, the Dreamers of Jilo, because they are all from Jilotepec, Mexico and share the idea that to them, microcredit is like a dream that gives them the opportunity to grow and create a better future for themselves and their children. The group is composed of 10 women. This is their first time requesting a loan from CrediComún. Bibiana S. Avedaño is the president of the group. She is 26 years old and went to school to become a beautician. She works as a stylist and has a 7-year-old daughter. She started her own business 9 years ago. Bibiana is requesting a loan to purchase hair dyes, peroxides, machines and accessories for her business. Martha D. Jesús B., known as "Martita," is 46 years old and completed her schooling until the 6th graD.. She is a vendor and has two children - a daughter and a son. Two years ago, she started selling fruit cocktails and tupperware. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and disposable containers for the fruit cocktails she sells. Martita begins her work at 5 am everyday. She prepares the fruit and leaves her house to sell the cocktails from her cart on the street. She also uses her time outsiD. to show people her catalogue of tupperware. In this way, she can attend to both of her businesses at the same time. Martita, just like everyone she knows, lives day-to-day in a constant fight for survival and for the improvement of her situation. She has been the primary breadwinner for her household ever since her husband began to progressively lose his vision some time back. His loss of vision went unexplained until a few weeks ago, when he was diagnosed with diabetes. Due to the effects of the disease, he is no longer able to work. Martita's son is studying for his degree and also working, since his mother's earnings are insufficient to support the household and pay for his education. Martita is afraid because she does not want her son to quit his studies to work full-time. Although there have been moments of frustration in her life, they have not stopped Martita from continuing her struggle for a better future. She is very enthusiastic about her loan request because it will help her to expand her business and at the same time obtain larger profits and a better income for her home. She is requesting this loan so she can continue to sell her fruit cocktails and possibly open a fixed locale, hopefully in the near future. A more permanent location would enable her to continue her sales without having to endure the weather conditions and would also give her the possibility of employing her family members.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and disposable containers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 46 year old mother of one. She has a business selling new clothes in Nairobi, a business she has been running for ten years. She says that she has gained financial independence since joining Faulu Kenya. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 60,000 to add stock such as trousers, shirts and shoes. She hopes to grow her business into wholesale and own several textile shops in Limuru. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Felicia Aquilina

texts.es:
La señora Felicia Aquilina es una mujer luchadora, tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad académica la menor que está en la fotografía junto con ella tiene 1 año y 5 meses de edad, conoce a EDAPROSPO desde hace 4 años, se dedica a brindar servicios de costura y confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 3 años además día a día se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 2 años, nos cuenta que se inicio ayudando a su cuñada y logro aprender y decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse una máquina de coser, materiales para su negocio, una refrigeradora y un ropero, sus ingresos cubren la educación de sus hijos y la inversión en su negocio. Felicia nos cuenta que su gran sueño es tener su propio taller y administrarlo.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de telas para la confección de camisas. Felicia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por apoyar a todas las personas con bajos recursos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicia Aquilina, 40, is a go-getter and a married woman with 3 children. The youngest, who is next to her in the photograph, is a 1 year and 5 months old; the others are school-aged. She became acquainted with EDAPROSPO 4 years ago. She has had a business providing seamstress services and making garments for 3 years. In addition, over the last 2 years she has been gradually developing a business selling beauty products. She tells us that she started out helping her sister-in-law and managed to learn and decided to work independently. With her daily efforts she has managed to buy herself a sewing machine, materials for her business, a refrigerator and a wardrobe. Her income pays for the education of her children and is used to invest in the business. Felicia tells us that her biggest dream is to own and manage her own workshop. The loan recently granted will be invested in the purchase of fabrics for the production of shirts. Felicia is very grateful to the lenders for supporting all of the people of limited means and in this way improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shirts

loans.name: Tatiana Marcela

texts.es:
Tatiana M. de 22 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. No tiene cargas familiares.

Ella empezó hace 5 años atrás, cuando todavía por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna panadería. Compro primero un horno y una vitrina pequeña.

Ahora Tatiana tiene un local para su panadería bien surtido. Trabaja desde las 05h00 hasta las 21h00 elaborando panes y tortas. La delincuencia del sector es una de las dificultades que siempre esta en su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, azúcar y mantequilla para elaborar más masa de pan. En el futuro quiere tener empleados para la panadería de dedicarse a su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Tatiana M. is 22 years old and lives in a suburban area of Fortín de Guayaquil in a cement home with basic water and electric services. She doesn't have any family responsibilities. Tatiana started out working five years ago when there wasn't a single bakery in her area. She first bought an oven and a small display case. Now Tatiana has her own shop for her well-stocked bakery. She works from 5 a.m. until 9 p.m. baking breads and cakes. Crime in the area is one of the difficulties her business is always facing. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase flour, sugar and butter to make more bread dough. In the future she wants to have employees at the bakery so she can have her own beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and butter

loans.name: Alfredo Alejandro

texts.es:
El joven Alfredo Alejandro A. A. tiene 24 años y es soltero, Alfredo sigue acudiendo a la Universidad de Cochabamba en busca de terminar su carrera como Administrador de Empresas. Alfredo es dueño de un café internet ubicado en la zona central de Cochabamba, y actualmente cuenta con 5 computadoras con las cuales logra ganar lo suficiente para poder vivir y pagar sus estudios, ya que Alfredo es quien corre con esta inversión en su futuro.

Alfredo desea obtener este crédito y con el poder comprar una computadora mas y actualizar las que ya tiene, ya que como es de su conocimiento las computadoras se des actualizan en muy poco tiempo. Alfredo es conocido por ser una persona muy trabajadora, estudiosa y con interés de superarse. A pesar que en Cochabamba la inestabilidad social (bloqueos de caminos, paros de transporte, manifestaciones y diferencias políticas) es un problema grande y es el mayor riesgo que corre su negocio puesto que si no hay libre circulación de gente no hay nadie que acuda a su café internet, el nos cuenta que no se dará por vencido y que su mayor sueño es ver su negocio crecer y el poder salir de la universidad.
texts.en:
Alfredo Alejandro A. A. is 24 years and single. He is attending the University of Cochabamba in hopes of finishing his degree in business administration. He owns an internet cafe located in central Cochabamba and currently has five computers, which helps him make enough to be able to live and pay for his studies. Alfredo is requesting this loan so he can purchase another computer and update the ones he already has, since with his knowledge of computers he can update them in little time. Alfredo is known as a very hard-working and studious person with an interest in moving up in life. Social instability in Cochabamba (road blocks, public transportation stoppages, demonstrations and political differences) is a problem, and the biggest risk for his business is if there is not a free movement of people nobody will come to his internet cafe. He tells us he will not give up, and his biggest dream is to see his business grow and be able to graduate at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Barclay Farm United Group

texts.en:
F. G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Barclay Farm United.  He is 26 years old, married, and has two girls.  One of his girls is six years old and is in the 1st grade, the other is 3 months old.  F. and his family live in the Barclay Farm Community in Harbel, about 40 miles from the capital of Liberia, Monrovia.  He also helps care for two of his siblings who live with him, and regularly sends money to his parents who are farmers in Lofa County in northwest Liberia.

F. currently attends night school, and is enrolled in the 11th grade.  His education was interrupted by the Liberian civil war, when his family went to neighboring Guinea to escape the fighting.  He sells hardware and tools from a stall at the Harbel Market, which is located on the Firestone Rubber Plantation.  Firestone's plantation in Liberia is one of the largest in the world, with a million acres under long-term lease from the Liberian government.

F. says he started his business with 4,000 Liberian dollars in seed money from his father.  He originally sold tools and hardware from a wheelbarrow, but thanks to his hard work and perseverance he has been able to move up to selling at the market.  He hopes to move his shop to a storefront one day soon.  With his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan, F. plans to buy more inventory for his business, such as nails, cutlasses (machetes), shovels, and hammers.

F. credits his success in business to selling quality items and treating his customers well.  In future, he wants to have more children and hopes to be able to send them all to school so they get a good education.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, F. is the one holding the sign.  Siah F. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy nails, cutlasses (machetes), shovels, hammers, and other tools and hardware.

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario denominado Bello Amanecer, esta integrado por tres personas, dos  mujeres y un varon, ellos son personas que viven humildemente en la comunidad la Nueva Caucara, dicha colonia se formo despues del huracan mitch y donde la mayoria de habitantes son parientes, es por eso que este lugar es una comunidad bien tranquila para vivir.
 
la señora Arlis Yaneth N. A., tiene 34 años de edad y se dedica a la venta  de baleadas y refrescos naturales en su comunidad, la ubicación de su casa le ayuda ya que esta junto a la escuela de la comunidad, ahora esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materia prima y asi aprovechar la epoca escolar.
 
la señora Maria Concepcion A.. tiene 60 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Celso Avila con quien tuvo 4 hijos,  ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propios hogares.
Maria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia desde hace 10 años, esto le a servido para ayudar a su esposo en las obligaciones del hogar.
esta solicitando  el credito para invertirlo en su negocio y tenerlo mas surtido.
 
Julio Cesar N. A. tiene 30 años y es padre de 3 hijos, todos ellos pequeños y estan en 
edad escolar, esta casado con Eila Areceli Montoya quien labora en la empacadora de camaron
san lorenzo, don Julio se dedica a la venta de mariscos, en especial camaron y pescado
desde hace 1 año, estos productos los comercializa en Tegucigalpa una vez por semana.
esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas producto y con ello mejorar sus ganancias.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group Bello Amanecer consists of three people, two women and a man, who humbly live in the community of Nueva Caucara. The community was forced after Hurricane Mitch, and most of the inhabitants are parents, so it's a peaceful place to live. Arlis Yaneth N. A. is 34 years old and makes a living selling natural refreshments in her community. Her home's location helps her, since it is right in front of the local school. She is requesting the loan to purchase more raw materials so she can take advantage of the school season. Maria Concepcion A. is 60 years old and married to Celso Avila, and together they have four children who are full-grown and have their own homes. Maria has made a living selling groceries out of her convenience store for the past 10 years, and this allows her to help her husband with household obligations. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and increase her store's supply stock. Julio Cesar N. A. is 30 years old and has three children, all of whom are small and of school age. He is married to Eila Areceli Montoya, who works at the San Lorenzo shrimp packaging plant. Julio has made a living selling seafood, especially shrimp and fish, for the past year. He sells the products in Tegucigalpa one time per week. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase more products and increase his earnings. All the members need to loan to make headway with their family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit, water, sugar, seafood, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 67 year old business lady who runs a grocery store selling vegetables and fruits in Nairobi. She is a mother of five and has been in business for 20 years. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of fruits like oranges, mangoes and plums as well as vegetables such as onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes. She hopes to be a wholesale supplier of groceries and open other outlets. She describes herself as enterprising.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
“Unión por el Progreso”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 miembros entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades D. comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años.
Ceci Ana asume el cargo D. presidenta, a sus 28 años, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo D. 4 años D. edad.
DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a L. confección D. prendas D. vestir (buzos) y desD. hace 5 meses a L. venta D. jugos D. frutas, se inicio en L. confección D. prendas a raíz D. que laboro en una fábrica, logro aprender y decidió independizarse y en ocasiones realiza prestamos, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado comprar su casa y 3 maquinas (2 rectas y 1 remalladora), sus ingresos cubren el pago D. servicios, gas y alimentos. El gran sueño D. Ceci es poner una panadería, el  reciente préstamo será destinado para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado D. los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Unión por el Progreso”, (United for Progress) is a community alliance maD. up of ten enthusiastic and enterprising members who run small businesses and have been working with “EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad” for the past two years. Ceci Ana serves as the group’s president. She is married and has a four year old son. She has been manufacturing articles of clothing (tops) for the past three years and selling juices for the past five months. The roots of her clothing business come from when she used to work in a factory where she learned her skills and then decided to venture out on her own. Her daily labor has allowed her to buy her home and three sewing machines (two straight and one specialized). Her income covers the cost of services, gas, and food. Some day Ceci would like to open a bakery. This loan will be used to improve her business. All of our associates appreciate the support they receive from the investors and promise to make all of their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Reynaldo Ivan

texts.es:
Reynaldo T. de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y caña cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposa es empleada domestica con ella tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años.

El inicio trabajando en una pastelería muy conocida en Guayaquil (Pasteles & Compañía). Una vez que el aprendió todo lo que se hace en las pasteleria empezo con un nuevo negocio en su casa. 

Ahora Reynaldo tiene una panadería, vende panes y tambien todo lo que aprendio en la pastelería. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 00h00 haciendo panes y tortas. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son los racionamientos de energía.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla y huevos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener muchas sucursales.
texts.en:
Reynaldo T. is 29 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and reeds, and receives electricity and water as its only basic services. Reynaldo’s wife works as a housekeeper and they have two children, ages 8 and 5. He started working at a well-known cake shop called “Cakes & Company” in Guayaquil. Once he learned everything, he decided to start his own baking business at home. Now Reynaldo has his own bakery, where he sells bread and everything else he learned how to make at the cake shop. He works from 7am to midnight making breads and cakes. Energy rations are one of the inconveniences he has to face. With this loan, he will buy flour, butter, and eggs for his bakery. In the future, he wants to open more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, and eggs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora VICTORIA C. C., se dedica a la Lechería, elabora quesillos para su venta en el pueblo próximo a su localidad, vive a 24 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba en Curubamba, una zona muy bonita llena de vegetación y productora de leche y sembradíos.

Es casada, tiene cuatro hijos entre 13 y 3 años de edad.  Su esposo trabaja la tierra y así también es albañil.  

Quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tiene una casa de 2 habitaciones a medio construir.  Quiere comprar una vaca lechera con el crédito para crecer en su actividad y con el tiempo desea poder seguir comprando mas vacas y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria C. C. operates a dairy and makes cheeses to sell in the neighboring village. She lives 24 km from the city of Cochabamba in Curubamba, which is a beautiful area full of vegetation. Many milk producers and farmers live in this area.

Victoria is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 13. Her husband works on their land and is also a bricklayer by profession. She and her husband want to improve their living conditions and they have a two-bedroom house that is halfway built. With her loan, she wants to buy a dairy cow so that she can grow her business. Over time, she hopes to continue buying more cows and improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 29 year old businessman. He runs Space net communications where he sells mobile phones and mobile accessories. His business is located in a busy part of Nairobi and his customers are walk-in customers. He has requested for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of mobile phones and accessories. He says that through Faulu Kenya, his financial status has changed.  In addition to that, his social life has also improved.  He hopes to have his own house and car in the future.  He sees himself opening multiple outlets for selling his products.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay labor costs for farm improvements.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 28 year old father of one. He runs a retail shop in Nairobi Kenya dealing with foodstuff and beverages. He has been running this business for ten years and terms it as favorable. He has requested for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add stock of unga (maize and wheat flour) and beverages. He hopes to expand his customer base and desires to be a prosperous businessman with high returns. He describes himself as focused and industrious.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 39 year old single mother of three children and the bread-winner in her family. She lives and conducts her business in Fort Portal, Uganda selling clothes, shoes, blankets and children's wear.  She started as a hawker of clothes, then rented a premises jointly with her sister, but with the help of a Hofokam loan, she managed to get her own full premises in which she operates alone.  Her dream is to sell clothes, shoes, blankets and children wear at wholesale to retailers.  She is using the loan to pay school fees for the children and add more clothes, shoes and children's wear stock in her business.

loans.use: Business inventory and school fees

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco G. F. se dedica a la venta de leña y a veces se dedica a la caficultura. tiene 5 años de vender leña, es casado tiene 2 hijos que dependen de El.   
con los ingresos  que le genera este negocio cubre  todos sus gastos personales y familiares.
La Zona donde vive el sr. G. es una zona boscosa de un clima fresco lo que le permite realizar estas actividades sacando un buen provecho de los recursos naturales que estan a su disposicion, la venta de leña en estos lugares es bien comun ya que se necesita para uso domestico para la cocion de alimentos y de uso industrial en lo que es hornos de panaderia y secadoras de café.
ahorita quiere abastecerse de leña porque se pone escasa en los siguientes meses y asi el podra tener producto para vender.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Francisco G. F. sells firewood and occasionally grows coffee. He has been selling firewood for five years. Juan is married and has two dependent children. With the income generated from his business, he is able to cover his personal and family expenses.

The neighborhood where Sr. G. lives is in a wooded area that experiences cool climate. His business is made possible because the conditions allow him to make good use of the natural resources at his disposal. The sale of firewood is very common in this area because it is needed for domestic use, such as preparing food. It also has commercial uses, since it is used to fuel bakery ovens and coffee dryers.

Sr. Juan wants to stock up on firewood right now because supplies will be limited in the coming months. He wants to be sure that he will have enough product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel B. C., tiene la edad de 50 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor  prioridad. Ellos tienen 24,17 y 15 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de agroquímicos para la siembra de plátano. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al terreno para poder darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de plátano, para que cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias. El cuenta con una finca sembrada de plátano  y otros cultivos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Manuel tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura.El está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo  proyecto.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.Además, desea poder pagar el estudio a sus hijos para que sean personas profesionales y personas provechosas para la sociedad.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Manuel B. C., 50, is married and has three children, who are his main priority in life; they are 24, 17 and 15 years old. He needs funds to buy chemicals for banana crops. The idea is to provide the farmland with proper care so that the banana crops will produce the best possible sale prices when time comes to sell them. He has a farm where he grows bananas and other crops. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. José Manuel has many years of farming experience. He is sure that he will do well with the new project. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and economic stability in the future so that he can continue to grow as a person and as a grower. In addition, he wants to be able to pay for the education of his children so that they will become professionals and upstanding citizens that are useful to society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant bananas.

loans.name: Limbert

texts.es:
El sr. Limbert M. P., esta casado con la Sra. Sandra Corrales. tienen juntos 3 hijos de los cuales solamente uno acude a la escuela de la zona viven en su casa propia.

Los solicitantes del prestamo se dedican a la lecheria desde hace mucho tiempo, unos 11 años, tienen bastante experiencia, empezaron a trabajar con sus padres los cuales les enseñaron todo sobre el cuidado del ganado lechero, cuentan con 11 vacas lecheras.

Ahora requieren del prestamo para poder alquilar un terreno donde cultivaran alfa-alfa y chala, esto debido a que los precios de los demas insumos (soya, pepa de algodon) estan muy altos y lo que requieren ellos es minimizar sus costos para obtener mayores ingresos a mediano plazo.

Es segundo credito que solicitan a nuestra entidad, el primer credito pagaron sin retrasos.
texts.en:
Sr. Limbert M. P. is married to Sra. Sandra Corrales. They live in their own house with their three children, of whom only one attends the local school.

These loan applicants have been in the dairy business for quite some time, approximately eleven years. They have enough experience and learned the trade from their parents, who taught them everything about taking care of dairy cattle. They currently have eleven dairy cows.

Limbert and his wife are requesting a loan to rent farmland for growing alfalfa and corn because the prices of other types of feed (such as soybeans and cottonseed) are very expensive. This will help them minimize their costs so that they can earn a better income in the medium term.

Limbert is requesting his second loan from our organization. The previous loan was repaid without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent farmland for growing alfalfa & corn

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a widowed lady and mother of two children.  She has a photo studio which she has been running for eight years.  She gained her skills for photography because she was previously a camera lady.  Faulu Kenya is an MFI which offers training for her clients.  Therefore, Jane appreciates that she has learned how to keep her business records.  She intends to buy a photocopy machine hence she has requested for a loan of Kes.30,000.  She hopes to open other outlets of the same business.

loans.use: Buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS MARAVILLAS”, está conformada por 11 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 8 meses.
Marcia es una socia del grupo comunal y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos D. 8 años y 3 meses, se dedica a la venta D. desayuno y jugos en un M. D. santa Anita desD. hace 3 años, se inicio en este negocio por recomendación D. un tío, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado comprar un refrigeradora, una mesa y arreglar su vivienda, el gran sueño D. Marcia es tener una tienda para vender prendas D. vestir.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra D. mercadería (azúcar, quinua, soya y harina etc.). Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Maravillas” consists of eleven enthusiastic and determined members who dedicate themselves to their small businesses. They have been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for eight months.

Marcia is a member of this Communal Bank and serves as its president. She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 8 and 3 months). Marcia has been selling breakfast and juices at the Santa Anita Market for three years. Her uncle suggested that she start this business, and with great effort, she was able to pay for a refrigerator, a table, and repairs to her home. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store.

This recent loan will be used to buy merchandise (sugar, quinoa, soybeans, flour, and other ingredients). All of the members are grateful for the support and promise to complete their respective payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Arturo P. I. se dedica al negocio de tapiceria el cual opera bajo el nombre de "DISEÑOS" el tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad ya que antes de tener su propio local el pudo aprender algo sobre este tipo de trabajo.
Y ahora con la experiencia que el maneja desde hace 14 años a podido tener una buena clientela por la calidad, elaboracion y diseños de sus manualidades.- 
su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí. 
Don Luis tiene 2 hijos a los cuales les a brindado todo el apoyo en sus estudios y en sus deberes. El Sr. I. trabaja arduamente dia a dia para poder generar mayores ingresos y asi poder mejorar su condicion de vida y la de sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Arturo P. I. manages an upholstery business that operates under the name “Diseños” (Designs). He has plenty of experience in this type of activity. Luis was able to learn about upholstery prior to having his own shop.

His business has been operation for 14 years. Luis has built up a good clientele because of the quality, craftsmanship, and design of his work. His shop is located in the neighborhood of Pueblo Nuevo in the City of Danlí.

Don Luis has two children to whom he extends his support for their studies and other activities. He works extremely hard each day to generate more income so that he can improve the living conditions for himself and his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, sponges, glue, springs, tacks, nails, and leather

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda M. tiene 32 años ella es una mujer sola tiene cuatro hijos se dedica a la producción de leche vive en la zona de la Maica Norte q es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
