Hilda tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos porque el esposo la abandono cuando ella hace un año estaba muy enferma y  estuvo internada en el hospital como seis meses en ese transcurso de tiempo el esposo la abandono y dejo solos a sus hijos razón por la cual la madre de Hilda estuvo todo el tiempo con los niños y su hija de quince años se puso a trabajar dejando el colegio para poder ayudar a su mama se recupere y salga del hospital y ayudar en los gastos de la casa que eran muchos porque no tenían otro ingreso más que el de la entrega de leche que realizaba la madre de Hilda junto a sus nietos, la Señora Hilda salió del hospital y se sentía muy culpable de que su hija haya dejado el colegio para ayudarla a ella y el rechazo que los niños sienten por el padre es muy fuerte como también Hilda que ninguno quiere saber de él y dicen que jamás vuelva porque para ellos el está muerto.
La Señora Hilda requiere el crédito para la compra de dos cabezas de ganado y de esa manera podrá incrementar  sus litros de entrega de leche y realizar más quesillo para la venta en el mercado pues ella se siente con mucho mas valor y fuerza para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y que ellos terminen el colegio ya que su hija volvió a estudiar pero al mismo tiempo colaboran con la producción de leche y de quesillo todas las tardes realizan un trabajo en conjunto, sus ingresos mejoraran y tendrán un nivel de vida mejor ya no tendrán que pasar tantas necesidades como hace un año atrás.
La madre de Hilda se encuentra muy orgullosa de su hija y de su nieta al saber luchar y no dejarse vencer con todo lo malo que les paso ellas saben salir adelante lo que yo le enseñe a mi hija lo mismo realiza mi nieta dice doña Carmen.
Hilda se encuentra en proceso de recuperación pero ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con la actividad de la producción de leche que lo hace a partir de la cuatro de la mañana y después a lista  a sus hijos para el colegio ella lucha para que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro que ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda M. is 32 years old and a single woman with four children. She operates a dairy and lives in an area of Maica Norte, which is a canton of the city of Cochabamba. Hilda has to raise her children alone because her husband abandoned them a year ago after she became severely ill and had to be hospitalized for six months. Hilda’s mother stayed with the children while she was in the hospital. Her fifteen year old daughter quit high school and began working so that she could help her mother recover and pay for the household expenses. Their bills were numerous since there was no other income besides the milk being sold by Hilda’s mother and children. After she was discharged from the hospital, Hilda felt guilty that her daughter had to quit school to help her and her children experienced a strong rejection by their father. Hilda advised them not to mention him again, as if he were dead.

Hilda is requesting a loan to buy two more dairy cows so that she can increase milk production for delivery and to make cheeses to sell at the market. She feels she has more courage and strength to move her children forward so that they can complete their education. Her daughter returned to school, but she still helps with gathering the milk and helping her mother in the afternoons make cheeses. Hilda hopes to improve her income and experience a better standard of living now that they she hasn't accumulated as many expenses as she had a year ago.

Hilda’s mother is very proud of her daughter and granddaughter for persevering and not giving in to everything bad that had happened to them. Doña Carmen (Hilda’s mother) says, “I know my granddaughter will experience success because my daughter will be the one to show her.”

Hilda is still in the process of recovery, but she continues to work hard and manage her dairy responsibly. She begins work at 4am and then prepares her children for school so that they can become professionals and have a better future than her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Concepcion C. I. cuenta con un negocio de Venta de ropa para cama, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí, Maria tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, poco a poco  se ha sabido ganar la clientela por
la variedad y tipos de cosas que vende. son de muy buena calidad y precios comodos. 
La Sra. Concepcion es madre soltera y gracias a su negocio a podido mantener estable su hogar y sus condiciones de vida.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene Maria para gananarse la vida diariamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Concepcion C. I. sells bed sheets from her home in the neighborhood of Pueblo Nuevo in the city of Danlí. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to gain customers by offering a variety of things to sell. Her products are of good quality and are offered at comfortable prices.

Sra. Concepcion is a single mother and, thanks to her business, has been able to maintain a stable household and adequate living conditions. This is the only source of income from which she earns her daily living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, and bedspreads

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras se reúne en una parroquia rural de Portoviejo llamada Pachinche, conversamos con la socia Ángela Maria y nos comenta que desde hace cuatro ciclos viene trabajando  con su banco comunal y le va muy bien.

Ella  se dedica a  bordar a mano en tela con hilos finos y delicados diseños muy elegantes en apliques para vestidos, este arte fue enseñado por su mamá y lleva quince años realizando esta actividad,  diariamente borda de 3 a 4 de estos apliques que los entrega a una señora que se encarga de enviar fuera del país para su venta, nos manifiesta que la ganancia es mínima de apenas 10 centavos en cada uno a pesar de ser una  tarea bastante difícil que requiere de mucha paciencia y mayor concentración por lo que dedica el mayor de su tiempo a este trabajo, a más de ésta actividad los sábados vende productos de belleza Yanbal; dada la situación económica no hay día para el descanso comenta.

Con este nuevo préstamo nuestra socia invertirá en productos Yanbal como cremas, labiales, maquillajes, perfumes, bisutería y más cosméticos para toda la familia que ofrece esta línea y dedicarle cuidado a su salud que ultimamente se ha visto afectada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Damas Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) meets in the rural parish of Pachinche in Portoviejo. We talked with Ángela Maria, one of its members, and she tells us that she has been working with her Communal Bank for the past four loan cycles and is doing very well.

Ángela does embroidery by hand on fabrics made of fine thread. She also designs delicate and elegant appliqués to put on dresses. Her mother taught her this art and she has been honing her skills for 15 years. She completes 3-4 appliquéd embroideries each day and sends them to a woman who is in charge of shipping them abroad for resale. Ángela says her earnings are meager, getting the bare minimum of ten cents for each piece. Since this type of work requires a lot patience and concentration, the majority of her time is dedicated to this activity. On Saturdays, she sells Yanbal beauty products. Giver her economic situation, Ángela says there are no days for her to rest.

With this new loan, Ángela will purchase Yanbal products such as crèmes, lipsticks, compacts, perfumes, costume jewelry, and other cosmetics offered by this line. She will spend some time to take care of her health, which has been affected as of late.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal cosmetics & jewelry

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora tiene 48 años está casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 están en la republica de Argentina trabajando, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos razón por la cual ninguno de los hijos no estudiaran una carrera profesional. 

La señora Teodora vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de mallco rancho, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente solo cuenta con tres cabezas de ganado lechero en producción ya que hace 6 meses una mañana se le murieron 3 cabezas de ganado lechero ella no sé explica que paso si fue el pasto que le dio de comer o algún vecino los enveneno .El  producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de un ganado lechero, con la cual incrementara la producción de leche lo cual mejorara el nivel de ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es incrementar la cantidad de la producción de la leche y que el hijo menor que está estudiando pueda terminar de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Teodora is 48 years old, married, and has eight children. Four of them work in Argentina. Her family has limited financial resources, which is why none of her children were able to study for a professional career.

Sra. Teodora lives in the in the city of Cochabamba, specifically the community of Mallco Rancho. Her main business activity is raw milk production. She has three dairy cows that she acquired six months ago that are currently producing. These animals were purchased after her three previous cows died inexplicably one morning. She is not sure whether their death was caused by the grass she fed them or if some neighbor tried to poison them.

The milk produced by her cows is delivered to a company that makes different types of dairy products. This loan will be used to buy another dairy cow, which will help increase milk production and improve her income. Among her dreams and goals are to increase her overall milk production and help her youngest son with his studies so that he can earn a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es: la sra. Brenda Carolina P. se dedica al transporte de materiales de construccion, tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, esta actividad la realiza comprando los materiales y los lleva a los lugares en donde estan construyendo, Brenda nos comentaba que su vehiculo lo han ido mejorando poco a poco ya que es el alma de su trabajo, pero ahorita necesita mantenimiento y cambio de llantas, gracias a este negocio ella junto con su esposo han logrado salir adelante y poder cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Brenda Carolina P. transports construction materials. She has been working in the transportation business for over 8 years. She purchases construction materials and then brings them to the construction sites. Her truck is the heart and soul of her business.

Brenda has been making improvements on her vehicle little by little, but it currently requires maintenance and a tire change. Thanks to her business, she and her husband have managed to improve their lives and are able to pay for their household expenditures.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires and replacement parts for vehicle repair

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Juana R. se dedica con gran esmero a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ofrecidas a diario en el mercado desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunos perecederos o verduras como son yuca, quequisque, papa, cebolla, entre otros. Ella está esperando que su crédito le sea aprobado para así surtir sus estantes con las verduras.
texts.en:
Juana R., with great care, sells fruits and vegetables daily from early in the morning until nightfall at Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy some perishable items or vegetables, like: yucca, arum, potato, onion, etc. She is hoping that the loan will be approved so that she can stock her shelves with vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph Wilson

texts.es:
Joseph C. de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. No tiene cargos familiares.

El era estudiante de ensamblaje de computadoras en la universidad, cuando se gradúo empezó con su negocio de reparación de computadoras.  

Ahora Joseph trabaja en su propio local de reparación y venta de equipos de computación, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la inseguridad del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pantallas para computadoras, CPU, Mouse para su negocio. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidor de computadoras
texts.en:
Joseph C. is 27 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and receives water and electricity as its only basic services. He has no family responsibilities. He studied computer assembly at the university. When he graduated, Joseph began his computer repair business. He now works at his own repair shop where he also sells computer equipment. His work schedule every day is from 8am until 7pm. One of the challenges he faces is the uncertainty associated with this type of business. With this loan, he will buy computer monitors, CPUs, and mouse devices for his business. In the future, Joseph wants to become a computer distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase monitors, CPUs, and mouse devices

loans.name: Benedicto William

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR BENEDICTO WILLIAM E. G. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA CON LA SRA. NELVI FLORES MARTINEZ, QUIENES ACABAN DE CONTRAER MATRIMONIO, SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ES LA PRODUCCION DE LECHE PARA LA ELABORACION DE QUESO, CON VENTAS DIARIAS AL MERCADO LOCAL, SIENDO LA ESPOSA LA ENCARGADA DE LA COMERCIALIZACION.

EL SEÑOR BENEDICTO WILLIAM E. G., NO TIENE UNA VIVIENDA PROPIA, HABITA JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ZONA OESTE DE COCHABAMBA, SON PERSONAS MUY DEDICADAS A SU TRABAJO CONOCEN MUCHO SOBRE EL MANEJO DE SU GANADO LECHERO.

EL PRESENTE CREDITO QUE SOLICITA EL CLIENTE ES PARA LA TERMINACION DE CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA E INDEPENDIZARSE CON SU NUEVA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Sr. Benedicto William E. G. is 22 years old and recently married to Sra. Nelvi Flores Martinez. His business activity involves producing milk for making cheeses, which are sold daily at the local market. His wife is in charge of product sales.

Benedicto does not own a home. He currently lives with his family on the west side of Cochabamba. They are dedicated people who are very knowledgeable about managing a dairy.

The current loan Benedicto is requesting will be used to finish construction of his house so that he and his new wife can live independently.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es:
la sra. Hilda Yaneth F. N. se dedica al servicio de salon de belleza denominada "VENUS" actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años, es soltera.
Con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permiten suplir algunos gastos personales y 
contribuye a sus padres en el hogar , ella tiene una vision de instalar otro salon de belleza en danli esto le aumentaria mas sus ingresos mejorando sus condiciones de vida de su familia y tambien a generar empleo beneficiando a otras familias.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda Yaneth F. N. is single and manages a beauty salon called “Venus”. Her business has been in operation for more than five years. The income she generates allows her to meet some of her personal expenses and also contribute to her parents’ household expenses. She envisions opening another beauty salon in Danli. This will help increase her income, improve her family’s living conditions, and also generate employment for other families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shampoos, dyes, conditioners, treatment drops, depilatory wax, peroxide, and other supplies

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 34 year old married man with two children in school.   He was formerly farming and running a grocery shop so as to earn a living.  He then started operating a retail shop where he sells shoe soles.  But he still earns extra income from farming. He wants to take his first loan from Faulu Kenya and hopes that his business will expand and improve. He plans to add stock and expand his business with the loan of Kes.15,000.  He hopes that his income will increase for him to meet his family’s need.  He sees himself having better living standards in a few years time.

loans.use: Add stock of soles

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Victor R. tiene su propio negocio de venta de pollo y embutidos habiéndolo desarrollado gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por mejorar dicho negocio y por estar persistente en dicho trabajo.

Actualmente el señor Victor ha ganado varios clientes que debe de aprovecharlos y siempre ofrecerles los productos para que estos los sigan consumiendo.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra del pollo y embutidos y por esta razón es que espera que le sea otorgado para la compra del producto y así satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor R. sells chicken and cured meats in the Mayoreo market. He has developed his business thanks to his efforts to improve it and for being persistent in his work. Victor has won over many customers so he must capitalize on this by always offering them product so that they will continue to consume from him. He is asking for funds to buy chicken and cured meats; he hopes they will be granted so that he can buy the product and satisfy his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken and cured meats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 46 year old hardworking lady who operates a music and movie shop and a kinyozi (barber shop).  She sells CDS and DVDS at the same time providing services in her barber shop. She also earns extra income from farming.  Mary was selling charcoal three years ago before she ventured into this business.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, she has previously taken three loans and she plans to take another loan of Kes.20,000.  She wants to use this loan to buy DVD players for sale in her shop.   She hopes to expand her business and to have a wholesale electronic shop in the future.   She sees herself becoming a local supplier in a few years time.

loans.use: Buy DVD players for sale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, de 65 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Estela de 46 años, quien le ayuda en sus cultivos y sus 3 hijos; Elizabeth de 23, Luis de 20 y Rosa de 17 años. Lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila, para lo cual necesita darles una buena educación a sus hijos. 

La agricultura ha sido para Esteban una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra la comida no le faltaría. Es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados papa, alverja, zanahoria, etc., los cuales una vez cosechados llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 50 años en la agricultura y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. 

Este es el octavo préstamo de Esteban con MFP y sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.
Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Esteban is 65 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible father. He lives in his own home with his wife Estela, who is 46. She helps him with his crops. He also lives with his 3 children: Elizabeth, 23, Luis, 20, and Rosa, 17. What he wants more than anything is to have a calm old age and for this he needs to give his children an good education. For Esteban, farming has been an activity he needs to live. Since he was very small, his parents taught him that if he worked in the fields he wouldn't lack for food. That is why he decided to continue with the family work and now he has his own crops. He has planted potatoes, peas, carrots, etc. Once these are harvested, he takes them to market in the city of Tarma. What he likes the most about his work is planting, since he knows that his family's stability depends on this activity. He has been in farming for 50 years. What he considers the hardest is taking care of his crops in sudden weather changes, since this affects his productivity a lot. This is the eight loan that Esteban has had with MFP and he knows that the loan will be beneficial to the development of his activity. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, and because of this he is very respected. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he is asking for, he will purchase pea seed, fertilizer and insecticide to have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita, de 49 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 49 años y sus 4 hijos: Lady de 28, Juliana de 26, Miguel de 19 y Jesús de 17 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El trabajo que realiza es el cultivo de zanahorias, papa, alverja, y otros productos; esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente comercializar sus productos en el país de Bolivia, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, limpiando y fumigando sus plantas. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y con el incremento de sus ventas pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Sarita con MFP, por lo que se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para sus cultivos, además contratará un operario para que trabaje en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Sarita is 49 years old and she is a woman that has always worked very hard to stand out in life. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Hugo, who is 49 years old and their 4 children: Lady who is 28, Juliana who is 26, Miguel who is 19, and Jesús who is 17. They are the motivation for all of her efforts.

Sarita works growing carrots, potatoes, peas, and other crops. She does this work together with her husband, who also works hard to provide their children with a good education. She has seen it to be convenient to sell her crops in Bolivia, since it is obvious that she has better earnings there.

What she likes most about her work is preventing her crops from pests that can threaten her productivity, cleaning and spraying her plants. She has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops, since the road is very long and tiring. With time, she hopes that her crops improve and with the increase in sales, she can improve her economic earnings.

This is Sarita’s ninth loan with MFP and she feels an obligation to make her loan repayments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked. With the 2,500 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer for her crops, and will also hire a worker for her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire a farm worker

loans.name: Zoila Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Zoila forma parte  del  Banco  Comunal  Damas  Emprendedoras  en  la  parroquia Pachinche  en las afuera de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí zona costera del Ecuador,  ella está casada tiene seis  hijos ya mayores que formaron sus propias familias y viven independientes.

Zoila tiene 59 años de edad y esta muy entregada al trabajo, realiza varias actividades como bordar y venta de  cosméticos de la línea Avon lleva cinco años realizando este trabajo, uno de sus sueños   es montar una pequeña tienda de víveres  en su casa  que espera cristalizarlo en corto plazo con  la ayuda de la  Fundación ya que no ha tenido ningún problema con sus pagos. También anhela tener su  propia distribuidora de bordados y ser ella la que abastezca a los comerciantes mayoristas.

Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en reconstruir el techo de su casa  una parte y otra para adquirir cremas, maquillajes, perfumes y mas cosméticos Avon para cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the Damas Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) communal bank in the Pachinche parish in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo, located in the province of Manabí in the coastal area of Ecuador. She is married and has six children, who are now older and live independently and have their own families.

Zoila is 59 years old and is very dedicated to her work. She does several activities, such as embroidery and selling Avon cosmetics, which she has been doing for five years. One of her dreams is to set up a small supplies store in her house and she hopes to finalize it in the short term with the help of the Fundación, since she has not had any problem with her repayments. She also wants to have her own distribution of embroideries and be the one to supply them to the wholesale merchants.

With this new loan, she will use it partly to reconstruct the roof of her house, and partly to purchase creams, makeup, perfumes, and other Avon cosmetics to fill her customer’s orders.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of her home and to purchase cream, lipstick, perfume, and other Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Limne Gricelda

texts.es:
la sra. Limne Gricelda Z. C. tiene dos años de haber iniciado con una pequeña pulpería, tambien los fines de semana elabora y vende Nacatamales y Rosquillas.
Limne hace nacatamales y rosquillas una vez por semana, anteriormente elaboraba estos productos dos veces por semana y en ocasiones hasta tres veces por semana, pero desde que inicio con la pulpería, decidió bajar la producción de los mismos ya que era bien maltratado para ella por las recalentadas que se daba en el fogón y el horno.
Sus clientes la prefieren por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que ella les ofrece, además los nacatamales y las rosquillas que elabora son de muy buena calidad y de buen sabor.
texts.en:
Limne Gricelda Z. C. started a small local store two years ago and on weekends, she also makes and sells nacatamales and rosquillas (two typical foods in Nicaragua).

Limne makes nacatamales and rosquillas once a week. Before, she used to make these items twice per week and sometimes up to three times per week. However, since opening her store, she decided to cut back on making them, since she had to reheat them over the fire or in the oven.

Her customers prefer her because of the attention that she provides to them and for the prices that she offers. In addition, the nacatamales and rosquillas that she makes are tasty and good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, sodas, coffee, churros, spices, eggs, tortillas, toilet paper, pastas, sauces, cookies, sugar, rice, and butter

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La señora Maricruz L. vive en el municipio de El Sauce y ha tomado la firme decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ella es una dama muy trabajadora y se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia que depende de ella.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para llevar a cabo la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo dicha obra y una vez finalizada poder beneficiar a su amada familia ofreciéndoles un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Maricruz L. lives in El Sauce and she has taken the firm decision to invest in home improvements because she is a very hard-working woman who is concerned with her family's wellbeing; they depend on her. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to undertake this project so that, once it is finished, it will benefit her beloved family by providing a proper home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Danitza de un año y medio y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su bodega es la primera en abrirse en su barrio, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Es por ello, que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su localidad. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el décimo préstamo de Zulma con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Zulma, 35, is a happy, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her beloved daughter, Danitza, who is a year-and-a-half old, and what she most wants in the world is to give her a better quality of life. Her general store is the first one in the neighborhood to open. Its doors open at 6 in the morning, ready for shoppers who are up early and know that they can find what they want there. The thing that Zulma most likes about her work is talking with her customers and hearing about what's going on in the neighborhood. She has operated the business for 5 years and says that the aspect of the work that she least likes is having to be in the store all day without being able to leave. In the future, she would like to grow the business and provide her customers with an even better service. This is Zulma's tenth MFP loan and she expects to be able to repay it on time. She doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of the community bank where she is much respected because of the order that she brings to the group. She will use the thousand-soles loan she is applying for to buy more products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Atilio B. M., tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor  prioridad. Ellos tienen 13,7 y 3 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de insumos para el desarrollo del cultivo de tiquisque y mano de obra. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al terreno para poder darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de tiquisque, para que cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias. El desea poder asistir el cultivo para lograr un mejor desarrollo del mismo,  y así lograr una mejor producción.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Atilio tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura.El está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo  proyecto.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Atilio B. M., 39, is married and has three children, who are his greatest priority in life. They are 13, 7 and 3 years of age. He needs funding to buy supplies for his tiquisque (a starchy tuber) crops and to pay for labor costs. The idea is to provide care and maintenance to the land so that the tiquisque crops will produce the best possible sale price when they are harvested and sold. He hopes to assist the crops so that production will be the best. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. Atilio has been a farmer for many years. He is sure he will do well with this new project. He hopes to provide his family with a better standard of living and more economic stability in the future and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his tiquisque (a starchy tuber) crops.

loans.name: Mauricio Arturo

texts.es:
el sr. Mauricio Arturo E. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el Barrio La Reforma, Mauricio se dedica a la tapiceria, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, muchas personas lo prefieren ya que el es muy detallista con sus trabajos, el acabado que les deja es muy bonito, tiene mucha habilidad para trabajar la tapiceria, en estos momentos Mauricio necesita el credito para poder comprar materiales para realizar varios trabajos en muebles.
con las ganancias que tenga el podra darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y salir adelante con su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Mauricio Arturo E., 31, lives in the La Reforma neighborhood. He operates an upholstery business, work that he has been doing for several years. There's a big demand for his services because he is very meticulous and his finished work is extremely good. The skill he exhibits is evident. Mauricio needs a loan so that he can buy materials for various furniture jobs. With the earnings that he expects to receive, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and help both his business and his household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for upholstery business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 26 year old married mother of one. She owns a hardware shop selling plumbing and building materials in Nairobi. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy building and plumbing materials. She hopes to expand her business and open other shops. She describes herself as flexible.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Havila Group

texts.en:
The Havila Group consists of three young women from Nejapa, a semirural area in Managua.  This area is inherently difficult for its residents because it does not have running water and, along with nearby neighborhoods, the area is deteriorating.

In this group is Ana Maria C. A. who sells food, Olga Marina who distributes Avon brand cosmetics, and the coordinator of this group, Yahoska Eveling M.. Yahoska’s goal is to have a clothing store. A year and a half ago she began selling used clothing in small quantities, and so far she has not had enough capital to invest in more than a little inventory. Thanks to the loans from ADIM she has been able to purchase a little more to please her clientele. She will use this loan to purchase more clothing as well.

loans.use: To purchase items of clothing

loans.name: Arling Melissa

texts.es:
la joven Arling Melissa M. tiene un año de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta Cosméticos  y desea comprar ropa nueva para vender tambien.
actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante en la aldea de Jutiapa, Jamastran.
Arling se a sabido ganar sus clientes, mismos que la prefieren por las facilidades de pago que les ofrece y por la buena calidad de productos que vende, ya que son de marcas reconocidas.
La Joven  Arling M., vive con sus padres y con los ingresos que le genera su negocio cubre a un 100% sus gastos personales y los gastos de estudios universitarios ya que estudia en el sistema de educación distancia. CASUED El Paraíso.
su meta a corto plazo es poder graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Young Arling Melissa M. has been operating her own business for a year, selling cosmetics mostly. She wants to buy new clothing so that she can sell that, as well. She works as a street vendor, sometimes selling from her house, but also around the small Honduran town of Jutiapa. Arling knows how to win over her customers. They like her because of the easy payment terms she offers and because of the quality of the products--all knows brands--that she sells. Arling lives with her parents, but her earnings cover 100% of her personal expenses. She is studying for a long-distance university degree and her earnings cover her education fees, as well. Her short-term goal is to get her university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo D. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 5 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. Tienen 15,12,9,6 y 3 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para cría.Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Arnoldo trabaja con el ganado desde hace varios años. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Arnoldo D. N., 42, is in a common-law relationship and has 5 children, who are his greatest priority. They are 15, 12, 9, 6, and 3 years of age. He needs funds to buy cattle. The idea is to have cattle to raise. He wants to provide the cattle with the proper care and maintenance so that the best possible income will be produced at the time of their sale. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. Arnoldo has raised cattle for many years. He hopes to provide his family with improved quality of life and economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maximina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maximina C. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora del municipio El Sauce en León donde a diario labora con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y que requiere mejorar.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción para cambiar el alumbrado eléctrico de su vivienda ya que actualmente no funciona a la perfección y ella está comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos hijos para que estos puedan estudiar e iluminarse. Ella espera obtener el crédito para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento y que sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con ella.
texts.en:
Maximina C. has stood out as a very hard-working woman in El Sauce, León. She works every day hoping to earn income to improve her home that has been in poor condition and needs to be repaired. She is asking for funds to buy some building materials and supplies in order to change the electric wiring in her home because it isn't working to perfection and she is committed to the wellbeing of her two children; that they have lighting so that they can study. She hopes to have the loan approved so that she can accomplish this improvement and her children will feel satisfied with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace electric wiring in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria del Carmen A. G. tiene un año de dedicarse al negocio de cafeteria y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de golosinas.
Negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, misma que se encuentra ubicada casi en frente del Instituto Polivalente Unión de Oriente, sus clientes potenciales en el periodo de educación son los alumnos de dicho centro educativo y los fines de semana los habitantes de la aldea de Jutiapa.
Cuando el periodo de estudios culmina, ella solo se queda elaborando las ventas de golosinas los fines de semana.- y en vista que el periodo de estudio esta por iniciar ella quiere comprar todos los ingredientes y materiales para llevar a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria del Carmen A. G. has operated a business for the last year, making and selling snacks. She operates the business from her house which is just across from the Instituto Polivalente Union de Oriente high school. During the school year, most of her weekday customers are students from the school. At the weekends, her customers are largely drawn from people in the neighborhood and, once school ends, she's only left with her weekend customers. The new school year is about to start, though, and she wants to buy the ingredients and supplies she needs to ramp up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for snacks business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelson Edgardo

texts.es:
Nelson Edgardo M. C. muestra una tenacidad frente a todo acontecimiento que se  lo impida. A pesar de un accidente de tránsito que tuvo hace tres años y en el que perdió su brazo izquierdo, no dejó de jugar billar a tal nivel que en octubre del año 2008 representó el departamento del Atlántico en los paralímpicos nacionales de Cali. Tiene 49 años y tres hijos entre las edades de 18 y 27 años. Maneja un taller de joyería de reparación y producción de joyas. Le gusta su arte y se dedica a diseñar joyas, hacer baños de oro, baños de plata, enchapes en oro y en níquel. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que le recomendó  un amigo que también participa en sus programas.  Nelson aplica en la actualidad a un crédito por valor de de $1.300.000, que invertirá en materia prima para la joyería como plata y oro y un surtido de  accesorios, más grande para su vitrina.
Nelson comenzó con la joyería hace más de treinta años, cuando en su barrio trabajó este arte con un amigo joyero  durante 15 años,  hasta que Nelson se independizara y montara el suyo propio. Originalmente trabajaba en el centro de Barranquilla, pero se fue para el centro de Soledad hace 10 años por que tiene su mejor clientela y también porque el centro comercial en que tenía su negocio se iba decayendo. En los últimos 16 años con su taller independiente manifiesta que su negocio ha sido estable, pero que esta estabilidad ha sido su mayor desafío debido a la  falta de recursos y apoyo,  tal como el que le ofrece  la Fundación a través de este financiamiento. Más adelante, quiere progresar en su negocio y tener la oportunidad de emplear a más personas, pues su   segundo hijo es el único que en la actualidad trabaja con él.
texts.en:
Nelson Edgardo M. C. has shown great tenacity in the face of adversity. Despite a traffic accident three years ago that cost him his left arm, he never stopped playing billiards at a high level. So high a level, in fact, that he was the representative of the Colombian "departamento" of Atlantico at the national Paralympic games in Cali in October 2008. Nelson is 49 years old and has three children between the ages of 18 and 27. He operates a workshop, making and repairing jewelry. He likes the work: designing jewelry, making gold and silver plating, plating jewelry in gold and nickle. This is his first Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan. A friend recommended that he apply and he's asking for a $1,300,000 loan so that he can buy supplies--silver, gold, etc.--for his workshop. Nelson began working with jewelry more than thirty years ago, working for 15 years with a friend who was a jeweler and then setting up his own business. He used to work in Barranquilla, but he left for Soledad 10 years ago because there's a better pool of customers and because the shopping area where he had his business before had declined. He says that his business has been stable for the last 16 years but he's suffered from a lack of resources and support, something that the Fundacion can remedy with this loan. In the future, he wants to grow the business and add new employees. For now, his second son is his only employee.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for jewelry business.

loans.name: Oneyda De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Oneyda E. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, cremas, colonias, shampoo, desodorante, entre otros. También ella vende ropa en menores cantidades.
Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los cosméticos para damas, caballeros y niños y también para la compra de la ropa con el único propósito de continuar comercializándolo y de esta forma percibir los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oneyda E., with great care and dedication, sells cosmetics in El Sauce, León. She sells such items as: perfume, creams, colognes, shampoo, deodorant, among others. She also sells clothing in smaller quantities. She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics for women, men and children. She wants to buy clothing also with the sole purpose of selling it in order to earn income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra. Aida Esperanza L. R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "AIDA" negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Lo cual le permite realizar sus oficios domesticos y cuidar de su nieto y un sobrino que viven con ella. 
Doña Aida  nos conto muy alegre que su negocio le a sido de gran bendición, ya que con los 
ingresos que le ha generado el mismo a ido invirtiendo mas en su negocio y cumpliendo con los 
compromisos adquiridos,  nos solicita el prestamo porque necesita capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio.
es una señora muy amable.
texts.en:
Aida Esperanza L. Rodríguez sells popular consumer products. She has a mini-market named Pulpería AIDA. The business is located in her house. This allows her to do her domestic chores and take care of her grandson and nephew that live with her. Aida told us that she is very happy that her business has been such a blessing to her. With the income that it has generated she has invested more in her business and met her commitments. She is asking us for a loan because she needs working capital to stock her business. She is a very kind woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, juice, soap, rice, beans, sugar, shortening, oil, bread, coffee, crackers, corn and wheat flour, pastas, salsas, grains, milk, eggs, potatoes, onions, garlic, chilis, and soup

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsa Trinidad

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 and lives in a cement home in Guayaquil with all the basic services.  She is separated with 7 children ranging in ages from 43 to 18.  She has a small store that her children help her run from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm every day.  One difficulty of her work is when she or her children get sick, which makes it harder to run the store.

With the loan, Elsa will buy items for her store such as rice, oil, and sugar.  In the future, she would love to have a larger store and to be able to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: Inventory for her general store (rice, sugar, oil)

loans.name: Monserrate Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Monserrate es  una de las socias activas del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche ubicado en la capital manabita una ciudad que goza de clima cálido perfecto para el cultivo de frutas tropicales,  nuestra socia es comerciante  de accesorios para el hogar elaborados en plástico, sábanas y otros utensillos  necesarios para  el hogar que los ofrece puerta a puerta recorriendo las calles de su comunidad dejando a crédito de hasta 10 semanas.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Monserrate podrá invertir en mas productos  como cortinas de baño, basureros, coladeras, tachos para agua,  sábanas, etc. para cumplir con algunos pedidos  que tiene por entregar, la ganancia no es mucha pero le ayuda a salir adelante ya que algunos productos los compra a buen precio.

A futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante pues  a ella le gusta la cocina y  prepara deliciosos platos y ese es uno de sus sueños, espera no tarde en hacerse realidad y para ello está reuniendo el capital poco a poco
texts.en:
Monserrate is one of the active members of the Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche Communal Bank. It is located in the capital, Manabita. This city enjoys a warm climate, which is perfect for growing tropical fruits. She sells plastic home accessories, sheets, and other necessary products for the home. She sells door to door and travels the streets of her community. She gives credit for up to ten weeks. With this new loan Monserrate will be able to invest in more products like shower curtains, trash cans, colanders, water containers, and sheets, etc. to fill some orders that she needs to deliver. The earnings are not much, but it helps her get ahead because she buys some products at a good price. In the future she would like to have a restaurant. She likes to cook and prepare delicious dishes. It is one of her dreams, and she hopes it will not be long before she can make her dream come true. Little by little she is gathering her money to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shower curtains, trash cans, colanders, water containers,  sheets and more plastic products

loans.name: Belki Vanessa

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en León, la dama Belki E. es propietaria de su negocio de venta de pollo el cual lo vende a la población de su localidad y lo almacena en una mantenedora para que este permanezca bien frio y así pueda ser vendido satisfactoriamente a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra del pollo con el objetivo de continuar comercializándolo ya que le es de mucha necesidad obtenerlo a lo inmediato para así satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Belki E. sells chicken to residents in her area in El Sauce, León. She also stores it in a refrigerated keeper so that it will stay nice and cold in order to be sold satisfactorily to her customers. She is asking for funds to buy chicken so that she can continue selling it. It is important that she get it immediately to continue to satisfy the needs of the customers in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Ketty Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Ketty forma parte del banco comunal Alianza formado  en la ciudad de Portoviejo provincia de Manabí donde podemos disfrutar de hermosas playas durante todo del año, es socia actica desde hace tres ciclos, junto a su esposo montaron su negocio de  reencauchadora que lo tienen hace tres años ya; su cónyuge se encarga de viajar  a otras ciudades a comprar las llantas usadas  en  un promedio de treinta por semana para luego reencaucharlas y sacarlas a la venta,  al mes vende un aproximado de 100 llantas que las distribuye entre Portoviejo y Quito en esta última ciudad un primo se encarga de comercializarlas.

Para la señora Ketty mantener firme este negocio no ha sido nada fácil y gracias a los créditos obtenidos de la Fundación Espoir han logrado mantenerlo a flote y espera seguir con su negocio que es su sustento diario.  Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar más llantas usadas para reencaucharlas e incrementar su negocio y tener un stock suficiente para ofrecer a sus clientes.
 
El sueño de nuestra socia es poder ve realizado los sueños de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ketty is part of the Alianza Communal Bank. It is in the city of Portoviejo in the province of Manabí, where we can enjoy beautiful beaches all year. She has been an active member for three cycles. She and her husband started a retread business, and they have had it for three years. Her husband travels to other cities to buy the used tires. He buys an average of about 30 tires a week. Then they retread the tires and sell them. They sell approximately 100 tires a month, which they distribute between Portoviejo and Quito. A cousin sells them in Quito. Keeping the business solid has not been easy for Ketty. Thanks to the loans received from the Espoir Foundation they have kept it afloat. She hopes to continue with this business, which is her daily support. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more used tires to retread. She will increase her business and have sufficient stock to offer her customers. Her dream is to be able to see her children’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used tires to retread and increase her business

loans.name: Ana Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Lizeth E. F. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Centro de la Ciudad de Trojes El Paraiso, Ana se dedica a la venta de joyeria para dama, este tipo de productos son muy vendidos a mujeres que trabajan en empresas privadas y oficinas estatales, ya que su costo es bajo y tienen buena apariencia, Ana necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mejores ganancias, dice sentirse muy alegre y satisfecha con las ventas ya que cada dia que pasa esta vendiendo mas y mas, las ganancias las necesita para poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante sus hijos que son lo mas importante de su vida.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene Ana para ganarse la vida diariamente.
texts.en:
Ana Lizeth E. F., age 43, lives in the El Centro neighborhood in the city of Trojes El Paraiso. She sells jewelry for women. These products are sold a lot to women who work in private companies and state offices. The jewelry does not cost much, and it looks good. Ana needs the loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale and get better earnings. She says that she is very happy and satisfied with her sales. She is selling more and more everyday. She needs the income to be able to cover the household expenses and to get her children ahead. Her children are the most important thing in her life. This is the only source of income that Ana has to earn a living everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy earrings, chains, bracelets, and necklaces

loans.name: Karina Evelyn

texts.es:
La Señora Karina López tiene 32 años ella es de la ciudad de Oruro se vino a Cochabamba por que la madre  se encontraba muy enferma de salud y es por eso que tuvo que dejar su trabajo y toda sus actividades ella y sus hijos ella es  madre soltera de dos niños los cuales tiene que velar por la educación y salud de la madre, ella vive en una pequeña casa ubicada en Quintanilla es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Karina trabaja como secretaria en el Colegio Señor de Mayo y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de mercaderías (carteras, edredones, zapatos etc.) lo que pueda vender para poder ayudar a sus hijos y a su madre que aun se encuentra enferma de diabetes que es una enfermedad de cuidado en nuestro país ella es la única hija que la apoya a su madre de 85 años de edad, sus demás hermanos se olvidaron de ella, Karina paga los gastos de la enfermedad de su madre y también de la educación de sus hijos que el menor va a kínder y el otro a tercero de primaria.
Karina es la menor de su familia y desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar y ayudar a la madre, porque el padre murió cuando trabajaba en la mina en la ciudad de Oruro y ellos tuvieron que salir adelante  y trabajar desde entonces Karina soñaba con estudiar una carrera pero no lo pudo, es por eso que ella lucha y trabaja el doble para que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y estudiar una carrera y ver que tengan un futuro mejor que el de ella darles una vida cómoda y segura ella trata de ser la mejor madre y dedicarles el poco tiempo que le queda.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar un auto para ponerlo a trabajar y pueda obtener más ingresos y darles más tiempo a sus hijos y cuidarle a su madre que siempre esta enfermita.
texts.en:
Señora Karina López is 32 years old. She is from the city of Oruro and she came to Cochabamba because of her mother who fell ill and this is why Karina had to leave her work and all of her activities. She is a single mother of two children for whom she has to ensure an education as well as the health of her mother. Karina lives in a small house located in Quintanilla a cantón of the city of Cochabamba. Karina works as a secretary in the Señor de Mayo high school and in the afternoons she sells merchandise (folders, quilts, shoes etc) whatever she can sell to be able to help her children and her mother who is sick with diabetes, which is a disease of care in our country. Karina is the only daughter that supports her 85 year old mother, her other siblings have forgotten her. Karina pays the costs of her mother's illness and also for the education of her children who are in kindergarten and third grade. Karina is the youngest of her family and has had to work since she was very young to help her mother because her father died while he was working in a mine in the city of Oruro and the family has had to get ahead and work since then. Karina dreamed of studying a career but she couldn't, and this is why she struggles and works double so that her children can finish high school and study a career, so that they can have a more comfortable and secure future. She tries to be the best mother and devotes what little time she has to them. She is seeking this credit to buy a car to use for work and earn more income, and to give her more time with her children and to care for her mother who is always sick.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es:
la sra Juana Dolores S. Z. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “JUTIAPA”
Doña juanita, como mas se le conoce en la aldea de Jutiapa, tiene 29 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, nos comento que con los ingresos que le genero su negocio crió y brindo educaciones universitarias a sus hijos.
Su clientela la prefieren  por la atención que les brinda, la higiene con que prepara los alimentos, el buen gusto que le da a las comidas, y por el precio que les da.
Doña juanita, le da la comida al crédito a (6) seis agentes de la Policía mismos que le cancelan en fin de mes.
texts.en:
Juana Dolores S. Z.'s principal activity is the sale of food, she operates her business under the name The "Jutiapa" Eatery. Doña Juanita, as she is best known as throughout Jutiapa, has 29 years of experience with this type of business. It is notable that in this time she has learned to manage it, she told us that the income generated by the business has grown and she has provided university educations for her children. Her clients prefer her for the attention that she gives, the hygienic way she prepares the food, the good tastes that she gives to the foods and for the prices. Doña Juanita gives food on credit to six police agents that they pay back at the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red meat and pork, chicken, vegetables, tortillas, drinks, butter, oil, plates, glasses and take out containers, juices, condiments, beans, sugar, rice, salsa, pasta

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes Estela

texts.en:
Mercedes is 57 years old and lives in a cement house with all the basic services in Guayaquil.  She is separated from her husband and has children that are all grown and married now.

Mercedes worked as a seamstress and saved money until she was able to open a small store in her home.  She works 7 days a week selling rice, oil, perfume, etc.  Even though she is separated, her husband still helps her run the store and she is very grateful to have the opportunity to have her own business.  Mercedes is able to buy rice for $35 and sell it for 40 cents a pound.  The perfume she buys for $30 and sells for $60.

With the loan, Mercedes is going to buy school and office supplies such as notebooks, pens, and pencils.

loans.use: Notebooks, pens, pencils, office supplies

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JORGE RUBEN J. S. Y SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA MARINA JANETH ALTAMIRANO SANDOVAL SON PERSONAS HUMILDES QUE DESDE HACE 25 AÑOS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA Y LA CRIANZA DE GANADO VACUNO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SANTA ANA LA NUEVA. MEDIANTE ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENEN A SUS DOS HIJOS  DE 18 Y 12 AÑOS.

AHORA SOLICITAN UN CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE  UN VEHICULO EL CUAL  AYUDARA AL TRANSPORTE DE LA FAMILIA DE ESA FORMA ALIVIANAR LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES  Y  LAS GRANDES DISTANCIAS QUE TIENEN QUE RECORRER PARA TRASLADARSE DE UN LUGAR A OTRO.
texts.en:
Senor Jorge Ruben J. S. and his wife, Senora Marina Janeth Altamirano Sandoval are humble people that for more than 25 years have worked in agriculture and raising cattle in the community of Santa Ana la Nueva. Through this activity they support their two children of ages 18 and 12. Now they are seeking a loan to buy a vehicle that will help them transport the family and lessen family expenses and the long distances that they have to travel to get from one place to another.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.es:
Fedelina García D. Páez,  tiene 61 años y 6 hijos, vive en el barrio villa gloria ubicado en el sur occidente D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla, que aunque algún día fue D. invasión hoy cuenta con servicios públicos y muchas líneas D. transporte.
DesD. hace un año ella misma diseña y confecciona y venD. calzado especialmente en la línea femenina, a clientes ubicados en las zona D. Urabá donD. ella entrega personalmente sus pedidos a vendedores  y tiene una colaboradora que cobra su cartera y le consigna los pagos que efectúan sus clientes y también  venD. en Barranquilla en su barrio y en zonas que lo circundan. En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor D.  $ 1.500.000  para comprar materias primas e insumos para zapatería tales como cuero, pegantes suelas e hilos, pues necesita cumplir con pedidos que han hecho sus clientes.  
Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, entidad con la que participa hace mas D. tres años, con ellos ha construido   un capital D. trabajo adicional,  para desarrollar su microempresa lo que ha traído como consecuencia el mejoramiento en la infraestructura D. su vivienda.
Ella sueña con construir un local donD. pueda fabricar sus productos y otro donD. los pueda exhibir, con relación a su meta familiar desea  el bienestar económico D. sus hijos y nietos  a través D. su educación y con el aumento D. sus ingresos provenientes del negocio. Su reto más importante es separar los espacios domésticos y productivos, pues genera dificultades familiares, por que el negocio ocupa mucho espacio y no es bueno para los niños que allí residen
texts.en:
Fedelina García D. Páez is 61 years old and has six children. She lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Gloria which is located in the south west of the city of Barranquilla. It was once a shanty town but now has public services and many bus companies. A year ago Fedelina started designing, making, and selling footwear, specializing in shoes for women. She sells them to customers who live in the Urabá area and personally delivers the orders to the people who sell the footwear. A colleague looks after the payments and bank deposits. Fedelina also sells in Barranquilla, in her own neighbourhood, and in the surrounding areas. She is now asking for a loan of $1,500 to buy materials and supplies to make footwear, such as leather, stick-on soles, and thread because she needs complete her customers’ orders. This is Fedelina’s fifth loan with Kiva parter, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to which she has belonged for more than three years. With the Foundation’s help, she built up working capital for developing the business, and as a result was able to make improvements to her house. Her dream is to build one place for making the products and another for displaying them. She also wishes for the financial wellbeing of her children and grandchildren through education, and for a greater income from her business. Her most important challenge is to separate the living quarters of the family from the workshop area because the business takes up a lot of space. This creates problems for the family and isn’t good for the children who live there.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shoe-making business

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Walter,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 30 años de edad, él socio es soltero, Nuestro socio  es un joven emprendedor y trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba desde el año 2007, el socio quiere implementar un proyecto en el área agropecuario, en realidad es un proyecto que abarcará el campo agrícola, el medio ambiente y ganadería; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para cubrir su proyecto. 

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Los Solidarios Community Bank. He lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, about one hour from the city of Cusco. He is 30 years old, single, and an enterprising young man who has worked in the municipality of Urubamba since 2007. Walter wishes to develop an agricultural project that involves farming, the environment, and cattle raising. He is asking for a loan to cover the costs of the project. He is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the costs of his agricultural project

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Victor,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 25 años de edad, él socio es conviviente, Nuestro socio  tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, el socio es chofer el tiene un carro y presta servicio en la ruta Urubamba Ollantaytambo Cusco; Nuestro socio trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia y darles una buena calidad de vida, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para costear el bautizo de su hijo, nuestro socio pagará los servicio de la iglesia, también agasajará a los invitados y le comprará un bonito terno a su hijo.  

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Victor is a member of the Los Solidarios Community Bank. He lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, about one hour from the city of Cusco. He is 25 years old, married, and has a 2-year old son. Victor drives a vehicle providing service on the Urubamba-Ollantaytambo-Cusco route. He works hard to help his family get ahead in life and give them a good standard of living. Victor is asking for a loan to pay for the cost of having his son baptized. He will pay for the church service, a celebration for the guests, and buy his son a smart suit. He is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the baptism of his young son

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal  “QOCHASAYWAS”, nuestros socios están ubicados en el distrito de San Sebastián en la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestros socios son un grupo de 13 miembros activos y muy organizados, todos ellos desempeñan diferentes labores, una de las socias tiene su restaurante, otro es guía de turismo, una enfermera, un docente, una socia teje chompas, venta de comida,  una socia cuida niños en su casa,  otra socia tiene su peluquería. La socia Livia en particular nació en la provincia de Acomayo perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, Nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende comida en un pequeño stand que es movible en el último paradero de la vía expresa en el paradero de Enaco; la socia todos los días lleva comida preparada para servir en especial a los choferes y boleteros que cubren la zona, Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para comprar insumos de restaurante y a futuro le gustaría tener uno propio.

Nuestros socios agradecen  la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Qochasaywas Communal Bank. Our members are located in the San Sebastián district in the Cusco province. Our members are a group of 13 active and very organized members. All of them do different work. One of the members has a restaurant and another is a tour guide. One is a nurse, one is a teacher, and one member knits sweaters. One sells food, one takes care of children in her house, and another member has a hair salon. One member, Livia, was born in the Acomayo province, which belongs to the Cusco department. She is in a common law marriage and has three children. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She sells food in a small mobile stand at the last stop on the express route at Enaco. Everyday she brings prepared food to serve. She especially serves the drivers and ticket sellers who cover the area. She wants the loan to buy restaurant supplies. In the future she would like to have one of her own. Our members are grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and they promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy restaurant supplies; in the future she would like to have her own

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Marlene ,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia trabaja en una tienda de producción y venta de cerámicas, la socia realiza trabajos de pulido y pintado en las cerámicas, hacen desde utensilios del hogar hasta adornos decorativos, como floreros, vasijas, cuadros, y todo tipo de trabajos, Nuestra socia desea comprar un moto taxi para ponerlo al servicio público, solicita el préstamo para aumentar al capital que tiene destinado para la compra de este vehículo.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our partner, Marlene, belongs to the Solidarity (Los Solidarios) village bank and lives in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco; about 1 hour from the city of Cusco. She is 30 years old, lives with her significant other, and has a 5 year old son. She balances her household duties with her work in retail. She works in a shop that produces and sells ceramics; her main job is polishing and painting the ceramics. They make anything from kitchen utensils to decorative items like flowerpots, vases, frames, etc. She would like to buy a moto-taxi to put in service so she is requesting a loan to increase the amount of money she has already saved to buy the moto-taxi. She is very grateful for the opportunity she is being offered and commits to punctually pay each of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase a moto-taxi

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: La señora Concepción C. tiene un negocio de elaboración de pan situado en Catarina, ella tiene de experiencia cincuenta y siete años, lleva con este dos créditos con CEPRODEL el cual le ha ayudado para tener mas inventario y por ende mas ganancia porque así no compra la materia prima al crédito, también le ayudara en su hogar y tener un nivel de vida moderado.
texts.en:
Concepción C. has a bread making business, which is located in Catarina. She has 57 years of experience. She has had two loans with Ceprodel. The loans have helped her to have more inventory, and this gave her more income. This way she does not have to buy the raw materials on credit. The loan will also help her to have modest living conditions in her home .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, margarine, firewood, and cheese

loans.name: Nicolás Leonel

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca  Palo grande el señor Nicolás M. M. se dedica a la producción de ganado bobino, actividad que en su mayoría de vida a suplido las necesidades básicas de su familia, el señor Nicolás M. se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida ha estas actividades, el señor Leonel M. trabaja de 6 a 3 de la tarde todo los días de la semana, tiene tres hijos los cuales dependen de el y de su esposa, el crédito será empleado para compra de alambre para mejorar las cercas de su finca, las que a su vez le aseguran la seguridad  de su ganado y bienestar social.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Palo Grande district, Mr. Nicolás dedicates himself to the production of cattle, an activity that supplies the basic necessities for his family. Nicolás has dedicated most of his life to these activities, working from 6:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon, every day of the week. He has 3 children who depend on him and his wife. The loan will be used to buy fencing wire, to improve the fences on his ranch, which will in turn, assure the security of his cattle and the social welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WIRE FOR FENCING IN HIS CATTLE

loans.name: Yuviza

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Yuviza ,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 21 años de edad, nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia es natural de Urubamba, ella trabaja vendiendo verduras, la socia compra al por mayor y las lleva a vender al mercado de Urubamba, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar verduras al por mayor y venderlas, en su stand en el mercado central.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our partner, Yuviza, belongs to the Solidarity (Los Solidarios) village bank and lives in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, one hour from the city of Cusco. She is 21 years old, lives with her significant other and has a 2 year old son. She balances her household responsibilities with her work in retail. She is an Urubamba native where she works selling vegetables. She buys them wholesale then takes them to the Urubamba market to sell. She is requesting the loan to be able to buy more vegetables on the wholesale market and sell them in her stand in the central market. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and commits to punctually pay all of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables wholesale to sell in her stand

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca nombre de Jesús, el señor Otilio C. se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino para la mantención de sus dos hijas y su esposa también se dedica al establecimiento de cultivos anuales dentro de los cuales figuran el maíz, frijoles y sorgo, el señor Otilio C.  ha dedicado la mayor parte  de su vida a estas actividades las que le ha brindado el bienestar familiar y su progreso, el realiza sus actividades de 6 a 3 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
El crédito será empleado para la compra de una vaca parida con la cual pretende mejorar aun más su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Nombre de Jesús (Name of Jesus) district, Mr. Otilio raises cattle and hogs to maintain his 2 daughters and his wife. He also plants crops each year, including corn, beans, and sorghum. Otilio has spent the better part of his life engaged in these activities, which have provided for the wellbeing of his family and for his progress. He works from 6:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon every day of the week. The loan will be used to buy a cow that recently delivered a calf.
