Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase new stock to sell

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
Nerma Z. is a loving mother and is filled with dreams for her two children (10 and 14 years old). One of her dreams is that they will graduate from college. However, as her children are still in elementary and secondary school, she wants to have enough money to build their own house. With hope and determination to achieve these dreams, Nerma joined ASHI and is requesting a loan which she will use to start a hog/pig fattening business.

Hog/pig fattening is the most convenient business Nerma can undertake while she stays at home looking after her children and attending to household chores.  Hogs that she fattens will be sold after four months, either live or slaughtered.  She can then have her own source of income to augment her husband’s. With the two of them working hard to grow their business and with the generosity of Kiva lenders all over the world, Nerma is optimistic that she will realize her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase hogs/pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Khudayberdieva Asalhan`s Group

texts.en: Asalhan is the founder of this group. She actively participates in the local community. Although she is a 63 years old, she still works as a teacher in the village school. All three of her children work in Russia. They send about USD120 per month to their parents. Apart from this, they fatten cattle at home and sell milk products. This loan will be used for three things: to buy a calf to send to pasture, to buy seed potatoes and to repair her house. Salamat is 49 years old. She and her husband are farmers. They have their own land where they grow rice, cotton and potatoes. She also sells milk and eggs in the local market. Her two sons work in Russia and regularly send money to support their parents. The loan will be used to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. A. Jypargul, 35, is married with three school-aged children. She works with her husband. Last autumn they sowed winter wheat. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer for wheat. She also has one milk cow. She has been working in this business since 2005. Burul is the treasurer of this group. She is responsible for paying back the loan on time. She collects the money from the other group members and comes to the MBF office. She is married with 3 sons and 1 daughter. The eldest son is 28 years old and the only daughter is 18. They have land where they raise vegetables. In the future she wants to increase her livestock and build a suitable yard for her animals. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of tje 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please click here. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf and seed potatoes

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng H. lives in Rean Thma village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Bu Sophat, are farmers who own 3-hectares where they earn a living by cultivating rice. They have seven children. One is a driver, one is a laborer in a gas station and the others are attending the local school. Although the family works hard, they still earn a small income. Therefore, Mrs. Eng H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a cow breeding business. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: K. Shavkat is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has a little kid and a wife whom he supports. Shavkat wishes to develop his cattle-raising business in response to the very high demand for milk from villagers and, in particular, from customers who come from the more built-up towns. Shavkat wants to expand his business to improve his living conditions. We hope that the combination of his capabilities and the services provided by IMON International will help him to improve his business. ------More about Tajikistan and IMON International--------- Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: to purchasing cattle to raise

loans.name: Munirjon

texts.en: Munirjon M. is married with three children. Munirjon is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 13 years. During that time he has become very popular at the market and has many clients. The secret of his success is simple: He tries to not only let his customers know the benefits of his products – he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is at with his venture. Munirjon is seeking a loan of $3,000 to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Munirjon's desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing clothing for selling

loans.name: Mr. Lun You Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This loan is a village bank loan, which consists of 14 borrowers who are located in Rean Thma village in Kandal province.  They all will use the loan, but each will use their money for different purposes.

Mr. Lun Y. is the village bank's president who has been selected by the bank's members. His wife, Mrs. Pot Samang, is a Chinese noodle seller. Mr. Lun Y. is the father of a child who is a garment worker.

Mr. Lun Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land one which he cultivates rice to make a living.  Since his rice farming is far from an irrigation system, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump so he can irrigate his crop.

loans.use: To buy a water pump with which to irrigate a rice field.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down to him from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Odiljon hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for 10 years, Rustam was born in 1976 in Djabbar Rasulov region. He is married and responsible for three people including his wife and two children.

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from more than 20 km from his village.

With this goal in mind, Rustam is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 25 years old and is married with one child who is one year and seven months of age. Francoise lives in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Francoise owns a small business selling various products such as handbags, clothes and shoes. She works hard, as does her husband who is driver, in order to provide all the needs of their family. Francoise has been an entrepreneur since 2007. The hours of her business are from seven in the morning to six in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Francoise is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive handbags, clothes and shoe styles for sale. With this loan she will be able to obtain more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy additional handbags, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Mahamatrasul

texts.en: Since 1999, Mahamatrasul has been a livestock farmer. He raises calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has two children to support and give a proper education. Mahamatrasul has improved his financial situation by wisely using the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer dairy products in his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Chheng Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan, all of whom are villagers in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chheng K. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Chheng K. is a mother of four children, two of whom are construction laborers while the others attend a local public school. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to grow rice and crops to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chory, is a construction worker. On her the farm, Mrs. Chheng K. has some problems because her field is infertile and is also far from an irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. With the rest of the loan, she wants to hire farmers to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to hire someone to plow her field

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya is 33 years old and the mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser since 1999. Over the years, thanks to her business income, she has been able to support her family with her husband, and she has a good number of clients who like her work. 

Today, Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to add new decor and renovate her shop, in addition to buying more tools needed order to attract more clients and increase her income.

loans.use: Add new decor, renovate her shop and add tools that will attract more clients

loans.name: Nizamuhamad

texts.en:
O. Nizamuhamad is a young, married man who breeds calves in a small village in the Djabbar Rasulov area of Sugd region. He is full of energy, and every single day he tries to make his family's life better. He started his business 12 years ago, continuing the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Nizamuhamad has a wealth of experience in cattle breeding because he has observed it since childhood. He would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's standard of living. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Galibat

texts.fr: A. Y. Galibat est née le 20 novembre 1965.  Il y a six ans que Galibat s’est installée au quartier Sodjèatinme à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Galibat est mariée à JONHSON Edouard et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Galibat vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Galibat a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Galibat vend des valises et des sacs de voyage à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Galibat a huit ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne au Ghana, pays voisin du Bénin. Galibat a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé.  Galibat sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité et multiplier son profit.
texts.en:
Galibat Akangba Y. was born November 20 1965. For the last six years she has lived in the Sodjèatinme neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is married to Edouard Jonhson, and has three children, all of them educated, and lives with her husband and children. Together, she and her husband take care of household expenses. She left school after the secondary course. To meet her needs, she sells suitcases and travel bags at Dantokpa, Bénin's international marketplace. She has eight years' experience in this field. She buys her merchandise in Ghana, a neighboring country. She has fully repaid one loan from ALIDé. She has applied for a second loan to grow her business and increase her profit.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of suitcases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Seoun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of twelve members who live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chanthy S. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sovan Chhoeurn, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops for supporting their family. However hard this family tries to work, they cannot earn enough income because their field has infertile soil. 

Thus, in order to improve their crop production, Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, and with the rest of the loan she would like to buy corn seed. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a farmer, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and corn seed

loans.name: Ismatillo

texts.en:
O. Ismatillo is a 56-year-old married man who lives with his daughter and owns a small farm. Ismatillo is a schoolteacher by profession and since he earns little, he also runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has fifteen years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is profitable, Ismatillo has become a very successful businessman.

Ismatillo has a friendly family which is always trying to help one another. Thus, his wife and daughter help him with his cattle raising business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. 

Now Ismatillo wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of $1500. He promises to repay the loan in time and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Ismatillo can get ahead.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31 year old married man with one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past 10 years. He owns a taxi van to transport a larger number of clients. He services his town and its surroundings. He works upon the request of his customers for private transportation.

Today Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his van after being in bad circumstances so he can apply himself towards always meeting the demands of his clients and present a comfortable service for them.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for his van

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 55 years of age, married, and has seven children between the ages of 16 and 38. Three of her children go to school. The rest are working small jobs in Kampala city. 

The family owns and lives in a four-room house where Asiya stays with four people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Asiya's greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children and grand children, medication, feeding the family and rent.

Asiya sells yellow bananas and roasted bananas in Kitawuluzi. She buys bananas from Owino market and so incurs little transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of forty customers a day. Asiya has operated this business for over thirty years. Her main challenges are defaulters and the rainy season, because she works from a very open place and on a retail basis only. She sells to all categories of people.

She has been with MCDT for over nine years, now servicing her eighteenth loan and working all this time with the same group mates. Asiya wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and a charcoal stove. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and would like to own a dairy in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and a charcoal stove

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
R. Sharifa is 49 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married and has three children.

This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for kids: jackets, sweaters, jeans and so on. Sharifa started her business thirteen years ago. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and, thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Sharifa needs a loan of $1100 which she will use to buy clothing for the spring season to meet the demands of her clients and to continue growing her business. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve this family's quality of life.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spring clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr: S. Chantale est née vers 1980 à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, mais habite depuis 12 ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à DOHUIN Clément, un chauffeur, Chantale est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Chantale vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Chantale n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Il y a quatre ans, Chantale s’est mise dans la vente de la nourriture (pâte rouge et viande), de façon ambulante au Parc MIVVO, dans la commune de Sèmè-kpoji. Chantale mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de thé, des boissons, et du charbon. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Chantale s’approvisionne.  Chantale est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés.  Chantale sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle.  Chantale ambitionne plus tard avoir une place pour pouvoir vendre ses marchandises au lieu de se promener sous le soleil.
texts.en:
Chantale S. was born round 1980 in Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin, but has been living for the past 12 years in the Sègbèya area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Clément DOHUIN, a driver, Chantale is mother of two children, both attending school. Chantal lives with her husband and children, and the couple share family expenses. Chantale has never been to school. Four years ago, she began selling food - red paste (cornmeal-based) and meat - as an itinerant vendor in Mivvo Park, in the Sèmè-Podji area. As a side business, she retails tea, beverages, and coal. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Chantale is a regular client of ALIDé, having been granted three previous loans, all repaid in full. She is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her business and increase her customer base. Her ambition for the future is to have a stall where she can display her products without having to walk around in the sun.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, gari (processed cassava root) and condiments

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi has owned a car repair shop in his village since 2004 and he has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years. He's 23 years old, single and living with his parents.

With his business income, he helps his father in the household; they support each other as a family to provide better living conditions.  He repairs all types of cars and that’s why he attracts more clients to his shop.

Today Chadi is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more spare parts and tools to meet his customers’ needs and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and tools

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is 44 years old and owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She has two children. The eldest is only ten years old and is studying in the elementary grades. Jocelyn started selling a variety of goods in 1995, and the income she earns helps a lot in paying their daily expenses. 

She hopes to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchnadise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
S. Muzaffar is 40 years old. He is married and has three children of school age. His wife is a teacher in a secondary school. 

Muzaffar manufactures national cradles. National cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. As a rule, the national cradle is presented by the grandparents when the baby is forty days old, and this event is celebrated by the entire family. 

Muzaffar has been in this business for seventeen years. His wife helps him. The completed cradles are purchased from their house. The stability of the business allows a steady income which ensures that the family has the possibility of improving their living conditions.

Muzaffar has been working with IMON for four years. For the entire period of time he has shown himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Muzaffar requests a loan in the amount of $1500 in order to purchase more planks and paints for producing more cradles. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase planks and paints for making cradles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prepare and sell cornmeal mush

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Z. Naimjon is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. After he finished his education he started to work with his mother. They have a trade business and sell jeans wear. Two years ago he decided to do the same business alone and opened clothing shop on one of the main market of Khujand. Although he has his own business now Naimjon still continues to help his mother in her business in supplying and delivering. To enlarge the range of clothes that he sells Naimjon wants to supply some sporting clothes and needs a loan of $1500 USD. Naimjon is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional timbers for sale

loans.name: Nematdjon

texts.en:
F. Nematdjon is 25 years old. He is married but has no children yet. For more than five years Nematdjon has been running his joiner’s shop, manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. This business is quite profitable and generates a stable income allowing him to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Nematdjon is respected as a good leader in his neighborhood. Now he needs to purchase more raw materials for his manufacturing shop. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $1500. This is his first loan from IMON. He promises to repay his loan on time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for his manufacturing needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make and sell cakes and fritters

loans.name: Fatullo

texts.en:
Fatullo is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. 

Fatullo works in the central city market selling blankets, towels and tablecloths. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for fifteen years. Fatullo likes working for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. 

Today Fatullo would like to ask for a loan of $1500 to purchase new goods for selling. We believe his drive for success will help him succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Fatullo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, towels and tablecloths for selling.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 36 years old and is married with one child who is one-and-a-half years of age. Jean Claude and his family live in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Gatsata.

Jean Claude owns a small business selling timber and has been in business since 2008. This business is profitable for him simply because everyone in the town who needs to build has to use timber. His business is very organized and he employs five people from his community so that his business runs well.

Jean claude is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more timber for sale. With this loan he hopes to obtain more profits through selling more timbers every day from seven in the morning to nine in evening.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Barohat

texts.en:
R. Barohat is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. Barohat is a woman determined to search for the best things in life and to offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities. She is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this six years ago, when she moved to settle in her home town. 

Barohat devoted herself to selling blankets, towels and tablecloths, and now she is satisfied because her business provides her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary education for her four young children.

Today she is requesting your help in getting a loan of $1500 to add new stock to her merchandise. Your support means a great deal to Barohat. Please offer her your help.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Stock and sell hot peppers

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: R. Bakhtiyor is 36 years old. Together with his wife, they have 3 children. Bakhtiyor is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 8 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Bakhtiyor is selling the majority of his products just from his home. However, he is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the ”lepeshka”. Now Bakhtiyor requests 4,000 Somoni. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale as required for his business. Bakhtiyor is grateful to all for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock wheat flour and other ingredients to prepare fritters

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.en: Ozodjon is 26 years old, married and has a little kid. He is a farmer and grows potatoes, carrots and wheat, something he has done for 6 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Ozodjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Ozodjon raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds and fertilizer in order to grow grains. This is the first loan by Ozodjon from IMON International and Kiva and he promises that he will not let you down. loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sèmawon

texts.fr: A. Sèmawon est née vers 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a sept ans que Sèmawon s’est installée au quartier Dandji à Cotonou.  Sèmawon est mariée et mère de deux enfants.  Sèmawon n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Sèmawon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Sèmawon vend des produits divers (conserves de tomate et de sardine, riz, pâtes alimentaires, œufs).  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sèmawon s’approvisionne et vend ses produits.  Sèmawon a 15 ans d’expérience de ce domaine et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.  Elle a bien remboursé le premier crédit et en sollicite un autre pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Sèmawon A. was born around 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She settled seven years ago in the Dandji area of Cotonou. Sèmawon is married and mother of two children. She has never attended school herself but all her children have had schooling. Sèmawon lives with her children and her husband, with whom she shares responsibility for family expenses. To meet her needs, Sèmawon sells various food products (canned tomatoes, sardines, rice, pasta, eggs). She gets her supplies and sells her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Sèmawon has 15 years’ experience with this activity and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she duly reimbursed. She is now requesting a second loan to strengthen her business and generate more profit.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and the mother of 4 children. She and her husband produce fruits and vegetables. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Fatima needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for producing of her fruits. The goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Fatima doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Kasiyet Kalmuratova's Group

texts.en:
K. Kasiyet is 46 years old, and has four children – three sons and one daughter. Her two eldest sons are builders and her third son is disabled and usually helps her in agriculture. Her husband works in a local school as a security guard. Kasiyet has a business selling food. Prior to starting her business, she worked in Moscow for five years. Soon after her return to her village, she commenced this business. She started with just 20K KGS and now her turnover is about 150K KGS. Kasiyet has much experience of working with loans as although this is her first loan with Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance, she has previously received loans from other MFIs. This loan will be used to buy 180 kilos of sugar. In the near future, she plans to open a second outlet.
Santalathon, 46, is married with three children. Her husband and only son are working in Russia, and send about $100 almost every month. She fattens cattle and sells them later at the local market. She will use her loan to buy five sheep. She has some free time and wants to spend it most effectively, so that is why soon she will open a little food kiosk near her house.
Mashraphon is a mother of two sons. She lives with her husband and children in a big village near Osh city. Her husband is a security guard at Manas school, and he also uses his car to provide passenger transportation services. All the family members look after the animals at home. They have a very good yard in which they fatten cattle and sheep. Mashraphon's loan will be used to buy sheep.
K. Elmira is 45 years old and a mother of two sons. She will use her loan to start up a new business selling sunflower oil. Her friend has a trade outlet, which she will rent. Elmira is going to spend a lot of her time improving and stabilizing her business.
Jangybek is the only male member of this group and this is his first ever loan. Previously he worked for a few years in Russia. Most of the money that he sent home was saved by his wife to start up their own livestock business, so there will be no need for Jangybek to work abroad again. Now he is asking for a loan to buy two more calves to fatten, thereby earning more income.

loans.use: To buy 180 kilos of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida A. is a married mother of six children. Her husband is a carpenter in the community while she manages her own sewing business to provide additional income for the family.
Ma. Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been in business for almost four years. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost four years, she has performed very well in her attendance at center meetings, her steady repayment of loans, and the ongoing nature of her business. Therefore, she has qualified to obtain larger loans.
Now on her fourth loan, Ma. Loida is requesting 20,000 PHP to expand her business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase inventory of cotton, threads, and other supplies, and the remaining money will be used to maintain her sewing machine.
Ma. Loida still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During her time in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true.

About ASHI
Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to people at the bottom/the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase cotton, threads, and other supplies, and to maintain her sewing machine
